name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Reebok Engine A does not disappoint. If you can get the fit right, the performance feels fantastic.

name: MARKCHES
description: Kudos to Reebok for moving in the right direction with the Engine A. I like the comfort, and the traction plays well on clean courts.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Reebok Engine A is a solid performer, especially for a comeback model. I like the cushioning, and the traction is consistent.

name: TommyLiu
description: I like the performance of the Jordan Luka 4. It has the best cushioning and traction in his signature line.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Jordan Luka 4 feels more refined than the Luka 3. I appreciate the tweaks and upgrades to the support and cushioning.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan Luka 4 is a solid shoe, but doesn't have the best tech. The traction performs well on clean courts, and the support is secure.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan Luka 4 is the best signature shoe in the line. The traction and support are impressive, but I wish the Zoom Air bag felt better.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Jordan Luka 4 is the best shoe in his line. It's a reliable and comfortable performer. The playability is good thanks to the weight, cushioning, and fit.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: There are plenty of upgrades and improvements to the Jordan Luka 4, but the support takes a step back.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan Luka 4 is a responsive, low-to-the-ground performance shoe. The cushioning feels comfortable, and I like the snug fit.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: If you liked the Luka 1, you're going to like the Luka 4. It offers decent cushioning, with the stability of the original.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta KAI 2 is a well-balanced shoe with very few faults. I always felt confident with the traction, and the cushioning is very bouncy.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Anta KAI 2 is one of my favourite shoes of the year. The cushioning is impressive, the materials work well, and I like the support.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: I enjoy playing in the Anta KAI 2. I like the traction, cushioning, and fit.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Anta KAI 2 truly feels like a Kyrie shoe. It's responsive and has impressive cushioning, but lacks cushioning.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I love the Way of Wade 808 5 Ultra. Li-Ning stepped up and improved an already good shoe. This shoe has my favourite drop-in midsole ever.

name: The Sole Drop
description: This shoe is extremely lightweight, has phenomenal traction, and outstanding cushioning.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Way of Wade 808 5 Ultra offers insane performance at its price point. The traction is the standout feature, but the cushioning is also impressive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 808 5 Ultra is a lively shoe. The bounce is incredible, and the traction is also top-notch.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Way of Wade 808 5 Ultra is lighter, breathable, and bouncier. It's an all-around upgrade and one of the best performers available.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 808 5 Ultra is worth the money. The drop-in midsole feels crazy and is one of the best available.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Way of Wade 808 5 Ultra is a solid performer after an initial break-in period. I like the traction and cushioning performance. It's lightweight and fast.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Zion 4 provides decent value for the price. The shape and fit are downsides, but the traction is reliable and the cushioning is comfortable.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The price point is awesome for what you're getting from the Jordan Zion 4. I love the cushioning setup and the support feels great.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I like playing in the Jordan Zion 4 but it's not my type of shoe. I prefer something more fluid. The cushioning feels nice though.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I can recommend the Zion 4 for people with narrow feet. It's bouncy, quick, and fun to play in.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Jordan Zion 4 is a slightly below-average performer. It doesn't work for my feet, but I like the cushioning setup.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan Zion 4 is not it for me. My main issue is the heel slippage, but the traction was also lacking.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan Zion 4 is more spacious and smoother, but the traction and materials are a letdown.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I can recommend the Nike KD 18. The traction performs well, but the cushioning could be better.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The KD 18 feels like a slightly better version of the KD 17. The traction is better, but the cushioning feels the same.

name: RicheeKim
description: Nike didn't change much on the KD 18, but it's a solid performer. I like the improvements to the materials and the support.

name: TommyLiu
description: I enjoy the Nike KD 18. There are no gimmicks. The traction and cushioning get the job done, and I like the extra structure of the midfoot caging.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: I like the Nike KD 18. It's more comfy but also slightly more clunky. There's not much difference from the KD 17.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike KD 18 feels similar to the 17. I'm not a fan of the shank plate, but the shoe's overall performance is decent.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I thoroughly enjoyed playing in the Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus. The only downsides are the shoe's short length and restrictive heel. Everything else performed exceptionally well.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus is a good basketball shoe, but not at the retail price. The traction is consistent, and the support and fit feel secure. I wish they kept the heel Zoom bag, though.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus is a weird basketball shoe. The cushioning takes a step back, but the traction plays well, and I like the fit.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus has consistent traction with plenty of rigid containment.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus is a good shoe. My only issue was some sliding with the traction on dirty courts. Everything else performs well.

name: TommyLiu
description: I didn't like the Nike LeBron NXXT Genisus much. I prefer the previous iteration because of its better traction performance and upper.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 Turbo is a fantastic performer. It has a high price tag, but I love the traction and upgraded support.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Turbo is a much different shoe than the original. Lockdown and containment feel better, and I still love the cushioning.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I recommend the Nike G.T. Cut 3 Turbo for anyone who enjoys the original but wants a more stable experience.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 Turbo has improved support and lockdown, but the increased price is not worth it.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The 361 Joker 1 feels very plush and comfortable without sacrificing much performance.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The 361 Joker 1 feels like a guard shoe. The traction is reliable, the court feel is responsive, and the well-balanced cushioning does everything well.

name: TommyLiu
description: The 361 Joker 1 is a banger. It's traction and cushioning are elite.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The 361 Joker 1 is a superb performance basketball shoe. I love the material usage, and the traction and cushioning are excellent.

name: RicheeKim
description: The 361 Joker 1 offers a lot of quality and performance for the price. I love the well-balanced cushioning. The only downside is the traction performance on dust.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: I love playing in the Adidas Harden Volume 9, and the improvements to the fit and support are welcomed.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 9 is much more nimble than it looks. The cushioning is springy, and the upper construction is impressive for stability.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Adidas Volume Harden 9 might be Harden's best signature shoe. The fit, support, and cushioning are all outstanding.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 9 is a solid performance model suited for all positions. I like the cushioning and support aspects of the shoe the most.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Harden Volume 9 is an A-tier performer, thanks to its excellent cushioning, secure support, and decent traction.

name: MARKCHES
description: I like the Adidas Harden Volume 9. It feels lighter than the last model, and the cushioning is springy. My main gripe is the dust pickup on the outsole.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 9 offers an incredible combination of bounce and stability. I like what Adidas did with this setup.

name: DG Hoops
description: I like the Adidas Harden Volume 9. The performance is consistent with the previous two models.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 9 is a good performance shoe but doesn't do enough to differentiate itself from its predecessor.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Harden Vol 9 has excellent cushioning and traction. It could be better with a more refined fit.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I didn't enjoy playing in the Adidas Harden Volume 9 because of its poor traction performance and clunky heel section. However, the support and cushioning are solid.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I like the Puma Scoot Zero 2 much more than last year's shoe. The price point is excellent, and I love the traction performance.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Puma Scoot Zeros 2 surpassed my expectations. The traction and support excel and make the shoe fun.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma Scoot Zeros 2 provides a lot of confidence when moving side to side and changing directions. I like the implementation of the traction and midsole.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Puma Scoot Zeros 2 is a solid pickup for the price. There are better shoes but the traction and support are decent.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Rigorer AR 2 is an excellent shoe for players who move a lot on the court. Thanks to its cushioning, it feels light on the bottom and well-protected.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I think the Rigorer AR 2 is a fun basketball shoe. I love the upgraded cushioning and the secure fit and support.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Rigorer AR 2 feels like a steal for the price. The cushioning is an upgrade, and the support and traction also perform very well.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Rigorer AR 2 feels quick and responsive. I like how it feels like a guard shoe with comfortable cushioning.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Rigorer AR 2 performs a lot better than expected. I like the upgraded cushioning and the shoe feels more locked down.

name: TommyLiu
description: I was not a fan of the AR 1, but I enjoy the Rigorer AR 2. The traction is excellent, and the upgraded cushioning is fantastic.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Rigorer AR 2 is an upgrade from the AR 1. The main improvement is the cushioning, which is softer and bouncier.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Rigorer AR 2 is a significant upgrade over its predecessor. It's a well-rounded shoe with excellent traction and responsive cushioning. The support and build also hold up well.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I like the Curry Fox 1 better than the signature Curry 12. The added shank makes the midsole cushioning feel more lively.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love the look of the Curry Fox 1, and the performance is similar to any other Curry or Under Armour shoe that features Flow foam. The traction excels on clean courts and the cushioning is adequate.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry Fox 1 is a solid performer in its price range. It's a good pickup if you play on mostly clean courts.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Curry Fox 1 is a decent low-top guard shoe. It's nothing special, and its performance features are mostly average.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Dame Certified 3 is a durable, stable-feeling shoe that can deal with an orthotic well.

name: TommyLiu
description: If you like an affordable and usable performance shoe, the Adidas Dame Certified 3 is a solid pick. The traction and cushioning were decent for me.

name: RicheeKim
description: I can't recommend the Adidas Dame Certified 3 because of the heel slippage and traction on dust. I do like the Bounce foam and fit though.

name: The Sole Drop
description: Do not get the Adidas Dame Certified 3. I can't recommend it. The full-length Bounce is soft but I had issues with the traction and heel slippage.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 13 is a performance beast. I'll keep this pair in my bag for the foreseeable future.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Way of Wade All City 13 is one of the best playing shoes I ever put on. They do everything well and there are no glaring issues.

name: The Sole Drop
description: This shoe feels minimal, responsive, and comfortable. It's almost the perfect guard shoe.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Way of Wade All City 13 is already one of the best shoes available. The traction and cushioning are both excellent, and the fit feels better.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Way of Wade All City 13 is an excellent performer. I would put the shoe in the A or S tier. It's firm on the outside and comfy on the inside.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 13 might be my favourite Wade shoe. It's an all-around beast of a performer.

name: MARKCHES
description: The All City 13 is a very dependable shoe. The traction and cushioning always played well.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Way of Wade Shadow 6 is fantastic for getting up and down the court. The shank and midsole foam also provide a lot of snap and pop.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Way of Wade Shadow 6 performed beyond my expectations. The shoe offers insane value for the price, particularly with cushioning.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Shadow 6 is a top-tier budget performer. The traction and cushioning are outstanding at this price.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Way of Wade Shadow 6 is a well-cushioned shoe with great traction performance.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Way of Wade Shadow 6 is a great shoe at a great price. I don't care for the materials but the traction, cushioning, and support are top-tier.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Way of Wade Shadow 6 is an impressive shoe for the money. Its cushioning and traction are more than worth the price.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta KT 10 is the best basketball shoe of 2024. It's an elite, versatile, well-rounded performer with little to no flaws.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The KT 10 is awesome. It's nearly pitch-perfect. I love the stopping power and outsole flange.

name: TommyLiu
description: I would place the Anta KT 10 in the S-tier of basketball shoes. It's an elite shoe with fantastic cushioning and traction.

name: MARKCHES
description: Anta made minor adjustments to the KT 10, which made a big difference. The cushioning and support are impressive.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love the cushioning and stability of the Anta KT 10, but the traction on dusty courts made me feel unsafe.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Everything about the Tatum 3 is decent. Some aspects could be better like the traction, but it works well overall.

name: RicheeKim
description: I can't recommend the Jordan Tatum 3. The containment issues and dust pick-up turned me away. I do like the comfortable cushioning.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Tatum 3 is Jayson Tatum's best signature sneaker so far. The cushioning and traction perform well.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: This is the best Tatum shoe to drop so far. It's nice to see a brand slowly improve.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I recommend waiting for a sale before getting the Jordan Tatum 3. It's the best shoe in the lineup because of the traction. The cushioning could be better and the support is decent.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan Tatum is smoother than previous models. The outsole composition is better and I like the material usage.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: When the Tatum 3 grips, it offers light, quick pop and performance. The problem is the shoe is inconsistent.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan Tatum 3 let me down. I can't recommend it because of the inconsistent traction and the lack of support.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron 22 has excellent traction and cushioning. The support also feels good. The main con is the weight, but the shoe feels great despite being heavier.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike LeBron 22 is a very nice performer. The biggest downfall is traction on dirty floors, but the cushioning and support are awesome.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I enjoy playing in the Nike LeBron 22, especially on clean courts. The cushioning is outstanding, the fit feels great, and the support and lockdown contain me well.

name: RicheeKim
description: I really enjoy the Nike LeBron 22. My only issue is the dust pickup on the traction. All of the other features are outstanding.

name: TommyLiu
description: I would say the Nike LeBron 22 took a step back. It feels slower and heavier. However, the traction and cushioning still feel good.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 22 isn't much improved in performance compared to the LeBron 21. It's still an impressive and dependable shoe with improved materials.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike LeBron 22 is a solid performance shoe for heavier players, thanks to its excellent stability and cushioning.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Despite all the tech, the Nike LeBron 22 feels mid to me. Traction and support are solid, but I'm not a fan of the materials and comfort.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike Ja 2. It's Kobe-esque, but there are other better-cushioned options available. The traction plays well, and I like the snug fit.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Ja 2 is one of the most practical, no-BS Nike shoes. The shoe's strengths are traction, weight, and agility.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The outsole traction performance makes the Nike Ja 2 a fun shoe. The downside is this shoe feels too similar to the Sabrina 2.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike Ja 2 is a good basketball shoe. I enjoyed the traction performance. The shoe is best for lightweight and shifty players.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I like the Nike Ja 2 slightly more than the Ja 1. The outsole is grippy and the cushioning feels a bit better. Like all Nike basketball shoes lately, this reminds me of Kobe shoes.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Ja 2 is a lightweight performance shoe with awesome traction. However, the impact protection is lacking.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Ja 2 is a solid performer with decent traction and cushioning.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I prefer the Nike Ja 1 because of the fit, but the Ja 2 provides a softer, minimal upper. The comfort feels decent, and the traction performs well.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike Ja 2 feels like a generic and basic Nike sneaker. The traction plays well and is the best feature.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: There are two main changes to the Nike Ja 2. It feels less supportive, but the materials are better. The traction remains a strong point.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Puma MB.04 is the best-fitting shoe in LaMelo Ball's line. However, the rest of the performance feels like last year's model. I like the traction and support.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma MB.04 is surprisingly nimble for a maximalist shoe. It feels slightly more stable and the grip plays well.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Puma MB.04 is a solid shoe for the price. My main complaints are the bulk and the design. I like the traction and impact protection, though.

name: TommyLiu
description: Hopefully, Puma can improve next time because the MB.04 is an inconsistent performer. Dust heavily affects the traction, and the support is lacking.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I'm unsure what direction Puma is taking the MB.04. It's comfortable and cozy, but the traction and fit could be better.

name: PureKicks
description: The outdoor durability is the only knock on the Nike Kobe 9 Elite Low Protro. It has the best traction, and I like the materials and support.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Kobe 9 Elite Low Protro breaks in extremely nicely. The traction and cushioning are very enjoyable to play in. My main complaint is the narrow fit.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kobe 9 Elite Low Protro is the same as the original but with a new drop-in midsole. The traction is elite and the cushioning feels better.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Nike Kobe 9 Protro feels close to the original in performance. I like this setup better than the Kobe 8 Protro.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Kobe 9 Elite Low Protro feels great when they're gripping. The cushioning is bouncy, and the traction is outstanding on clean courts.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta Shock Wave 6 provides incredible responsiveness and push-off power. The cushioning is snappy and the traction's stopping power is fantastic.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Anta Shock Wave 6 feels lightweight, minimal, and responsive. I felt quick when playing in this shoe.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Anta Shock Wave 6 is nothing special but has no downsides. All of the features work well. This feels like Anta's take on a Nike Kyrie Low.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Anta Shock Wave 6 is a low-to-the-ground and responsive performer. The shoe is lightweight and responsive but lacks impact protection.

name: RicheeKim
description: The New Balance Hesi Low V2 is an impressive shoe for the price. The traction, materials, and cushioning are all solid. This shoe is a definite improvement from the V1.

name: TommyLiu
description: The New Balance Hesi Low V2 is one of the best affordable performers of the year. It hits a solid price point, has excellent traction, and has impressive cushioning.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The New Balance Hesi Low V2 is a minimal shoe with soft and comfortable cushioning. I enjoyed playing in this shoe thanks to the traction.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The New Balance Hesi Low V2 is underrated. The traction performance is fantastic, and I like how light and fast the setup feels.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance Hesi Low V2 offers plenty of performance for your money. It's low to the ground, and the grip is solid. I like how streamlined the setup feels.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas Dame 9 might be the best Adidas shoe this year. This is an excellent performer. The traction is top-tier, and the cushioning is very comfortable.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Dame 9 is a solid performer. It performs very well on clean courts, and the cushioning feels impressive. My only issue was with the dust performance.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Adidas Dame 9 offers excellent value for money. Its traction, cushioning, fit, and materials make it a superb basketball shoe.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Adidas Dame 9 is one hell of a performer. I love the cushioning and the support features.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Dame 9 feels buttery and quick. It allows extra freedom while maintaining the containment.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: Adidas came through with the Dame 9. I enjoyed the traction and fit; the cushioning also feels plush and comfortable.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Adidas Dame 9 is a solid performer because of its traction and support. My only complaint is the flat heel-to-toe transition.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Adidas Dame 9 feels premium without needing premium materials. I'm a big fan of the price.

name: PureKicks
description: I love the traction, cushioning, and support of the Adidas Dame 9, but the breathability does take a few points off.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I felt quick and comfortable playing in the Adidas Dame 9. This shoe has the best cushioning and support for an Adidas basketball shoe.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 4 is a solid performing shoe, especially for the price. The traction performance is great, and the outsole will last outdoors.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Giannis Immortality 4 provides much better value for money than the main signature. The traction performance is reliable and the cushioning feels better this year.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 4 is an excellent shoe for the price. The materials are cheap but stronger, which was much needed.

name: RicheeKim
description: I like the price reduction for the Nike Giannis Immortality 4. The materials update makes this shoe more comfortable performance-wise.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Giannis Immortality 4 is a better shoe than the Zoom Freak 6, for the money, because of the containment and shank usage. I like the bottom-light midfoot setup, too.

name: The Sole Drop
description: There are better shoes out than the Nike Giannis Immortality 4. The pros are the price and the supportive materials if you can deal with a break-in period.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V5 is an upgrade on the V4, but only a minor upgrade. The traction and cushioning are fantastic.

name: TommyLiu
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V5 is responsive, bouncy, and comfortable. This shoe continues the great performance of its predecessor.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V5 is a superb performer. It's the total package, offering everything you need in a basketball shoe.

name: The Sole Drop
description: This shoe has fantastic cushioning and solid traction. I think the TWO WXY V5 shoe will have something for everyone.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V5 is a versatile basketball shoe. The traction is elite, and I enjoyed the cushioning performance.

name: RicheeKim
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V5 is an impressive performance shoe. It has everything you need and nothing you don't, and for the price, you can't go wrong.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta KAI 1 Speed has fantastic push-off power, and the shoe propels you in whatever direction you're moving. I like the fit, materials, and outsole tread.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Anta KAI 1 Speed is an awesome shoe to play in. I felt protected in all movements, the traction was superb, and the cushioning was impressive. This is a top-five shoe for 2024.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The quality and tech of the Anta KAI 1 Speed are top-notch. It feels like the KAI 1 but it's lower to the ground and more responsive.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Anta KAI 1 Speed is faster, lighter, and stiffer than the KAI 1. This shoe is better for players who prioritize fast play styles.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan Luka 3 is a solid performance hoop shoe, especially at this price. The traction bites well, and the cushioning is comfortable. Make sure to wipe the dust, though.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Jordan Luka 3 performance surprised me. The design and construction make the fit and support feel better, and the materials do the job well.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love the performance of the Jordan Luka 3 on clean courts. Dust pickup drops the performance slightly but it's still a solid shoe.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: There's nothing special about the Jordan Luka 3, but there's nothing that will hinder you as well.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Luka 3 doesn't feel premium, but the performance is decent. It caters to slower-paced players or spot-up shooters. I like the containment and traction.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Jordan Luka 3 is best for bigger players. I like the stability, lockdown, and impact protection.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan Luka 3 is my favourite from his lineup so far. I love the support and containment, as well as the traction and cushioning.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Luka 3 is my favourite shoe within the Luka signature line. The traction is tacky, and the upper materials are supportive. I also like the Cushlon foam in the midsole.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan 39 is a top-tier hoop shoe because of its traction, cushioning, comfort, and fit. The only downside is the lack of an outrigger.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Air Jordan 39 is an excellent basketball shoe. The cushioning, fit, and materials are outstanding. However, there's a lack of side-to-side stability and breathability.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Air Jordan 39 is so close to being fantastic. The cushioning performance is great, and I love the materials, but the lack of stability hurts.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Air Jordan 39 has excellent cushioning and materials. This shoe caters to bigger, powerful players well.

name: RicheeKim
description: I like everything about the Jordan 39 except for the support and stability. The cushioning is very comfortable, but I wish they would've put in a shank.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Air Jordan 39 performance was not what I expected. The cushioning is too soft for smaller, shiftier players, but the materials are impressive.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: I wouldn't recommend the Air Jordan 39 for bigger players because of the lack of stability. However, the traction is elite and the cushioning is decent.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I didn't mind the Air Jordan 39 on clean courts, but there are a few too many negatives. The dust pickup causes sliding, and there's a lack of lateral stability.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Air Jordan 39 is a fantastic shootaround shoe. The comfort is outstanding, but the lack of stability makes cutting and planting difficult.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I love the bang for your buck the Adidas AE 1 Low offers. My main gripe is the fit and sizing. However, the cushioning, traction, and support are all impressive.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The AE 1 Low is still a solid performer. I enjoy the Lows better because of the fit, but the main difference between the two shoes is cushioning. The Lows are firmer.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: I like how the Adidas AE 1 Lows perform. The cushioning and support cater well to my play style, and I didn't have any issues with the traction.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas AE 1 Low is a great shoe for the price. It's not for everyone because of the lack of impact protection, but I like the traction. The materials feel better on feet too.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas AE 1 Low feels clunky enough to be noticeable on feet. The shoe performance doesn't feel the same without the bigger ankle collar and upper materials.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Adidas AE 1 Low's fit throws off the shoe's performance. It affects the fit and heel containment. However, the traction and other support features are solid.

name: TommyLiu
description: The AE 1 Low is the most disappointing release of 2024. The lack of heel slippage and fit affects performance too much. The cushioning also feels like a downgrade.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 6 is well worth it. I like the tech, especially the comfortable cushioning.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 6 takes an incremental step forward. I enjoy the lightweight materials and the responsive cushioning.

name: TommyLiu
description: I don't have much to complain about with the Nike Zoom Freak 6. The traction is the best feature. I highly recommend waiting for sales.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I like the comfort of the Nike Freak 6 but the quality could be better for a signature shoe. The cushioning is low to the ground, and the traction performs well after breaking in.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Zoom Freak 6 has decent performance. There are only minor issues with dust accumulation and heel slippage. The rest of the features perform well.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Zoom Freak 6 is adequate. The materials are crappy, and the upper is too flimsy to keep you contained. It's a shoe meant for light and shifty guards.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 6 feels great initially. However, wear and tear can deteriorate the build quality and containment.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 12 is the best overall performer in his lineup. This pair blew my mind. The cushioning is improved, while the support and traction remain fantastic.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Curry 12 is an impressive performer. Flow foam provides excellent traction, and the materials are comfortable and supportive.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Curry 12 is extremely light and performs similarly to the Curry 11. The traction plays well on clean courts, and the cushioning is best for responsiveness.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Curry 12 performance is similar to the 11 but is more comfortable. The fit and upper materials are much improved.

name: RicheeKim
description: You should know what to expect with a Curry shoe. The Curry 12 is in line with the rest of the Flow lineup. I love the performance on clean courts.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Way of Wade All City 12 Encore is a speedy, quick-moving shoe with plenty of bounce and stability. All my movement felt easy in this shoe.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Way of Wade All City 12 Encore is an elite performer. Traction and cushioning are both top-tier, and the materials even feel comfortable.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 Encore is the best value-for-money shoe on the market. The traction and cushioning are both near perfect.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Wade All City 12 Encore kills it as a performer. The traction and support are improved, and the Boom cushioning is incredibly balanced.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 Encore has something to offer everyone. It has balanced cushioning and grippy traction. All of the features are solid.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Way of Wade All City 12 Encore is an impressive all-around performer. The shoe has no real weak points. The cushioning is balanced, and the traction performance is great.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Way of Wade Ice Blood 2 feels snappy and springy during play. However, the shoe has some stiffness and fit issues.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Wade Ice Blood 2 is a fun performer with a problematic fit. I like the low-profile cushioning setup and the support features.

name: TommyLiu
description: I had a lot of fun playing in the Ice Blood 2. It's designed as a guard shoe with its lightweight and responsive cushioning. However, the materials are cheap, so beware.

name: RicheeKim
description: I think the Wade Ice Blood 2 is a good shoe for the most part. The main drawbacks are the narrowness and lack of torsional stability. I like the cushioning setup though.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning Wade Ice Blood 2 is fluid, minimal, and lightweight. The cushioning is also solid, but the materials are cheap and the fit is off.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 11 are much nimbler and make movement easy. I like the weight and setup. The traction and cushion are also incredible.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: This shoe is a pleasure to play in. The Way of Wade 11 has almost no weaknesses outside of the lack of breathability.

name: TommyLiu
description: I'm very excited for the Li-Ning Way of Wade 11. It's a top-tier performance shoe. The traction and cushioning are incredible. The main downside is the lack of breathability.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 11 is an incredible performance shoe. The traction and cushioning combination is outstanding. My only complaints are the slight bulkiness and lack of ventilation.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Way of Wade 11 features Li-Ning's top tech. The shoe is fast, fluid, and stable. My only complaint is with the fit.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Way of Wade 11 is one of the better-performing basketball shoes. The traction is almost top-tier, and the cushioning is plenty soft.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 11 is a banger. It's light, bouncy and feels good on my feet.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 11 is another outstanding performance shoe. I love the traction performance. The cushioning is also amazing, it's smoother but not as bouncy.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 11 is a great performance hoop shoe. It doesn't live up to the WoW 10, but the support and materials are impressive.

name: RicheeKim
description: I enjoyed playing in the Adidas D.O.N Issue 6. The shoe features phenomenal traction and solid impact protection. My only issue is the minor heel slippage.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue 6 has top-tier traction, and I felt extremely fast during play. I love the lightweight performance the shoe provides.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue 6 has some of the best traction available. I also like the cushioning setup for indoor play.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue 6 has excellent traction and lockdown. This is one of the best options for fast, smaller guards.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue 6 offers elite balance. The shoe is light and the traction is impressive for surefooted players. The main downside is the lack of snap and springiness.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I love the performance of the Nike Sabrina 2. The traction and cushioning performance are outstanding. Beware of potential quality control issues. I experienced some peeling on my first pair.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 is a solid performer. It reminds me of the Nike Kobe 5. The traction is fantastic; the only downside is the lack of impact protection.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 is lighter without losing support, stability, or comfort. The new Cushlon 3.0 midsole feels more plush as well.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 provides impressive traction, style, and design. The support and lockdown are solid but beware of the snug fit.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love the Nike Sabrina 2. The traction is elite, and the cushioning is lightweight and responsive. I felt extremely quick playing in this shoe.

name: MARKCHES
description: I would say the Nike Sabrina 2 is a solid performer. The shoe is lightweight and minimal, and the traction performance is outstanding.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 is a dream shoe for players with flat, slightly wide feet. I love the fit, and the traction performance is great.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 is an overall improvement compared to the Sabrina 1. The support and fit feel much better, and the traction performance is solid.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 is a consistent performer, especially the traction. I like how tactile the shoe feels throughout all my movements.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 is a beast of a performer. I like the traction and fit but durability could be better.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Nike Sabrina 2 feels like a budget Kobe. The shoe reminds me of the Kobe 5 with how the traction and cushioning feel.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: This is a fantastic hoop shoe. The Nike GT Hustle 3 is a perfect shoe for players who like plush cushioning. It offers some of Nike's best tech from cushioning to support and materials.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike GT Hustle 3 feels like an elevated running shoe meant for basketball. The traction and cushioning are fantastic, and I like how Nike built the upper.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike GT Hustle 3 has an insane amount of cushioning and reliable traction. This is a perfect shoe for players who want impact protection.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike GT Hustle 3 is an amazing basketball sneaker. I highly recommend this for bigger players. The impact protection and cushioning are outstanding.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike GT Hustle 3 is a solid performer if impact protection is your top priority. The containment and stack height can be an issue, but the traction performance is also great.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike GT Hustle 3 is an easy shoe to play in. It gets off the ground easily because of the cushioning setup and the shank. My only concern is the stability.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike GT Hustle 3 has ample cushioning and reliable traction. However, the lack of stability hurts, and the cushion can be excessive.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I think you're getting hosed with the Nike GT Hustle Academy. There's not enough tech to offer much performance.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike GT Hustle Academy is a head-scratcher. There's no tech in the cushioning and support features. The only upside is the lightweight feeling and decent traction.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike GT Hustle Academy is minimal and lightweight but sacrifices too much to get there. There's no cushioning and a lack of support features.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike GT Hustle Academy feels light and breezy and has a solid grip. However, the lack of cushioning, support, and durability is too much to overcome.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 4 Ultra is an incredibly supportive shoe with a fantastic drop-in midsole. I also enjoyed the traction performance. This shoe is a great value.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: There is so much packed into the Li-Ning Wade 808 4 Ultra. The materials and cushioning help you get off the floor and move side-to-side quickly.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Wade 808 4 Ultra is an incredibly balanced shoe. The upper is minimal, I love the cushioning, and the traction is elite. My only complaint is the heel area feels clunky.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 4 Ultra is the best shoe in the 808 line. The materials and the cushioning are the best features, but the shoe is also lightweight and comfortable.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 4 Ultra is an incredible performer. The drop-in midsole is outstanding, and the traction performs well. My only gripe is the hollowed-out sections on the outsole. I prefer full coverage.

name: RicheeKim
description: I think the Wade 808 4 Ultra is a banger of a shoe. Once you break in the traction, the performance is outstanding. I love the Boom midsole setup, too.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Kobe 8 Protro is a responsive shoe. I feel quick because of the top-tier traction and support. I wish Nike upgraded the cushioning more.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Nike Kobe 8 Protro is a lightweight, minimal shoe. The traction performs very well, but the cushioning is not geared for impact protection. The shoe is better suited for shifty guards.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Kobe 8 Protro is a great pair to play in. The traction is impressive, and I enjoy the React cushioning setup.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: I love how supportive, lightweight, and grippy the Nike Kobe Protro 8 feels. The traction is excellent, and the heel counter keeps you contained.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I'm not impressed by the improvements to the Nike Kobe 8 Protro. The cushioning could be better, but the traction and support are outstanding.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Kobe 8 Protro allows a lot of movement freedom and contortion. Lighter players who don't require impact protection will get the most out of this shoe.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike GT Cut Cross is one of the best budget shoes. I love the traction, but the cushioning is a budget setup.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike GT Cut Cross is a solid budget shoe and a good option for outdoor play. The traction performance is great, and the upper materials feel improved.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike GT Cut Cross is a snappy performance shoe. I like how the traction feels, but the cushioning isn't as bouncy as the rest of the GT Cut line.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma Stewie 3 are surefooted and cater well to low-to-the-ground players. The traction can be better, but I like the material and build-quality setup.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: I had a mostly positive experience playing in the Puma Stewie 3. The traction performs well, especially on clean courts, and the shoe feels comfortable.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Puma Stewie 3 is a solid performer. My main concern is the stiff rear outsole. Otherwise, I like the traction on clean courts and the drop-in midsole.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I had issues with the Puma Stewie 3 because of the traction. It also feels bottom-heavy and clunky. I do like the drop-in midsole and materials, though.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I want to love the Jordan Zion 3 SE but the fit and traction cause too many problems. The cushioning is impressive and I enjoy the materials, though.

name: RicheeKim
description: I can't recommend the Jordan Zion 3 SE because of the lack of traction. All the other features perform well, but it's not enough to compensate for the traction.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan Zion 3 SE is a clunky shoe with poor traction performance. The cushioning feels good, and the shoe is extra supportive, though.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I'm not the best person to judge these shoes. The Jordan Zion 3 SE does not line up with my foot shape. The lockdown is impressive, but the fit hurts.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance Kawhi 4 sacrifices some ground feel for improved cushioning and nimbleness. I felt confident throughout all movements.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I'm pleasantly surprised with the performance of the New Balance Kawhi 4. The traction and cushioning are impressive, and the materials are also solid.

name: TommyLiu
description: I love the aesthetics and the performance matches the looks. The traction is elite, and the cushioning is one of the best. My only gripe is the lateral containment for my flat feet.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The New Balance Kawhi 4 performs better than expected. I like the FuelCell cushioning, and the traction is reliable.

name: RicheeKim
description: The New Balance Kawhi 4 is a bit pricey, but the traction and cushioning make this a solid performer.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Kawhi 4 is his best signature shoe so far. The bulk and weight are down, and I enjoy the updated FuelCell cushioning setup.

name: DG Hoops
description: I love the traction and cushioning setup in the New Balance Kawhi 4. The comfort is impressive. I'm not a fan of the shoe's fit, though.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The standout features of the Kawhi 4 are the traction on clean floors and the support. I also like the fit after a break-in period, but I think the price is too high.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike KD 17 is a lighter, faster version of the KD 16. I like the tweaks Nike made on this model, and the traction is my favourite feature.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike KD 17s are moderate bad boys. It's a good shoe, but the performance is similar to last year's model. I enjoy the traction the most.

name: TommyLiu
description: I'm enjoying my time in the Nike KD 17. Materials, traction, and cushioning are the standout features. However, heel slippage is a concern.

name: DG Hoops
description: The Nike KD 17 is a solid performer because of the impressive traction and stable cushioning. I also like the lightweight materials. The lockdown is the only minor gripe I have.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike KD 17 is my favourite KD model since the 14. It's flexible and has impressive traction performance. My only complaints are the short shank and the long fit.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike KD 17 is a solid shoe overall, but I experienced issues with the flimsy upper. The traction and cushioning are comfortable though.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike KD 17 is a solid performer. This pair feels better than the previous model for sure. I like the cushioning and stability.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I enjoyed the Nike KD 17. It's comfortable, but I don't feel quick playing in the shoe. The traction feels good, but the responsiveness and support are lacking.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike KD 17 is a letdown for me. The cushioning and materials are both downgraded compared to last year. On the bright side, the traction is impressive.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 8 is a fantastic performer. I highly recommend this shoe. The traction is tacky, and the cushioning is very comfortable.

name: MARKCHES
description: I like what Adidas is doing with the Harden Volume 8. The Jetboost cushioning feels protective and bouncy, and the traction performance is consistent.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 8 is one of the best performance shoes of the year. The cushioning is comfortable, and the traction is slightly improved compared to last year.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 8 is an excellent performer with standout traction on clean courts. I love the Jetboost midsole for cushioning, too.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 8 has great traction and cushioning, but the weight holds back the performance. The shoe is better suited to bigger, more powerful players.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 8 is a fantastic performer. The traction feels quick and responsive, and the cushioning is comfortable. Heat retention and weight are the main drawbacks.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 8 has excellent traction, and the comfort exceeded my expectations. My only concern is the extra space in the toe box for people who prefer a snug fit.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 8 is an amazing performer, especially for the price. The cushioning is ideal for me, and the lateral support is excellent.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 8 has plush cushioning and reliable traction on clean courts. My main gripes are the weight and heat retention. The shoe is best for players looking to create space.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: I enjoyed Volume 7 slightly more than the Adidas Harden Volume 8. The fit bothered me a bit and the cushioning felt firm. The traction performs well, though.

name: TommyLiu
description: I love how durable the Jordan Tatum 2 feels. The revamped construction is comfortable and supportive, while the traction and cushioning are average.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan Tatum 2 is light and responsive, but the performance on dust is not good. You have to keep the outsole dust-free at all costs.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan Tatum 2 is an upgrade on the Tatum 1. I like the Air Strobel cushioning; the support and lockdown were also solid. I don't like the materials and the traction is not top-tier.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan Tatum 2 is a letdown because of the required break-in time. The shoe is supportive, but the traction and cushioning are inconsistent.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The safety and support of the Jordan Tatum 2 is improved, but the traction and cushioning take a step back.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Tatum 2 feels dull. Lateral stability and ground feel are the pros, but the traction attracts a lot of dust and the cushioning feels dead.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Jordan Tatum 2 is an upgrade from the 1, but there's plenty of room for improvement. The cushioning is light and the fit and support are decent.

name: RicheeKim
description: I can't recommend the Jordan Tatum 2, mainly because of the poor traction. The cushioning is well-balanced, but the materials are low-quality.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: I did not enjoy my time playing in the Jordan Tatum 2. The side panels ruin the shoe for me. There isn't enough flexibility built in.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta KAI 1 feels incredibly low to the ground. The traction and cushioning also allow players to get creative with their movements.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Anta KAI 1 has consistent traction and responsive cushioning. I felt fast and quick while playing in this shoe.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Anta KAI 1 has plenty of tech features to aid with support, traction, and cushioning. The performance is impressive.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Anta KAI 1 is a solid first signature shoe with Anta for Kyrie. The support and lockdown are excellent, and the cushioning feels responsive.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta KAI 1 is an outstanding first signature shoe with the brand. The cushioning feels comfortable, and the materials feel impressive after breaking in.

name: DG Hoops
description: I'm pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoy the Anta KAI 1. The shoe feels smooth and the traction is a standout feature.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Anta KAI 1 impressed me performance-wise. I like the materials and construction, but the cushioning is my favourite feature.

name: TommyLiu
description: I had a fun time playing in the Anta KAI 1. It's a solid performer, but it isn't an elite shoe. The cushioning and traction are the best features.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Anta KAI 1 is a solid pickup. My only gripe is the break-in time. I enjoyed the cushioning and overall performance after the shoe broke in.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: I don't recommend the Anta KAI 1 for bigs. If you play on clean courts, this shoe is more suitable for guards and wings.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning JB 2 feels out of this world. The cushioning and traction are outstanding. The materials also provide breathability, flexibility, and comfort.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning JB 2 is a solid, responsive shoe. I love how the traction and cushioning feel. This shoe is an impressive performer.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning JB 2 is an overpriced shoe with solid performance. I love the cushioning and how the shoe fits.

name: TommyLiu
description: Li-Ning put a lot of effort into making the JB 2 one of their better performers. I have this in the A-tier. I love how comfortable the cushioning feels.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning JB 2 is best for quicker guards and wings. I like the traction on clean courts, and the cushioning felt good.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike Book 1. The performance is justified. The traction and materials are standout features.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I recommend the Nike Book 1 for every position. I like the traction and cushioning but wish the breathability was better.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Book 1 is a decent basketball shoe. I love the materials and traction performance. The cushioning is slightly lacking, though.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: I like the Nike Book 1. The performance is best for shooters because of the traction and cushioning setups.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike Book 1 is simple and effective. It plays fast with traction which works, and the materials are good quality. My only gripe is with the lack of forefoot cushioning tech.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Book 1 is slightly expensive for the features you get. I enjoyed the responsive cushioning and the premium-feeling materials.

name: TommyLiu
description: I love the materials on the Nike Book 1. The traction is surprisingly good, and the cushioning is comfortable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Book 1 is an impressive shoe because of its traction and materials. The only downsides are the lateral containment in the forefoot and the lack of forefoot impact protection.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Book 1 is incredibly light of foot. It has quick and light side-to-side movement, and the cushioning and traction are impressive for lighter players.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: I like the look, materials, and style of the Nike Book 1. In terms of performance, they're better suited for players with a perimeter focus.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Book 1 is a well-made and aesthetic sneaker. I enjoyed the materials and support. The traction and cushioning could be better.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Under Armour FUTR X Elite has standout traction and cushioning. This shoe has my favourite implementation of Flow foam to date.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I truly enjoyed the playability of the Under Armour Flow FUTR X Elite. The shoe feels accommodating for most play styles, and it's an easy shoe to play in.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Under Armour FUTR X Elite is an interesting innovative performer. The cushioning is stable and comfortable, but the fit might divide players.

name: RicheeKim
description: Pick up the Under Armour FUTR X Elite if you enjoy Flow cushioning and traction. It's excellent on clean courts and has plenty of responsiveness.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Under Armour FUTR X Elite is a weird shoe. The traction and cushioning feel solid, but the fit is not optimal for performance.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance Fresh Foam BB V2 is one of the most protective shoes for support and impact protection. The Fresh Foam X does a good job of keeping your whole foot comfortable.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: I enjoy the New Balance Fresh Foam BB V2 more than the V1. The fit and materials are better, and the traction and cushioning are outstanding.

name: TommyLiu
description: Performance and quality are top-notch on the New Balance Fresh Foam BB V2. The traction and cushioning feel very impressive.

name: RicheeKim
description: The New Balance Fresh Foam BB V2 has exceptional cushioning, materials and support. The traction performance on dust can be better.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The New Balance Fresh Foam BB V2 has comfortable cushioning. The shoe caters to impact protection. The traction slides a bit during forward movements, which is frustrating.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 feels like the rightful successor to the original. The performance is amazing, and the cushioning is one of my favourites.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 feels better than the 2. The cushioning is impressive out of the box, and the shoe is extremely lightweight.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 is a fantastic performer. The traction worked well, and I love how the ZoomX foam feels.

name: MARKCHES
description: I'm impressed with the performance of the Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 3. I like how the cushioning feels, and the traction performs very well.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 does its job. The cushioning is comfortable, the traction is solid, and the materials feel light.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 has solid traction on clean courts, but the materials disappointed me. I would've preferred the cushioning to be more responsive, too.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The G.T. Cut 3 is a reliable performer. The traction is consistent, and the ZoomX cushioning feels plush.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 has a steep price. I wish the materials and support were better, but I enjoy the feeling of the ZoomX foam.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 3 has top-tier traction and comfortable, but underwhelming, cushioning. The materials could be better quality for the price.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 3 has all the bells and whistles but needs to refine how they work in unison. The traction performs well, and the ZoomX implementation is fresh.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: You need the proper skill set to use the Nike G.T. Cut 3. The shoe plays fast, and the cushioning is bouncy. Torsional support and lateral containment can be an issue.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Air Jordan 38 Low is a well-balanced performer. The support and materials are fantastic, and I love the cushioning setup.

name: RicheeKim
description: I enjoyed playing in the Air Jordan 38 Low. The cushioning is outstanding. The traction performance is solid, too. Make sure to wipe on dust, though.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I like the Jordan 38 Low more than the Jordan 38. I recommend the cushioning and reliable traction to everyone.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan 38 Low is slightly better than the regular 38. I especially enjoyed the improved stability and containment.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan 38 Low doesn't improve enough from the regular 38 to be worth it. The traction and cushioning are solid, but the extra flexibility felt less secure.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan 38 Low is a decent performer for a lower price than the mid-cut version. The traction is decent, and the full-length Zoom Strobel is bouncy.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Dame Certified 2.0 is incredibly agile, considering the bulk. I love the shank usage, and the traction performs well.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas Dame Certified 2.0 does not disappoint. The traction is exceptional, and this year's improvements in stability are appreciated.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Dame Certified 2.0 is a steal for the price. The only downside is the lack of impact protection. Otherwise, the shoe is excellent.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike G.T. Cut Academy has phenomenal traction and comfortable cushioning. I felt quick when I was playing with this shoe. This is one of the best shoes under $100.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike G.T. Cut Academy is a beast of a performer for the price. The slight heel slippage and narrowness were the only downsides. I enjoyed the cushioning, and the traction is top-tier.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike G.T. Cut Academy is the best budget shoe this year. The traction is some of the best on the market, and the support and lockdown feel secure.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike GT Cut Academy is a legitimate performer. I love the traction and how comfortable the materials feel during play.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike G.T. Cut Academy is a solid performer for the price. The cushioning is decent, and the traction performed better than expected.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike GT Cut Academy. It has outstanding traction, and the cushioning felt comfortable. The main downfall is the cheap materials.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike G.T. Cut Academy feels similar to the G.T. Cut 3. It feels more stable, but it does not have the tools and pop the G.T. Cut 3 has.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan One Take 5 is tremendous around the hoop, but the breathability is not good. The shoe is stable with solid traction.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan One Take 5 is not bad, but better options are available. The shoe's performance features feel basic.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan One Take 5 is a solid performer for the price. The traction and materials are decent, but the fit is an issue for wider feet.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordon One Take 5 is a niche performance model. The shank plate makes the shoe too restrictive for most players. Traction is the shoe's best feature.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I'm not a fan of the Jordan One Take 5. I wouldn't recommend this shoe because the performance is below standard.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Adizero Select 2.0 feels like an improved Harden Vol 4. The shoe is lightweight with fantastic traction.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Adizero Select 2.0 has impressive grip and materials. The shoe is lightweight and breathable, too. This pair is best when moving in different directions.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adizero Select 2.0 is a decent shoe. There are downfalls with the cushioning and traction, but the lightweight nature feels comfortable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas Adizero Select 2.0 is lightweight but I didn't feel quick during play. The traction on dust is not good. A responsive cushion is the best feature.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas Adizero Select 2.0 is lightweight and breathable, but few standout features exist. The cushioning feels flat. The traction feels decent, though.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love playing in the Adidas AE 1. The traction is outstanding, the cushioning feels comfortable, and the support and lockdown keep you secure.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Adidas AE 1 is in the running for best performer of the year. I love the traction and cushioning setup. This shoe is one of my favourite performance models.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Adidas AE 1 has outstanding performance. The support and cushioning are some of the best; the only downside is the weight.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Adidas AE 1 feels complete. I feel ready to play in this shoe. The cushioning is elite, and the traction holds up as well.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Adidas AE 1 is a dope performer. It's sturdy and well-built. It has the traction, cushioning, and support that players need.

name: TommyLiu
description: I'm loving the Adidas AE 1. The step-in cushioning feels comfortable, and the lockdown is impressive. My only gripes are the weight and breathability.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The standout features of the Adidas AE 1 are the stability and cushioning. This is one of the best performance shoes if you enjoy the materials.

name: MARKCHES
description: I like the direction Adidas is going with the AE 1. The cushioning feels good, the traction is grippy, and I felt secure in these shoes.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Adidas AE 1 debuts with a solid score for performance. Lateral stability is the only downside. The traction is perfect, and the cushioning feels comfortable.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas AE 1 is an easy shoe to play in. It feels buttery underfoot despite being heavy. The foam choices for the cushioning are incredible.

name: RicheeKim
description: I have no problem recommending the Adidas AE 1 at this price point. The traction is phenomenal, but I did experience some sliding on the footbed.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Puma Scoot Zeros feel incredibly similar to the MB.02. The performance is decent, but there aren't many differences from the rest of the Puma lineup.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Puma Scoot Zeros are a great budget option. The traction feels good, and I enjoyed the fit, even though it feels snug.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma Scoot Zero is a nice, crafty shoe. I like the traction performance and how accommodating the fit feels.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I would only recommend the Puma Scoot Zeros to guards. It feels responsive but lacks impact protection.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I did not like playing in the Puma Scoot Zeros. This shoe is a disappointment. Traction and cushioning are both poor, and the shoe is heavy.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Curry Spawn FloTro is a fantastic performance shoe. It's easy to play in because of the traction and cushioning. I enjoy the fit and support, too.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Curry Spawn FloTro is a low-to-the-floor, responsive sneaker. I love the Flow foam for traction and cushioning.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I enjoy playing in the Curry Spawn FloTro. The shoe feels smooth, and the traction is incredible. The cushioning is also soft and comfortable.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Curry Spawn FloTro is a fantastic shoe for guards. It's light and responsive, and the traction is top-tier. I wish the shoe had more stability, though.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 is surefooted and offers tremendous performance. The cushioning is incredible, and the traction enables all types of movement.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 is one of my favourite shoes of 2024. Both traction and cushioning are excellent, and the shoe has no weaknesses.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 is a fantastic performer. The traction pattern is amazing, the cushioning is comfortable, and the support is outstanding.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: Li-Ning's Way of Wade All City 12 is one of the most well-rounded shoes of the year. The shoe is the entire package with its excellent traction and balanced cushioning.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 is my favourite model in the lineup. I recommend the shoe for all positions.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 is a must-cop. The cushioning is comfortable, and the traction is one of the best. I also enjoyed the material improvement.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 is low to the ground and fast. The cushioning has incredible court feel, and the traction is consistent.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 12 continues the impressive performance from the All City line. The cushioning offers more impact protection, and the materials feel better.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue #5 thrives on fit, support, and lockdown. The performance of the materials aids with the containment, and the traction is decent.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue #5 is a Jekyll and Hyde type of shoe. I felt quick and snappy but also stiff at the same time. The foam could be better.

name: TommyLiu
description: I like the Adidas D.O.N. Issue #5 aesthetics more than the performance. The traction is excellent, but the cushioning feels B-tier.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance Hesi Low feels agile and light around the court. The traction warms up well, and it benefits lighter, shiftier players.

name: TommyLiu
description: The New Balance Hesi Low has no weaknesses, but there are also no standout features. I enjoy the cushioning, and the support is solid.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I love the Nike LeBron 21, especially after breaking in the materials. The traction and cushioning are top-notch. It's an elite shoe.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron 21 is incredibly fun to play in. I felt like I could cut, move, and pivot quickly. The traction is outstanding, and the cushioning is bouncy.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: This year's Nike LeBron 21 is incrementally better than the 20. The traction performance is excellent, and the cushioning feels slightly improved too.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 21 is still an impressive performer. The materials and support are improved to provide additional containment and stability.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike LeBron 21 feels quick. I love playing in these shoes. The traction is outstanding, and the cushioning feels comfortable and responsive. It's not the most breathable, though.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike LeBron 21 is an elite basketball performer. The materials feel more premium, while the traction and cushioning remain top-tier.

name: RicheeKim
description: I highly recommend the Nike LeBron 21. It has fantastic cushioning and impressive traction. It's also fun to play in.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike LeBron 21 keeps the impressive traction and cushioning from last year. I prefer the knit material on the previous LeBron shoe.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I think the Nike LeBron 21 is a dope sneaker once it's broken in properly. The traction is top-tier, and the cushioning provides plenty of impact protection.

name: TommyLiu
description: The LeBron 21 is Nike's best basketball shoe right now. The cushioning is better, and the traction is excellent.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike LeBron 21 is all over the place. The traction and materials disappointed me, but the cushioning and support are incredible.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V4 exceeds in multiple ways. There's no better option for players seeking maximalist protection and minimalist pop and explosion.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: New Balance did not disappoint with the TWO WXY V4. The cushioning feels better this year, and the traction continues to perform well.

name: TommyLiu
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V4 is the complete package. It has the cushioning and traction to cater to all positions and play styles.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: I prefer the New Balance TWO WXY V3 to the TWO WXY V4, but the impact protection and outsole durability are better on the V4. The fit is tricky, but the traction remains reliable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V4 feels quick, responsive, and comfortable. The cushioning is soft, the traction performs well, and the materials are supportive.

name: RicheeKim
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V4 is a fun shoe to play in. I enjoyed the cushioning and the traction.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan Zion 3 provides enough stabilization for all positions. I love the cushioning, and the traction works as long as you wipe the dust.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love the Jordan Zion 3. Everything about the shoe is fantastic except for the narrow fit. The traction was solid, and this shoe has my favourite drop-in midsole.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan Zion 3 is one of the best supportive low-top shoes. Jordan Brand knocked the drop-in midsole out of the park, too.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Zion 3 is a departure from his previous shoes. It's a minimal shoe that maintains the structure, but it's still heavy. The traction and outsole are the best features.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Jordan Zion 3 is made for stockier players who play with pace. All the features perform as intended, but there is a break in period.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Zion 3 is a minimal shoe with outstanding support and lockdown. I enjoy the drop-in midsole, but the shape and fit of the shoe are off.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Jordan Zion 3 didn't meet our expectations. The only upside is the cushioning. Jordan Brand takes a step back on this model.

name: TommyLiu
description: I'm disappointed with the Jordan Zion 3. The comfort is poor, and there's a lot of pinching because of the fit.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta KT 9 is one of my top shoes this year. The traction and cushioning are outstanding. None of the features disappoint.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Anta KT 9 is suitable for the 1-3 positions. It has fantastic heel impact protection, and the support is solid. My only gripe is the breathability.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Anta KT 9 is a shoe I enjoyed playing in. My only concerns are breathability and dust pickup. The comfort feels good, and the traction performs well.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta KT 9 is an incredibly stable and containing shoe. The playability is impressive if you have the right foot shape. The impact protection is one of the best.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 8 caters to quick play styles. The traction is outstanding, but the cushioning could be better.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 8 is a solid, budget performer. I think it's a good pickup if you can get it at a discount. The cushioning is soft, and the traction works.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The LeBron Witness 8 is low to the ground and responsive. The materials and support feel better than the previous Witness 7.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 8 does not inspire confidence. The lateral containment was not secure enough because of the lack of containment features.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Li-Ning Wade Shadow 5 is a decent performer, especially for a budget shoe. Stability is the best feature, while traction and cushion take some time to warm up.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I like the Li-Ning Wade Shadow 5 as a budget performer. The shoe is impressive for lockdown, and the traction and cushioning are decent.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Wade Shadow 5 is better for outdoor use. The shoe caters to larger, more powerful players that can generate more force for traction and cushioning.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas Trae Young 3 has bouncy cushioning and consistent traction, but the heel slippage and stability subtract from the overall performance.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Trae Young 3 is a niche shoe. It's best for lightweight, bouncing players. The cushion is soft and bouncy, while the traction grips. Beware of the durability outdoors.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Trae Young 3 is a massive improvement. It feels light and reactive. The best features are the grippy outsole and stability. The main downside is the lack of impact protection for heavier players.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas Trae Young 3 is a solid performer, but I didn't enjoy how bulky it is. The cushioning feels good, and the stability is better than expected, though.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Adidas Trae Young 3 is a decent shoe. It has impressive traction and cushioning. The materials and comfort are lacking, though.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
