description: The Puma MB.03 has impressive traction and support. This iteration is similar to the previous two, and I enjoy playing in this shoe.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma MB.03 is my favourite performer in LaMelo's signature line. The fit feels great, the materials are improved, and the traction is elite.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Puma MB.03 is a stable and supportive sneaker. The cushioning is my favourite part, but I dislike the shoe's weight.

name: TommyLiu
description: Not much has changed with the Puma MB.03. The heel impact protection is slightly improved, while the other features remain solid.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma MB.03 is such a comfortable shoe. The foam is forgiving, and I enjoy the upper material setup. The main downside is the weight.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: If you like consistency, consider the Puma MB.03. LaMelo Ball's line is consistent. All of the features work well together.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I didn't enjoy playing in the Puma MB.03. Puma took steps back with the materials, traction, and cushioning. Support and lockdown are impressive, though.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The quality is impressive for the price of the 361 AG 4. The traction is outstanding, the lockdown is solid, and the cushioning feels incredibly comfortable. This is the best value shoe for it's price.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The 361 AG 4 takes some breaking in, but they play like a maximalist shoe with soft cushioning and support. I enjoyed the shiftiness it provides for being a beefier shoe.

name: TommyLiu
description: The 361 AG 4 feels best for quick play styles. I had a fantastic experience playing in this shoe because of the traction and cushioning.

name: MARKCHES
description: Aaron Gordon's fourth shoe, the 361 AG 4, is a step up in performance. The cushioning is the best since the first shoe, and the traction is top-tier.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Under Armour Curry 11 is Steph Curry's best signature model. I enjoyed the updated cushioning. The fit and support are stellar, and the traction is fantastic.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: I love the Curry 11 more than the Curry 10. The traction is elite, and the cushioning caters to shooters nicely. It uses the best iteration of Flow, too.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Under Armour Curry 11 is the perfect guard shoe. It has you covered in all directions and through all movements.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Under Armour Curry 11 keeps all the best performance features of the Curry 10. It's a fantastic shoe with excellent traction.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Curry 11 is more of the same. The traction continues to be impressive, and the cushion is low to the ground and responsive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Curry 11 is an improvement from previous models. I love the Flow foam setup, the weight, and the traction. It's more laterally stable as well.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Air Jordan 38 is a fantastic basketball shoe. The cushioning, materials, and support are all improved. This is the best Jordan Brand shoe in a while.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I recommend the Jordan 38 to everyone. I love the bouncy Zoom Strobel and the top-tier traction. My only gripe is the poor toe box materials.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Air Jordan 38 is an improvement compared to the last model. The cushioning, stability, and materials are all better. I enjoyed the zero break-in time.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Air Jordan 38 is well worth the price. The traction and cushioning feel great. Jordan Brand paid attention to the details to make this shoe a top performer.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: I enjoyed playing in the Air Jordan 38. The traction performed well on all courts, and the cushioning is some of Jordan's best. My outsole did separate, which was disappointing.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Air Jordan 38 is responsive and comfortable. The traction performs on clean courts, and the support is solid. I prefer the cushioning setup with bounce and comfort, too.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Air Jordan 38 is a perfect containing and maximalist shoe. The support and lockdown are improved, and the cushioning is comfortable.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike KD is a well-balanced hoop shoe. I enjoy the comfortable cushioning, and the shoe feels like an improvement from last year.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike KD 16 is one of my favourite performers. The cushioning is catered to impact protection, and the support and materials combine to provide excellent comfort.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike KD 16 is perfect for players looking for heel impact protection and low movement latency. The traction is decent, but the cushioning is where the shoe excels.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike KD 16 feels quick. It's a solid shoe, but there are better options on the market. The cushioning is soft, and the traction plays well on clean courts.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike KD 16 is a decent performer. The cushioning was a letdown compared to last year, but the support and lockdown felt fantastic.

name: MARKCHES
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike KD 16, even with the change in cushioning. The traction feels nice, and the shoe is supportive.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike KD 16 is a well-rounded, versatile sneaker. It has traction, cushioning, and support for multiple positions and play styles.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike KD 16 doesn't pack the same punch as previous models. It's still a solid performer because none of the features are bad, but it's not exceptional.

name: RicheeKim
description: I recommend the Nike KD 16 if you're playing on clean courts. The shoe is comfortable, and the cushioning feels incredible. Avoid playing on dusty courts, though.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike KD 16 is plush and maneuverable, but it doesn't have the bite of the previous models.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 3 is an impressive budget shoe. It's a solid pick suited well for outdoors. The cushioning and materials are improved.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 3 is a minimal, quick, and responsive shoe. The cushioning could be softer and more plush, but the traction feels excellent.

name: TommyLiu
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike Giannis Immortality 3. It's an improvement from last year's model. The traction performs well, and the cushioning is responsive.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 3 is a solid pickup. The traction is impressive, especially at this price point. This is a great 'balling on a budget' shoe.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 3 feels lively and springy. The materials and midsole likely hold up better for lighter guards. It caters to shifty players well because of the weight and traction.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Rigorer AR 1 is incredibly responsive. The shoe transitions from high speed to low speed very well. The traction is fantastic, and it's a highlight feature.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Rigorer AR 1 excels at being a fast and responsive shoe. I never worried when playing in the AR 1. Traction is top-tier.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Rigorer AR1 is an excellent shoe, especially considering the price. The support is secure and locked down, while the traction pattern works well.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Rigorer AR 1 is a banger. It offers excellent performance for the price and is a fun and comfortable shoe to play in.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Rigorer AR 1 is one of the best budget shoes available. The traction is the best feature. Cushioning is minimal, but it's not a hindrance.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Rigorer AR 1 is a solid shoe for players who enjoy low-to-the-ground, responsive sneakers with subtle bounce.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I think positions 1 through 5 can play in the Rigorer AR 1. The traction is elite and the support is impressive. My main concern is the outsole's durability.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Rigorer AR 1 is a solid option at this price. I love the traction, and the cushioning feels balanced. It's a versatile shoe I can get down with.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I enjoyed the Nike Sabrina 1. I didn't have to think when playing, which I loved. The traction and cushioning are excellent, and the support is near perfect.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 is a solid first signature shoe. The shoe caters to shifty, ground-based players. My only gripe is I wish the React foam felt softer.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 reminds me of the Kobe line. The traction and lockdown are exceptional. The cushioning feels good after a break-in period, too.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 is an impressive guard shoe. I enjoyed the materials and traction. I would've liked a more prominent Zoom unit.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 is a standout shoe for players who enjoy lightweight, quick, and responsive shoes. The materials are light and breathable, and cushioning feels straightforward.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 offers tons of ground feel and shiftiness. The support and traction allow players to make shifty moves. The materials are also very comfortable.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 is a solid performer. It's lightweight and low profile. The traction, cushioning, and support remind me of the Kobe line.

name: RicheeKim
description: I recommend the Nike Sabrina 1 for the price. I enjoyed the cushioning, traction, and materials. The support felt impressive, too.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 is a responsive, comfortable shoe. I felt quick, the cushioning is soft, and the materials feel fantastic.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Sabrina is a solid performer and a minimal sneaker. It's better for players with low-to-the-ground play styles because of the thin cushioning and grippy traction.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Sabrina 1 has inconsistent traction and a snug fit, but playing with this cushioning setup is enjoyable.

name: TommyLiu
description: I'm impressed by the comfort of the Nike G.T. Hustle 2. The shoe provides speed and agility while remaining responsive and bouncy.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike G.T. Hustle 2 is my favourite in the G.T. lineup. I love the cushioning and materials. Look elsewhere if you need midfoot support.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: I'm pleasantly surprised how much I enjoy the Nike G.T. Hustle 2. I felt rejuvenated when making cuts, planting my feet, and using quick moves.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike G.T. Hustle 2 is a decent performer. I didn't have any issues with the traction, and the lockdown is outstanding once you get your feet in and the laces completely secure.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike G.T. Hustle 2 is a smooth and nimble-feeling shoe. There's a lot of court feel, and the cushioning feels well-rounded, too. The material quality is the main downside.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike G.T. Hustle 2 is a lightweight and bouncy performer. The cushioning and outsole setup make getting up and down the court easier.

name: MARKCHES
description: There's a lot of promise with the Nike G.T. Hustle 2, but it misses the mark slightly. The shoe plays low and responsive thanks to the full-length Zoom cushioning.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 5 is close to perfect. All aspects of the shoe are impressive and perform well. The traction and cushioning remind me of the Kobe 5.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I felt quick playing in the Nike Zoom Freak 5. The traction is top-tier, and the cushioning is comfortable. I like how the shoe feels on foot. It suits my play style.

name: TommyLiu
description: I think the Nike Zoom Freak 5 is a solid shoe. The traction and cushioning get the job done. The materials could be better. I'm not a fan of the looks, though.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 5 is a solid performer with impressive traction. I enjoy the cushioning and support as well.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 5 isn't a poor performer, but the shoe feels cheap. The traction and cushioning are decent, but I don't enjoy the materials.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 5 is my favourite shoe in Giannis's line. I'm enjoying the cushioning and traction setups.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 5 feels like a more secure version of the 4. I enjoyed the stability, and the traction and cushion let me play a quick style.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Zoom GT Jump 2 will live in my bag permanently. The traction is outstanding, but the cushioning and support features make this shoe incredible.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike GT Jump 2 fixed all my concerns with the original version. It's still incredibly bouncy, but now it feels comfortable, secure, and stable.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike GT Jump 2 is a maximalist shoe with incredibly plush and comfortable cushioning. The bounce and springiness are second to none.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: Frontcourt players will love the Nike GT Jump 2. The cushioning and traction are top-tier, and the materials are comfortable.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike GT Jump 2 makes perfect sense as a package. The cushioning is top-tier, and the other features are more versatile than last year's model.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike GT Jump 2 is a maximalist shoe with unreal cushioning. I prefer to feel responsive and low to the ground, but this shoe is solid for bounce and impact protection.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike G.T. Jump 2 is held back by the lack of lateral stability. The traction and cushioning are fantastic, though.

name: MARKCHES
description: It's not a signature model, but the performance of the Li-Ning Wade 808 3 Ultra feels premium. The cushioning and traction are both top-tier.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 3 Ultra is on a whole new level. This year's model improved on traction while maintaining performance with cushioning and support.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Way of Wade 808 line is one of my favourites. The 808 3 Ultra has responsive cushioning and top-tier traction performance. Impact protection could be better.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 3 Ultra is a shoe for every position because of the support and lockdown. The cushioning feels comfortable, and the traction works. The shoe is versatile.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: After breaking in the Li-Ning Wade 808 3 Ultra, I felt bouncier and tuned for getting up in the air. The traction takes some warming, and the support is impressive.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan Luka 2 takes a step in the right direction. The traction is fantastic, and the lockdown is secure and impressive.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Luka 2 has a reactive and responsive setup better suited for shiftier guards. The traction grips well, and the cushioning caters to lighter players.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Jordan Luka 2 feels like a standard hoop shoe. The changes to the shoe are catered toward bigger guards. The support and lockdown are sturdy, but the shoe is also heavier.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan Luka 2 has outstanding midfoot and lateral support and containment. It's a solid shoe for guards and wings.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Luka 2s are at their best when shifting weight onto one foot, particularly for stepbacks and cuts. The support and lockdown are the best features.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Luka 2's best feature is the lockdown. The traction performs in cleaner conditions, and the cushioning is stable.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan Luka is a solid shoe that covers all of the bases. Most positions can utilize it. The cushioning is soft, and the materials feel comfortable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan Luka 2 beefs up the support and lockdown. The traction performs well on clean courts, and the cushioning feels responsive.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Jordan Luka 2 is a definite improvement from the Luka 1. It's a controlled ride with lots of stability and sturdiness. There's plenty of value at this price point.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma All Pro Nitro is a different shoe but a worthy follow-up to the original. The shoe has excellent traction, balanced, plush cushioning, and solid support.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma All Pro Nitro is one of the best shoes available. It's versatile, with phenomenal traction and improved cushioning.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I love playing in the Puma All Pro Nitro because of how responsive and fast it feels. It fits me well, and I felt supportive, too.

name: TommyLiu
description: Puma finally has a lightweight basketball shoe. The All-Pro Nitro is Puma's best release of the year. The traction is impressive, and the cushioning is comfortable.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Puma All Pro Nitro is a dependable sneaker. The bouncy foam and reliable traction make it a solid performer.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma All Pro Nitro goes north and south incredibly well. The lockdown is impressive but beware of wiping the outsole to remove dust.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Puma All-Pro Nitro is a shoe I plan to keep in my bag. The traction and cushion setup is tried and true. This is one of the best budget-friendly options.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Anta Shockwave 5 is a super responsive shoe. I enjoy playing in it. The traction is outstanding, and the cushioning is low to the ground with tons of court feel.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta Shock Wave 5 feels like a shoe meant for Kyrie Irving. It feels agile, low-profile, and reactive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I enjoyed the Anta Shockwave 5 more than other Kyrie models. The performance is better because of the build quality, the materials, and the cushioning.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Anta Shock Wave 5 has impressive traction, underfoot cushioning, and lockdown. Beware of the inconsistent materials, though.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta Shockwave 5 is an impressive performer. The traction performs well, and the cushioning is balanced. My only concern is the weight.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Anta Shock Wave 5 has grippy traction and a responsive cushioning setup. The containment is also solid but beware of the slim fit.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 3 performed better than expected. It's a bulky but sturdy shoe and is well-suited for outdoor play.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 3 is a sturdy and contained shoe. The build and materials help improve the support and lockdown quite a bit.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 3 is a step down from the 2. The cushioning took a step back, and the traction was inconsistent. It is durable and sturdy, though.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 3 is a decent shoe, but it feels like a downgrade from its predecessors. The cushioning is responsive but stiff, and the shoe is somewhat heavy.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 3 caters to outdoor play. The traction is durable, and the materials are comfortable. The cushioning isn't as bouncy as in past seasons, but it is responsive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Wade Fission 8 is one of the fastest shoes. It has an impressive cushioning setup that offers plenty of energy return. The traction is also solid.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning Wade Fission 8 is a solid performer with a strong traction and cushioning combo. It's an excellent pick for outdoors. Just make sure to get the proper fit.

name: TommyLiu
description: Li-Ning's Wade Fission 8 is light enough for faster players and has enough bounce for high jumpers. The biggest highlight is the traction.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: I love the Li-Ning Wade Fission 8. I have no problem recommending this shoe. The materials, traction, and cushioning are all on the level of a signature shoe.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Wade Fission 8 has outstanding performance. I recommend the shoe for lighter, quicker players because the cushioning is low and responsive.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I had some issues with the Li-Ning Wade Fission 8. The impact protection hurt me, and the traction slipped a bit. Otherwise, the shoe has solid features.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma Stewie 2 is one of the year's best basketball shoes. It has excellent traction and a smooth cushioning ride.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: Puma knocked it out of the park with the Stewie 2. I recommend the shoe to everyone. The traction and cushioning are phenomenal, and the materials are light.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma Stewie 2 is a balanced, versatile shoe. It's incredibly accommodating indoors and is best suited for a ground game.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Puma Stewie 2 feels and performs like the MB.02. It's a comfortable and consistent performer but nothing special stands out.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Puma Stewie 2 has responsive cushioning and decent traction. It feels quick and streamlined while playing. I like the way it performs.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The playability feels similar in the Wade All City 11 V2, but the material durability and stability feel improved. The traction and cushioning remain top-notch.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning Wade All City 11 V2 blends all its features to provide excellent performance. The traction is outstanding indoors and outdoors, while the cushioning is bouncy.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Wade All City 11 V2 is still an impressive performer. The materials and stability feel improved, while the cushioning and traction are still solid.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Li-Ning Wade All City 11 V2 does a solid job addressing issues from the previous model. The performance feels better, but the sizing becomes more snug.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning Wade All City 11 V2 feels almost identical to the original. The updated upper materials provide additional lockdown, but the shoe is still versatile and suited for multiple play styles.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I felt amazing playing in the Jordan Tatum 1 on clean courts. The bounce in the forefoot felt great, the materials are light, and the traction works well. Just be careful on dusty courts.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan Tatum 1 has bouncy cushioning and reliable traction. The torsional support can be better, though.

name: MARKCHES
description: I'm enjoying playing in the Jordan Tatum 1. The cushioning is low but bouncy. I didn't have issues with the traction, and the materials were comfortable.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Jordan Tatum 1 is a solid first performance shoe for Jayson Tatum. It's different and feels odd underfoot. The cushioning is the best part, but the traction disappointed me.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan Tatum 1 is one of the lightest basketball shoes available. I enjoyed playing in the shoe because of the cushioning and material setup. I had no traction issues, but dust picks up quickly.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: There are parts to like about the Jordan Tatum 1, but there's room for improvement. The material choice is solid, but the traction design is weird.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: There are slight concerns about the Jordan Tatum 1, but if you value lightweight shoes, you'll appreciate these. The cushioning is comfortable, and after breaking it in, the traction is decent.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Tatum 1 is a solid option for players constantly on the balls of their feet. I like how lightweight the shoe is. The forefoot traction grips the court well, too.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Jordan Tatum 1 is light and comfortable. It has solid traction and cushioning. The shoe lacks stability and torsional support, though.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Jayson Tatum's debut shoe has a striking appearance. I found the foam traction, support, and fit lacking, but I enjoyed the Zoom Air and the shoe's materials.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 2 Ultra V2 is a fantastic performer. It reminds me a lot of the Kobe 9. The traction is outstanding, and the added heel lockdown is a welcome improvement.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 2 Ultra V2 improves on the regular 808 2 with improved cushioning and a revamped ankle collar. The fit and support feel better too.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 2 Ultra V2 is a solid performer. The fit and lockdown are the best features. I wish the traction performed up to my high expectations.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 2 Ultra V2 feels like an upgrade. The heel and ankle support are where the shoe shines. It has dependable traction and cushioning, too.

name: TommyLiu
description: I enjoyed playing in the Adidas BYW Select. The cushioning feels awesome, and the traction is solid.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas BYW Select is a responsive and comfortable basketball shoe. The cushioning is solid, and the traction performs as intended.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta GH 4 is best for powerful playstyles because of the incredible lockdown, stability, and bouncy cushioning.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Anta GH 4 is an impressive performer, especially for the price. The support is outstanding, and the cushioning is low to the ground while feeling responsive.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I loved playing in the Anta GH 4. I recommend this shoe to anyone. I especially like the heel impact protection and the lockdown from the lacing system.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Anta GH 4 improves on the GH 3 a lot. The support and lockdown are excellent because of the lacing system, and the traction is reliable.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Why Not Zer0.6 is fun to play in. The shoe is fluid from step to step, and they pick up speed well with good traction and cushioning.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Why Not Zer0.6 is a responsive, well-fitting performance shoe. The traction is good, and I felt secure.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan Why Not .6 is an easy ride. It didn't take long to get used to playing in this shoe. It's lightweight, comfortable, and reliable.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Players looking for decent traction, solid forefoot cushioning, and contained support will enjoy the Jordan Why Not Zero.6. It's also lightweight and breathable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan Why Not .6 is somewhat inconsistent. The traction performed well at times but not great at others. The cushioning is alright, but it's not responsive.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike Ja 1. The traction sticks, the materials work, and the cushioning is comfortable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike Ja 1 is a quick and responsive shoe. It's one of my favourite shoes over the past year. The traction, fit, and support are all excellent.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Ja 1 is a solid debut shoe for Ja Morant. The best features are traction, fit, and support. The materials could be better, but I enjoyed playing in the shoe.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike Ja 1 is an impressive initial shoe for Ja Morant. The traction works for me, and the cushioning is a pleasant surprise. I recommend this pair to any player.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Ja 1 is a pleasant surprise. The traction is impressive, the cushioning is decent, and the support provides everything I need.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike Ja 1 is an impressive debut shoe. It feels similar to the Kyrie Low 5. I recommend these for both guard positions because of the cushioning and traction setup.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Ja 1 disappointed me because of my high expectations. The traction is inconsistent, and the comfort and cushioning are lacking. The shoe is playable, though.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Ja 1 is a solid performer. Not many features perform poorly. The traction excels, but the cushioning could be more comfortable.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Ja 1 is straightforward and reliable. The performance surprised me, especially the cushioning. The traction is also serviceable on multiple surfaces.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Ja 1 is a solid performer outside of the narrow fit. The traction feels very good, and the cushioning caters to shifty players.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Ja 1 plays bouncier than expected. The cushioning profile looks flat and offers explosiveness. The traction can be iffy indoors, but it still performs decently.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: I love playing in the New Balance Kawhi 3. The upper is supportive, the traction performs on clean courts, the fit is perfect, and the cushioning is versatile.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The New Balance Kawhi 3 is a good performer but an overpriced shoe. The cushioning is responsive and low to the ground, and the traction plays well on clean courts.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The New Balance Kawhi 3 has solid basketball features, but I advise wearing thicker socks because of the heel portion of the shoe. Impact protection and traction performed well.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance Kawhi 3 is an optimal shoe for playing outdoors and for players who enjoy support. The FuelCell cushioning feels stiff, but the other features make it worthwhile.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 11 is a fast shoe. They have a lot of pop and feel springy. All positions can benefit from this setup.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 11 is a quick and responsive shoe. The traction is elite, and the cushioning does everything.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Way of Wade All City 11 is a solid performance option. The traction and cushioning feel good, and the materials are more breathable this year.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I have no problems recommending the Way of Wade All City 11 as a performance shoe, especially on clean courts. It plays and feels similar to a Kobe shoe. Just be careful on dusty courts.

name: TommyLiu
description: Li-Ning's Way of Wade All City 11 is another strong performance shoe from the brand. The smooth transition with each step is the best part. The traction takes some breaking in, though.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I enjoyed playing in the Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 11. My favourite features are the cushion, fit, and support. The traction was a letdown because of the dust performance.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Under Armour Spawn 5 is a low-profile shoe best suited for guards. The traction is solid, and the shoe feels smooth to play in.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Under Armour Spawn 5 would be a banger if the traction were better. It's a responsive shoe with comfortable cushioning and support.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Wade Son of Flash is another top performer in the Li-Ning lineup. It excels outdoors. The traction is excellent, the cushioning is well-balanced, and there's more than enough support and containment.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Son of Flash plays extremely fast. The first step of the shoe is explosive because of the foam and shank setup, and the herringbone traction pattern helps with stops.

name: TommyLiu
description: I consider the Li-Ning Wade Son of Flash an amazing shoe for the price. The traction is grippy, and the cushioning is good enough for most players. There are also no issues with the support.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Son of Flash is ideal for outdoor use because of the thick rubber outsole. The cushioning is responsive but not the best for impact protection. The shoe is a solid budget option.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Li-Ning Wade Son of Flash has top-tier traction and low-to-the-ground cushioning. I felt quick and light on my feet when playing in this shoe.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Under Armour Curry 2 Low FloTro is a dope sneaker. Flow foam offers outstanding traction, but there isn't much impact protection.

name: TommyLiu
description: Under Armour's FloTro line continues to deliver with the Curry 2 Low FloTro. It performs as expected, with amazing traction and court feel. The transition is smooth too.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Trae Unlimited offers a superior ground-based game. It's supportive and stable while feeling low to the ground. The traction caters to shifty players too.

name: The Sole Drop
description: For the price, the Adidas Trae Unlimited is a comfortable shoe with no weaknesses. It doesn't excel in any specific area, but the performance is well-rounded.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: You can't go wrong with the Nike LeBron NXXT Gen at this price point. The traction is top-tier, the Zoom units feel fantastic, and the support is outstanding.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Gen is an awesome basketball shoe. It's quick, responsive, and stable, and the fit is dead on.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Gen feels light, responsive, and quick. The traction performance is fantastic, and the cushioning does everything well.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I like the Nike LeBron NXXT Gen better than the LeBron 20. I recommend the shoe for all players. It performed better than expected because of the comfortable materials and tacky traction.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Gen is an A-tier shoe. The cushioning isn't as bouncy but stable, and the traction provides good stopping power.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron NXXT Gen is a solid option for forwards who don't need maximalist cushioning setups. The cushioning is comfortable, and the materials play well.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: I love the hybrid feel of the Adidas Harden Vol 7. They are heavy but feel light during play, the heel collar offers flexible movement while the shoe remains supportive, and the cushioning is firm but still bouncy.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Almost every aspect of the Adidas Harden Vol. 7 performs well. Nimble bigs and versatile guards will enjoy the traction and cushioning setup.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: I can comfortably say the Adidas Harden Vol. 7 is one of the best hoop shoes this year. The traction, cushion, and support have you covered.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 7 provides lots of performance for players with powerful and heavy movements. The containment in the upper enables players with excellent footwork.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 7 is an upgrade from the Harden Vol. 6. It's one of the best-fitting shoes, the cushioning feels better, and the traction is dependable.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 7 is a stylish performance shoe. The traction and cushioning are top-tier, but the materials are heavy and not breathable despite being comfortable.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 7 is one of Adidas' best basketball shoes. The cushioning and support are superb, and the traction pattern is aggressive and reliable.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 7 feels great on your feet. It's a versatile shoe I can recommend to every type of player. The cushioning accommodates many different play styles, and the traction performs.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Adidas Harden Volume 7 is one of my favourite performance shoes. I feel quick playing in these shoes. They're supportive, the traction works, and the cushioning is versatile.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: You cannot get more performance for a $99 basketball shoe. The Li-Ning Ice Blood V2 is a fantastic performance model. The traction plays well on clean courts, you can take the shoe outdoors, and the cushioning feels outstanding.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I enjoyed playing in the Li-Ning Ice Blood V2. It has stop-on-a-dime type traction. The containment is locked down, and the shoe is responsive.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Ice Blood V2 is a solid budget sneaker for performance. The support is solid, the materials are soft, and the cushioning feels comfortable.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Ice Blood V2 is best suited for guards who don't rely on explosive movements. The cushioning is comfortable, the fit is accommodating, and the traction is durable.

name: The Sole Drop
description: The Jordan 37 Low is a responsive performance shoe with grippy traction and a bouncy cushion. The bounciness can be excessive, but the overall performance is solid.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan 37 is a bouncy and explosive shoe. The Zoom units in the cushioning feel great, and the traction performs well on clean courts.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Jordan 37 Low is a better performer than the regular Jordan 37. The upgraded materials provide improved support and comfort, while the traction and cushioning are still impressive.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan 37 Low addresses a lot of problems the regular 37 had. The support and fit feel much improved, while the traction and cushioning remain the same.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan 37 is an excellent option for players who play on their forefoot often. The traction holds up, and the forefoot cushioning is explosive.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Air Jordan 37 Low feels like a downgrade. I'm a bit disappointed. Lateral containment is an issue, but cushioning is still impressive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning JB1 is a fast and stable shoe. The shoe is also incredibly bouncy. I love the construction as well. There's not much to complain about.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning JB1 is an expensive shoe but a solid performer. The cushioning is springy, and I experienced no issues with the traction.

name: The Sole Drop
description: I felt responsive and quick playing in the Li-Ning JB1. The upper is minimal, the cushion is comfortable, and the traction is decent.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Li-Ning JB1 is a solid shoe but is overpriced at retail. The cushioning is a top feature, but shifty players might want to double-check with the lateral containment.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Li-Ning Jimmy Butler 1 is only a decent performer on clean hardwood courts. The materials are the main disappointment, but the cushioning feels good.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan One Take 4 has some of the best gripping shoes for indoor courts, but the cushioning doesn't offer much impact protection. It's a solid pick for a budget model.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan One Take 4 is a good but not a great performer. There are better options at this price point, but it's a solid shoe with reactive cushioning and traction for outdoor play.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 is one of my favourite basketball shoes of 2022. The neutral cushioning is the only downside. The fit, traction, materials, and support are phenomenal.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 has everything needed to be a top basketball shoe. I have minor gripes with cushioning and support, but the shoe is still elite.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 is easy to wear, look at, and play in. It has all the necessary features of a great basketball shoe. It does it all and at every level.

name: TommyLiu
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 feels like an S-tier performance shoe. The traction and cushioning feel great, and there are no glaring weaknesses.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 is a shoe I plan to keep in my bag for the long term. It's a reliable setup because of the tacky traction, 1-to-1 fit, and impressive support.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 is a lightweight and minimal shoe. The lockdown and containment are outstanding. It has minimalist but comfortable cushioning and effective traction too.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V3 is a light, responsive shoe with great traction and low-to-the-ground cushioning. Overall, I enjoyed playing in this shoe.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 10 V2 is a fantastic shoe, especially for the price. The cushioning feels perfect, and the traction works. It's versatile - I recommend this for all positions.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 10 V2 is a bang for your buck sneaker. It's versatile and dependable for all conditions. The cushioning is comfortable, the traction is reliable, and the support is on point.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 10 V2 is a solid performer. I had a good time playing on clean courts because of the cushioning and support. Dust can be an issue for the traction, though.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I enjoyed playing in the Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 10 V2. The shoe offers a bit of everything, from traction and cushioning to support and materials. There are no downsides.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 10 V2 is my favourite performance shoe of the year. The support and stability are the best features of the shoe. The traction is dependable, and the cushioning is outstanding too.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Dame Certified is a decent basketball shoe. The traction and material setup are highlights, while the Bounce cushioning is adequate.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas Dame Certified has no features I hated. The traction is so damn good, the cushioning is responsive, and you're low to the ground the whole time.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Dame Certified allows players to change directions well. It's a solid all-around shoe because of the traction but beware of the Bounce cushioning bottoming out.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: I enjoyed the Adidas Dame Certified because of the traction and materials. My only concerns are heel lockdown because of the fit and the lack of bounciness in the cushioning.

name: The Sole Drop
description: You feel quick when playing in the 361 DVD 1. The traction and cushioning are impressive, and the support and lockdown get the job done.

name: MARKCHES
description: Spencer Dinwiddie's 361 DVD 1 is a must-try sneaker for the price. The traction is outstanding, and there's a lot of life in the cushioning.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The 361 DVD 1 is best for players who change directions and speed often. The traction caters to shifty styles, while the cushioning is light and bouncy.

name: TommyLiu
description: The 361 DVD 1 is a solid shoe at its current price point. If the upper weren't stiff, it'd be an impressive performer. The traction and cushion are stand-out features.

name: MARKCHES
description: The 361 AG 3 is one of the best supportive basketball shoes. The traction is fantastic, and the support and lockdown are impressive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The 361 AG 3 is perfect for players with Aaron Gordon's play style. The shoe is stable and anchored with fantastic traction. It's best suited to keep you centered and moving in a straight line.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: If you're a fan of the Curry 8 and 9, you'll enjoy the Curry 10. The traction is phenomenal, the cushioning is solid, and the support and lockdown have no issues.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 10 is one of my favourite shoes of the year. The shoe feels like an extension of your foot. The traction is phenomenal, the fit is on point, and the shoe is supportive.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Curry 10 has tremendous traction, responsive cushioning, and comfortable materials. I prefer the Curry 10 compared to the 8 and 9.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Curry 10 has enough upgrades to offer an improved performance experience compared to the Curry 9. The cushioning has more spring, and the traction continues to be amazing.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Curry 10 feels similar to the Curry 8 and the 9, but there is a slight upgrade. The materials feel better while the traction remains the best available traction.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Curry 10 is one of the best basketball shoes available. The traction and cushioning are good for shifty players, and the support is not an issue.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Curry 10 is one of the best performance basketball shoes. The traction and support are top-notch, and the materials feel good, too.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: If you play on clean courts and have ankle braces, the Curry 10 is meant for you. I experienced slipping with dust, and the cushioning wasn't enough for my play style.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue #4 is a well-built shoe for containment, lockdown, and traction. It's a comfortable shoe overall but beware of the foam bottoming out.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: If you want stability, then Adidas D.O.N Issue #4 is for you. The shoe has all the support features a performance shoe needs, and the traction performs well on clean courts.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas D.O.N Issue #4 is a responsive shoe that performs best on clean courts. It's a pretty good performer, but it's a tad bulky for my liking.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: I wouldn't recommend the Adidas D.O.N. Issue #4. At best, it's alright for shootarounds and practice. The traction is too inconsistent, and the cushioning is stiff.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Trae Young 2 is a flexible shoe that's best for players who enjoy having more freedom of movement. It's a niche profile, but I enjoyed playing in the shoe.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Adidas Trae Young 2 is not as good as the previous model, but it's still a solid performer. The materials are improved, and the cushioning performed better than expected.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas Trae Young 2 struggles with performance on dusty courts, but I enjoyed the cushioning and support features of the shoe.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I did not enjoy the Adidas Trae Young 2 as much as I was hoping. The cushioning feels fantastic, but the traction and materials weren't up to par.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Air Deldon is one of the most creative shoes on the market. It allows you to move in different directions and offers a lot of range of motion for your footwork.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Air Deldon is a decent performance shoe, but I don't enjoy playing in it because of the poor traction. I enjoyed the cushioning and support, though.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike Air Deldon has a fantastic design, but the traction and cushioning were disappointing. I can't recommend this shoe for performance.

name: RunStretchTech
description: I couldn't find anything wrong with the Puma MB.02. It's an excellent performance basketball shoe. The support and stability were solid, and the traction and cushion were reliable.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Puma MB.02 is a quick, fast shoe with fantastic traction and adequate cushioning. The support also holds up well because of the materials.

name: MARKCHES
description: Overall, the Puma MB.02 is an improvement in LaMelo's shoe line. It has improved traction and materials while the support and cushioning remain solid.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma MB.02 is a solid shoe that's best for players who rely on impact protection to help with heavy footwork. The cushioning is stable and protective, and the traction grips well.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Puma MB.02 is one of the best basketball shoes for support. It also has solid cushioning and reliable traction.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Puma MB.02 has a lot of standard but proven features. It provides a lot of bang for your buck with soft cushioning and solid traction.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: Playing in the Puma MB.02 is a mixed bag for me. I like the traction and fit, but I don't like the stiff midsole.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: I was not impressed with the Puma MB.02 compared to the MB.01. The traction is solid, but most other features were better on the previous model.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Puma MB.02 takes a step back compared to the previous model. The traction is solid, but the cushioning and support are lacking.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 4 offers a lot of performance for a lower price. The materials aren't premium, and the traction needed a break-in period, but the shoe is a solid all-around performer.

name: LZ Hoops
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 4 has solid traction and lockdown but is offset by average cushioning.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 4 is an upgrade from the Zoom Freak 3 in terms of side-to-side stability. It also offers tremendous forefoot bounce because of the Zoom Air units. People who are prone to spraining their ankles might want to look elsewhere.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 4 is a lightweight shoe offering solid support, bouncy cushioning, and reliable traction. I enjoyed playing in this shoe.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 4 is a solid shoe, but there are plenty of other options on the market at this price point. The traction performs well, and the shoe is breathable.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 4 is a shoe for players that enjoy playing fast. It offers a propelling cushion, and the traction is solid, but you are high off the ground.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Air Jordan 37 made me feel explosive, but the cushioning can be too much for people who prefer responsiveness. The traction performed well after a few runs, and the materials feel breathable.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: In my opinion, Jordan Brand has a hit with the Air Jordan 37. The cushioning, materials, fit and support are all fantastic.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan 37 is built for indoor performance and shines on hardwood courts. I had no issues with the traction, and the materials provided a solid lockdown.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Jordan 37 is a mixed bag in terms of performance. The cushioning and fit are perfect. However, the traction doesn't hold up with dust, and the stability is not good.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I can recommend the Jordan 37 for most players. The only issue for me is the lack of heel cushioning. The forefoot cushion, traction, materials and support all performed well.

name: MARKCHES
description: I recommend the Jordan 37 to powerful guards who get a lot of performance out of the bouncy cushion. The materials and traction are both solid. The only downside of this shoe is the price.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan 37 steps away from features that performed excellently on the Jordan 36, but it still looks like it will be a solid performer.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan 37 could be an impressive performer with improved support. The traction is reliable, and I enjoyed the cushioning, though.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike LeBron 20 is the best basketball shoe on the market. The traction and support are the best Nike's made in a long time, and the cushioning is an almost perfect combination.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike LeBron 20 is the best shoe in his signature lineup. The cushioning is versatile, and the traction is one of the best setups on the market.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike LeBron 20 could be the best Nike basketball shoe of the year. The shoe has it all. There's cushioning, speed, comfort and stability.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: I like the Nike LeBron 20 a lot. It feels versatile with a complete cushioning setup, solid traction, and a comfortable upper.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike LeBron 20 delivers phenomenal traction and an enjoyable, responsive cushioning setup. It feels great playing in this shoe.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron 20 is the best low-top basketball shoe I've tried in 2022. The shoe is quick, shifty, and contained but not the bounciest.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, I love the Nike LeBron 20. I don't have any complaints because the shoe offers something for everyone. It has good traction, cushion, and stability.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Nike LeBron 20 is an overall solid shoe I enjoyed playing in. It has solid support and traction, and the materials feel comfortable. My only gripe is the high price tag.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike LeBron 20 is evolving and improving. The traction is outstanding, and the fit and materials are premium. The heel lockdown was my only issue with the shoe.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 20 provides a strong traction and cushion setup that caters to a quick play style. The shoe feels comfortable and offers something for everybody.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Nike LeBron 20 has all the tech needed to be an excellent performance basketball shoe but struggles to put it together. The traction was inconsistent, and the court feel can be better.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 808 2 is a shoe-of-the-year contender. The traction is outstanding, the cushion is solid, and the support feels perfect.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Wade 808 2 is a top two or three performer on the market. The traction is phenomenal, the materials are supportive, and I love the drop-in midsole.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Way of Wade 808 2 feels like a Kobe 8 reincarnated. I enjoy the drop-in midsole, and the traction feels sticky.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Way of Wade 808 2 is a speedy shoe that's low to the ground, and the traction offers a lot of grip. More advanced footwork players will benefit the most from this shoe.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 2 is a great shoe for light, quick, and shifty players. The cushioning and traction are impressive. The only issue to consider is comfort for wide-footers.

name: Jackson Bayer [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning Wade 808 2 feels reminiscent of the Kobe 8 and 11. The traction is top-notch, and the drop-in midsole feels like Lunarlon.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Anta KT 8 is the best Klay Thompson basketball shoe. It has fantastic cushioning and materials, while traction and support are no slouch.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Anta KT 8 features high-quality support and lockdown, balanced cushioning, and grippy traction. It caters well to players looking for stability.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Anta KT 8 is a versatile performance model. The shoe offers features that cover all different playstyles and positions. The traction, cushioning, and support are all consistent and solid.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I feel quick playing in the Anta KT 8. The traction is solid, and the cushioning is responsive and balanced. It's an impressive performer.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Anta KT 8 is a solid shoe. Traction and cushioning are standout features, but the collar feels like a gimmick.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 is a fantastic performing basketball shoe. The traction and cushioning are top-tier, and I enjoyed the materials and fit on this shoe more than the last one.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 offers some of the best cushioning on the market. It also has strong traction and comfortable materials. It's a solid shoe for quick, shifty guards.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike G.T Cut 2 is perfect for players who perform a lot of twists and turns while driving to the rim. The cushioning is an improvement, but the traction takes a minor step back.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 is an outstanding performer. It's low-cut and lightweight and has perfect traction and cushioning.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 is an excellent performance basketball shoe. It's one of my favourite shoes to play in because of the cushioning and traction.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: If the Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 had a more secure tongue, it'd be a top 2 or 3 performer. The traction and cushioning are outstanding. Its fit didn't work for me, though.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike G.T. Cut 2 is a solid shoe for advanced shifty players who will benefit from the flexibility and versatility this shoe offers. It might not be the best shoe for players relying on explosiveness and stability.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 is a solid performer in all aspects. The traction isn't top-tier, and the cushioning is high off the ground, so the shoe isn't elite. It's still a fun shoe to play in, though.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T Cut 2 improves on some aspects but takes a step back for others. If you prefer cushioning over court feel in your shoe, this shoe is better than the previous model.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut 2 is a solid performer. The traction is incredibly reliable, and the cushioning is comfortable. Just beware of the fit around the tongue.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity is a top-tier performer. I put this shoe alongside the KD 15 as Nike's best for the year.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: It's going to be tough finding a shoe better than the Nike Cosmic Unity 2 this year. It's the best shoe I've played in all year. The traction and cushion are top-tier.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 2 is worth the price upgrade for this year's model. The traction is insane, the cushion is bouncy, and the support is there.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 2 is a steady sneaker. The cushion and support are solid. The traction performs well, but the shoe would be better if the traction were also top-tier.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I expect the Nike Cosmic Unity 2 will perform well indoors and outdoors. The traction and cushion are the main features, but I am concerned with the lack of a toe guard.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 2 has a plush cushioning setup with solid traction, but it's not good for aggressive footwork.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity 2 is not the shoe for me. I enjoyed the traction and cushioning, but the price, support and materials will keep me away.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, I really like the way the Puma TRC Blaze Court performs. My only gripe is that you sit high on the midsole, but that didn't hinder performance. You feel agile and supported.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I have no problems recommending the Puma TRC Blaze Court. The traction is phenomenal, but the materials feel cheap.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma TRC Blaze Court is an all-around shoe that offers grip, comfort, speed, and bounciness. It's best for quick and explosive-style players.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Puma TRC Blaze Court is a comfortable shoe, but the performance of the traction holds it back.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I definitely recommend the Puma Rise NITRO. The cushioning, traction, and materials work together to provide a comfortable shoe.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma Rise Nitro plays similarly to the MB.01 Low. It has a reliable fit, support, and materials, but it doesn't play well outdoors. The cushioning is also underwhelming.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Puma Rise NITRO is a solid shoe held back by the traction pattern. It has average traction, but the cushioning feels comfortable, and the materials are better than expected.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Puma Rise NITRO is a comfortable performance shoe with flexible materials and dependable traction. I only wish the cushion was plusher.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Puma Rise NITRO is a solid performer. It's not top-tier, but not awful. The stability is the main standout feature, and the traction performs well.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Puma Rise NITRO is a fantastic shoe for players who contort their feet during movements. The shank plate and foam make the shoe feel bouncy and springy.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 2 is a solid shoe for the price. The materials are the best part of the shoe, and the support is there, too.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 2 is a step back from the original. I had fit issues caused by the materials. The traction performed well after breaking it in, and the cushioning is responsive, though.

name: Gavriel Rupert Dela Cruz [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality 2 is a solid budget offering, but it doesn't do much to differentiate itself from last year's Immortality 1. It has the traction, fit, and support needed for most guards on a budget.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality is an above-average performer but remains a very good budget option. The traction and responsive cushion make it a solid pick for smaller, quicker players.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Jordan Luka 1 is as good as it gets. It is one of the best performance basketball shoes available right now. Traction, cushion, and support are all there.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: Luka Doncic's first signature shoe, the Jordan Luka 1, is a performance-first shoe. While they're newer and you're using them for intense play, they'll perform phenomenally.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Jordan Luka 1. The big drawback is that the cushioning could be better. Otherwise, it's a fantastic buy at retail because the traction is top-tier, and the support features perform well.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Luka 1 features a brand new cushion setup called Formula 23, and it feels fantastic under your feet. The traction also feels tacky, and the support is there. This shoe has all the makings of a solid performer.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Luka 1 is an excellent performer. Players who value traction, fit adaptability, and court feel will enjoy this shoe.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan Luka 1 is definitively a shoe I can recommend for guards. It has top-tier traction and feels comfortable on foot. You can't expect much cushioning, though.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Jordan Luka 1 makes you feel shifty and agile, and it's the perfect shoe for guards. The traction, support, and lockdown are standout features.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Luka 1 is a stable hoop shoe that caters to players who prefer responsive performance. It offers extra support but isn't the bounciest.

name: LZ Hoops
description: Overall, I enjoyed playing in the Jordan Luka 1. The support and lockdown feel comfortable with every move I made, and the materials are lightweight.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Jordan Luka 1 is a solid shoe for players who value stability. The traction is versatile, and the shoe is plenty supportive.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I had a great time playing in the Jordan Luka 1 because of the traction. The shoe feels minimal and cozy, but the fit didn't work out for me.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 10 is the best performer of the season. It might be the best shoe we've ever tested. The cushioning feels perfect, and the fit and traction are excellent too.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 10 is definitely an upgrade when compared to the Way of Wade 9. This shoe is a versatile performer that can play well for both nimble and aggressive players.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 10 is a top performer for players that only play on indoor wooden courts. I had a lot of fun playing with this cushion and material setup.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, the Li-Ning Way of Wade 10 is such a fun shoe to play in. It feels quick, the support features are there, and the cushioning is fantastic.

name: Allen Sison [weartesters.com]
description: The more I played in the Li-Ning Way of Wade 10, the more I became convinced they would be top-tier shoes. I love the reliable traction and bouncy cushioning.

name: Jeremy Jones
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 10 is a top performer. The traction grips, the cushioning is balanced, and the support is locked down.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 10 is a potential contender for the best basketball shoe of 2022. The cushioning is incredibly bouncy, the materials are lightweight, and the traction feels grippy.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Nike Precision shoe is an excellent shoe for its price range. The shoe is comfortable, and my movement felt great in them.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: If you're looking for a lightweight and responsive shoe, the Nike Precision 6 is one of the best you can get for the money. Anybody that needs any cushioning should avoid this shoe, though.

name: RicheeKim
description: I highly recommend the Nike Precision 6 for the price. It should be a solid option for outdoor play and players on a budget.

name: RunStretchTech
description: I had a lot of fun playing in the Puma MB.01 Lo. To me, these are the perfect basketball shoe. The traction and cushion are top-notch, and the stability is fantastic.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma MB.01 Low is one of the best and most versatile performance shoes on the market. It packs an aggressive traction pattern, balanced cushioning, and support features that get the job done.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Puma MB.01 is a fantastic shoe at a great price. The traction is reliable, and the cushion offers an impressive mix of court feel and impact protection.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Puma MB.01 Lo is not a shoe I can recommend over the mid-top version. It's still a solid shoe, but the traction didn't perform as well for me on the Lo compared to the original.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V2 provides a nearly flawless experience. Some players might prefer a bit more cushion, but I had no complaints. This shoe could be New Balance's best offering yet.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The New Balance TWO WXY V2 is a fun shoe to play in, and it's a good shoe for players needing their feet to plant and grip in tight spaces such as under the rim.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the New Balance TWO WXY V2. The traction is outstanding, and all other aspects of the shoe such as cushioning and support held their own.

name: RicheeKim
description: I would say that the New Balance TWO WXY V2 is the best performer in New Balance's basketball lineup. Every performance aspect of the shoe is solid.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The New Balance TWO WXT V2 is one of the best shoes available. It has one of the best traction setups I've ever played in, but be careful if you need a lot of lateral containment.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Jordan Zion 2 is an excellent basketball shoe. I was balanced and supported the whole time. They weren't the most breathable and are a bit heavy, though.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: There's not much to complain about with the Jordan Zion 2. It's a low-to-the-ground, supportive basketball shoe with one of the best tractions available.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan Zion 2 has some of the best materials on a signature shoe to go along with being the most supportive shoe on the market.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Zion 2 has a better traction and cushion setup than the Zion 1, which makes this a great shoe to play in.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Zion 2 is a solid shoe for players that like to operate in the paint and utilize lateral movement to their advantage. They are probably the best shoe for sturdy post players.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I had a very good time playing in the Jordan Zion 2. The shoe offers a lot of support, and I was impressed with the cushioning and traction setup.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan Zion 2 is an upgrade from the Jordan Zion 1. The traction is good, the cushion feels nice, and the support is there.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: If you can try the Jordan Zion 2 on for size first, I'd recommend it as a performance basketball shoe. Just make sure that the Achilles pillows don't feel uncomfortable for you.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: In my opinion, the Jordan Zion 2 is worse than last year's model. The traction is decent, and the support was great. However, I didn't like the materials and cushioning was mediocre.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I preferred playing in the Jordan 36 Low a bit more than the Jordan 36. It's a lightweight, breathable shoe that offers bouncy cushion and grippy traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Jordan 36 Low performs almost identically to the Jordan 36. It comes down to personal preference, and I like a low-top shoe better.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan 36 Low is almost identical to the regular Jordan 36. The main difference is the Lows are not as supportive, but it has a more comfortable fit.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan 36 Low is a must-buy for most players. I can't recommend it enough, especially for the price. It's comfortable, the traction is great, and the cushion is outstanding.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Under Armour Curry 4 FloTro features some of the tackiest traction on the market. It's a shoe meant for players who utilize footwork and movement, so they may not be the best for more explosive players.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Curry 4 FloTro provides amazing performance for the price. The materials are comfortable, and the traction is outstanding. This shoe will definitely be in my rotation.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry 4 FloTro is a solid pickup. It's similar to the Curry 8 and 9 with fantastic traction. The only potential downside is the lack of impact protection.

name: TommyLiu
description: A very impressive traction and cushion setup carries the Curry 4 FloTro. It's a great performer. Just be careful with sudden lateral cuts and stops.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Under Armour HOVR Havoc 4 Clone is a great shoe for clean courts, but beware if you primarily play on dustier courts.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Under Armour HOVR Havoc 4 Clone is not a shoe I can recommend because of issues I had with the support. Everything else was pretty good. The shoe could've been much better with improved materials.

name: RicheeKim
description: For its price, the Nike Renew Elevate 3 is a solid performer. My only gripe with the shoe is the cushion. The shoe can be played indoors and outdoors without issues.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I liked the Nike Renew Elevate 3, but I wouldn't say it's a top-tier performer. It's a great option if you're looking for a budget shoe.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Renew Elevate 3 is a shifty shoe that's also fast in a straight line. The lateral containment also isn't the best. This shoe is a solid pickup for low-to-the-ground players, though.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Renew Elevate 3 will not disappoint you for the price. You can use it as a go-to budget-friendly outdoor hoop shoe.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Nike Kyrie Low 5 might be my favourite shoe in the Kyrie lineup. Its traction, comfort, and support were fantastic for me. The only drawback is the breathability.

name: Evan Miranda [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kyrie Low 5 is one of the best basketball shoes for lighter guards. It's an excellent performance shoe, but the lack of impact protection may not be the best for everyone.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: You'll feel quick and light on your feet in the Nike Kyrie Low 5. It does what every previous Kyrie Low model does, but it also features improved cushioning.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Nike Kyrie Low 5 offers incredible traction and a sturdy support setup. The cushion isn't the bounciest, but it is soft and comfortable.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: Overall, I liked the Nike Kyrie Low 5. It offers plenty of agility, traction, and support. I have no problem recommending these to players that rely heavily on footwork.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Kyrie Low 5 is a solid pickup for the price. The overall performance is a huge improvement from the previous Kyrie models.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Shifty guards will enjoy the Nike Kyrie Low 5 the most. The cushion is somewhat lacking, but the shoe plays quickly and has strong traction.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike KD 15 has something for everybody. The cushion is outstanding, and the traction grips incredibly. The shoe also accommodates almost every type of foot shape.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Nike KD 15 could very well be the best basketball this year. The shoe has great cushion and traction, and the materials are solid.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I would recommend the Nike KD 15 to any and everyone. The traction is amazing, and the cushion is incredibly comfortable.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike KD 15 is an amazing performer. The shoe feels responsive because the traction is so damn good, and the cushion is bouncy. The only downside is that my heel doesn't feel the most locked down.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Nike KD 15 is a magnificent shoe that I highly recommend. The traction is one of the best available, and the cushion is good to go right out of the box.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike KD 15 is almost a complete upgrade of the KD 14. The only downside is the heel slippage. Otherwise, the cushioning and traction are amazing.

name: SnB PH
description: I enjoyed playing in the Nike KD 15 a lot. I would highly recommend them. The traction is grippy and perfect for indoors, and the Zoom Strobel unit is bouncy, as usual.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike KD 15 is one of my favourite basketball shoes. The cushioning, traction, and support are some of the best available.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall, the Nike KD 15 feels fantastic on the court. It's fun to play in, and I definitely recommend it. The only downside is the minimal amount of heel slippage.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike LeBron 19 Low plays better than the high-top version of the shoe. The cushion setup is one of my favourites, while the support and traction are improved.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron 19 Low is best for centers and forwards, and if I'm being honest, I think they perform better than the highs.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike LeBron 19 Low is a shoe that I enjoyed playing in. The impact protection is crazy, and the materials feel minimal.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 19 Low feels nice, and the cushion setup is comfortable. The materials provide solid support and lockdown, but the traction could be better.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $160, the Nike LeBron 19 Low is a solid shoe. It offers a lot of impact protection but beware of dusty courts.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: Once I broke in the New Balance Kawhi 2, I really started to enjoy the stability, grip, and nimbleness that the shoe provides. I'd recommend this shoe for any larger players.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The New Balance Kawhi 2 is pretty damn good. There are no glaring flaws. I would definitely recommend this shoe to anyone looking for an all-around shoe.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The New Balance Kawhi 2 is a great shoe for players that rely on footwork to give them advantages. The cushion feels low to the ground, and the traction is incredible.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The New Balance Kawhi 2 is my first ever New Balance shoe, and I do not regret picking it up. If you have a stop-and-go, run-the-floor style of play, I'm sure you'll love this shoe.

name: MARKCHES
description: The only downside of the New Balance Kawhi 2 is that I wish they kept the same cushion found on the Kawhi 1. Every other aspect of the shoe is on par or better than the previous model.

name: RicheeKim
description: The New Balance Kawhi 2 is a solid performer for the price point. It's a step in the right direction for the Kawhi lineup but still isn't quite as good as the Omn1s.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The New Balance Kawhi 2 is a solid shoe, but I wouldn't say it's my favourite. It's a lightweight, supportive, and minimal shoe.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The New Balance Kawhi 2 is not flashy but gets the job done. It's one of my preferred shoes to play in because of the balanced performance it provides.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
