description: The Anta KT 7 made my footwork feel improved. The cushioning is one of the best this year, and the support and stability are fantastic.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I enjoyed playing in the Anta KT 7. It's a solid shoe with impressive traction and surprisingly comfortable cushioning.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Anta KT 7 is meant for players who like stability and cushioning. The setup is catered to non-shifty players who rely on a stable foundation.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I would recommend the Jordan Why Not 0.5 to all types of basketball players. The shoe was super responsive, and I felt explosive and quick playing in them.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: If the traction played better, the Jordan Why Not .5 would be a much better shoe. It checked all the boxes needed in a shoe, but the traction is a big con in my books.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Why Not Zero.5 offers a lot in terms of fit and comfort, but the performance is hindered by the traction.

name: RicheeKim
description: I cannot recommend the Jordan Why Not Zero.5. The traction does not bite, making it potentially dangerous to play in this shoe. It's a shame because everything else was solid.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Air Zoom GT Jump has one of the best cushion setups on the market, especially if you like Nike Zoom. It's a shoe that I'm always going to have in my bag.

name: Shoeware
description: I have no problems recommending the Nike GT Jump. Overall, I'm impressed. These are definitely worth it.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike GT Jump loads a  ton of tech into the shoe, making it one of the better shoes to come out recently. They help you pick up speed easier than any other shoe on the market. This combination is great when paired with the traction and cushion in the shoe.

name: SnB PH
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Jump has a top-tier cushion and traction that holds its own. The shoe is definitely worth the price because of the tech that Nike includes.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: Yes, I would recommend the Nike Air Zoom G.T. Jump to anyone. The cushion is the best on the market, and the shoe is versatile enough to accommodate all playstyles.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Air Zoom GT Jump is a pricey shoe that's worth every penny, in my opinion. It comes loaded with tech, and the performance reflects that.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Jump offers one of the best cushioning setups in basketball right now. The traction performs well, and the shoe feels springy. Overall, this shoe is super fun to play in.

name: RicheeKim
description: Despite being a pricier shoe on the market, I have no issues recommending the Nike Air Zoom G.T. Jump, especially if you like impact protection and cushioning.

name: SnB PH
description: Adidas definitely stepped up and redeemed themselves with the Harden Vol. 6. You get superb traction, a comfy cushion, and strong support.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Adidas has redeemed the Harden line with the Vol. 6. This shoe is a fantastic performer, and I love playing in them.

name: Shoeware
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 6 is a vast improvement from last year's shoe. Adidas is taking a step in the right direction with improved traction, cushion, and support.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 6 is the best Harden model I've played in, slightly edging out the Vol 1. There are improvements with both the traction and cushion. The only cons I can think of are the cheap-feeling materials and tight toebox.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Harden Vol 6 is best for players looking to outwork their opponents with fast footwork. The cushion and traction offer a lot of versatility. Just be sure to avoid toe drags.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 6 offers solid traction and comfort. The materials can be hit or miss depending on what you're looking for in a shoe, though.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The traction and cushion on the Adidas Harden Vol. 6 are solid, but the fit and materials aren't up to par.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike PG 6 is a shoe I can easily recommend. I didn't have to worry about anything when playing in these. They're comfortable with excellent traction and materials.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike PG 6 is a must cop for the price. I consider this shoe an early contender for the best basketball shoe of 2022.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: I would recommend the Nike PG 6 for any player and any position, especially if you like a combination of response and comfort.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike PG 6 is the best of both maximalist and minimalist worlds. It offers quick vertical movements with its grippy traction. Just be mindful that the cushion can bottom out quickly.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike PG 6 is one of the best basketball shoes for value. The support is fantastic, the fit is impressive, and the traction is reliable.

name: PureKicks
description: The cushion and traction of the Nike PG 6 excelled, but the materials let down the shoe. Overall, I still really enjoyed playing in these.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love playing in the Jordan Zoom Separate. Due to the traction and cushion, I felt quick and smooth while playing in this shoe.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Not only is the Jordan Zoom Separate a great budget model, but it's also a great shoe overall, regardless of the price point. I think Jordan Brand knocked these out of the park.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Zoom Separate is the shoe for you if you're looking for a budget shoe that provides traction, cushion, fit and stability. It is a well-rounded sneaker for the price.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Jordan Zoom Separate is a solid option for players that want to outplay their opponents with footwork. The traction performs well, and the materials help keep the shoe light and easy to play in.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan Zoom Separate is a solid budget-friendly shoe. The cushion setup provides lots of impact protection, and the traction grips well. The only downside is the quality of the materials isn't the greatest.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan Zoom Separate is a must-cop for the price. It's a great performer and has a lot to offer. The traction is beastly, and the cushion provides a welcome balance of bounce and responsiveness.

name: Gavriel Rupert Dela Cruz [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Zoom Separate is the perfect shoe for forefoot-heavy players. They have good traction, impact protection, and breathable materials that fit well.

name: Shoeware
description: The Puma MB.01 is a fantastic start to a signature shoe line. Traction and cushion are the highlights, but nothing to point out for negatives on this model.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Puma MB.01 is a solid, all-around hoop shoe with nothing to complain about besides the lack of premium materials. It features well-performing traction and cushioning at a reasonable price.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: LaMelo Ball's first signature shoe, the Puma MB.01, is amazing. I love playing in these. This is a versatile option for a number of different playstyles.

name: LZ Hoops
description: The Puma MB.01 is one of the most comfortable shoes I've worn in a long time. I think these could be one of the best first signature shoes ever.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: LaMelo Ball's Puma MB.01 is an excellent all-around shoe that players who enjoy quick, nimbler movements will enjoy. The shoe offers solid traction, and the materials perform exceptionally.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: Overall, the Puma MB.01 is a pretty damn good shoe. It offers strong traction, cushioning, and upper materials.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Puma MB.01 is a shoe that I highly recommend. It has a great balance of everything and is really fun to play in.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: Although they aren't the sleekest, the Puma Melo MB.01 does provide great balance and comfort. The cushion is a perfect balance, and the materials do a great job of keeping your feet feeling nice.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: Puma did a great job of putting together LaMelo Ball's first signature shoe. The shoe is fun to play in and has little to no downsides.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I think the Puma MB.01 is a fantastic shoe at this price point. They might just be the best budget shoe out right now.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Fly By Mid 3 is Nike's lowest-priced shoe, but don't let that fool you. This shoe was a pleasant surprise. I liked playing in these a lot more than expected.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Fly By Mid 3 is a solid performance shoe at a low retail price. The cushion surprised me, and the traction is just what you want from a basketball shoe.

name: TommyLiu
description: The Nike Fly By Mid 3 provides a bit of everything. The traction is impressive for the price, and it feels minimal overall.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: As much as I want to recommend the Nike Fly By Mid 3, I can't because of the fit and traction. It could still be worth it for those looking for an affordable budget option.

name: Gavriel Rupert Dela Cruz [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Fly By Mid 3 is an okay shoe for the price. There are better shoes at this price point, however. I'd only consider this if budget is your biggest factor.

name: KicksContestWorld
description: The Adidas Harden Stepback 3 showed great results during our tests. The traction and cushioning will be solid for guards and wings.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: I was presently surprised with the Adidas Harden Stepback 3. They might be the best budget shoe in recent memory, especially for shifty guards that rely on heavy footwork.

name: RunStretchTech
description: The Adidas Harden Stepback 3 is a comfortable budget shoe. The traction was reliable, and I enjoyed how the materials felt.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I had a good time playing in the Adidas Harden Stepback 3. The traction performed nicely, the cushion was responsive, and I enjoyed the fit. I do wish impact protection was better, though.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Kyrie 8 is an overall great feeling shoe. It provides balance with the weight while still remaining a quality performer. Cushioning and materials are the standouts for me.

name: SnB PH
description: The Nike Kyrie 8 is one of the better options from Nike this year. They give you solid traction if you keep them clean, and the underfoot cushion performs well.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: I love the Nike Kyrie 8. They are the most comfortable and functional Kyrie model to date. The traction is one of the only aspects that doesn't improve from last year, but the rest of the shoe is excellent.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Kyrie 8 performs well for players that want nimble footwork, control, traction and stability. Be aware that the shoe may not be the best for more explosive players.

name: MARKCHES
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Nike Kyrie 8. The cushioning setup is the best in the entire Kyrie lineup, and the traction performs well as always.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Kyrie 8 is a solid pickup for the price. The only downside is the break-in time needed for the traction to get going. Everything else about the shoe is awesome.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Kyrie 8 is my favourite Kyrie of all time. They are my favourite Kyrie model to play in. It should be a fantastic shoe for guards and players that don't need much torsional rigidity.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Under Armour Curry 9 is an overall improvement from the Curry 8. The traction and cushion remain fantastic, but the materials and support perform better in this year's model.

name: SnB PH
description: The Under Armour Curry 9 is one of my go-to shoes right now. The traction and cushion remain solid, and the materials are greatly improved. This shoe is definitely worth the price.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Curry 9 feels like a running shoe that has the lateral containment needed for basketball. The traction is top-tier, and the cushion feels responsive. I absolutely love playing in this shoe.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Curry 9 is pretty similar to the Curry 8 for the most part. However, there is an improvement in the materials used this year; this leads to improved support and fit.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall, the Curry 9 is an amazing performer. Everything about the shoe is an improvement from the Curry 8.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Curry 9 provides a fantastic grip for traction, and the cushion performs well in most situations. The materials feel durable and premium while remaining comfortable as well.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: If you enjoy a firmer cushion setup, I think you'll really enjoy the Curry 9. The traction and support are top-tier, and the materials get the job done.

name: SnB PH
description: Overall, I think the performance of the Adidas Dame 8 will suit many players. The shoe definitely delivers as my only gripes were minor.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall, the Adidas Dame 8 is a solid pickup at its current price point. The inconsistency with the traction is the only downside. The cushion is an improvement from last year and the fit and support were perfect.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Dame 8 is a great pick for players looking for easy push-off power or stability for hard pivoting. They're also versatile as they play well on different surfaces and can accommodate many foot shapes.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Adidas Dame 8 could have been a strong performer but are held back by the traction. I had a lot of problems when it came to slippage. Other than that, the materials are comfortable, and the cushion provides a good amount of impact protection.

name: Shoeware
description: The Dame 8 plays very similarly to the Dame 7 even with the slight changes made. Still a well-balanced shoe overall, nothing stands out in a good or bad way.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas Dame 8's Bounce Pro cushion setup is a joy to play in. However, other aspects of the shoe, such as traction and fit, are too inconsistent for me to recommend these.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: I had high hopes for the Adidas Dame 8, but the traction didn't work for me, and the materials had a lot of room for improvement.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Kyrie Flytrap 5 is a responsive and lightweight shoe. The traction is solid when on clean courts, and the cushion performs well enough for players that play low to the ground.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Kyrie Flytrap 5 is a solid budget shoe for anyone who likes to play in a firmer and more responsive shoe. Almost all aspects performed adequately, but I wish the cushion and fit were better.

name: Shoeware
description: The Kyrie Flytrap 5 gives you about what you can expect from a shoe that is $90. The traction and cushion aren't anything special, but the support holds up well to play in.

name: Gavriel Rupert Dela Cruz [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kyrie Flytrap 5 is a shoe that I can only recommend to wide-footers who enjoy minimal cushioning. For everybody else, there are a lot of better shoes out there.

name: SnB PH
description: The Nike LeBron 19 has plenty of tech and provides the best impact protection you can find right now. However, the traction can be suspect, and they are heavy.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 19 is one of the best shoes in the LeBron line in recent years. The cushioning setup is lower to the ground without sacrificing any impact protection, but the biggest improvement is the stability that they feature.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike LeBron 19 doesn't quite fit my playstyle. They do provide impact protection and would be a solid pick for players that enjoy extra cushioning.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, the Nike LeBron 19 is a fun shoe to play in. It provides a crazy amount of bounce, and the cushion feels fantastic. The traction and weight do hold the shoe back, though.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron 19 offers a lot of tech, especially in the mid and outsole. It's a maximalist shoe that provides plenty of energy return, but it may not be the best shoe for those that rely on speed up and down the court because of the weight.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike LeBron 19 provides an unreal cushioning experience in terms of comfort, but the traction is disappointing. They remain one of the best shoes for those that value impact protection.

name: RicheeKim
description: Not even the crazy cushion and improved support of the LeBron 19 could make me recommend this shoe. For the price, the traction is just not good.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Overall, I can't recommend the Nike LeBron 19 because of the traction. If you need an awesome cushion setup with a lot of support, this shoe could work for you.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan One Take 3 is a solid pickup for the price. In my opinion, it is the best One Take model yet. The traction bites hard, and the cushion setup performs well for the price range.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Jordan One Take 3. They felt like an extension of my foot with the grippy traction and responsive cushion. The materials are also minimal and support and lockdown were not an issue at all.

name: RunStretchTech
description: Overall, the Nike LeBron Witness 6 is comfortable and gets the job done for the price. It's a good option for outdoor play.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 6 has a lot of stability enhancements this year, but it can still be a bit unstable. However, this is a great shoe to beat up on outdoor courts.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 6 is a step down from the previous model in the Witness line. The shoe's instability combined with the underperforming traction leaves much to be desired. Even for the $100 price point, I can't recommend this shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 6 is not a shoe I can recommend, even at its lower price point. The traction works well, but the lateral stability and cushion are lacking.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Nike LeBron Witness 6 is a great-looking shoe, and can definitely be worn casually. However, I cannot recommend it for playing basketball. The cushion feels unstable and not supportive underfoot.

name: RunStretchTech
description: For the price, this is one of the better shoes I've played in this year. I was surprised at just how well the traction performed.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: Overall, I would recommend the Nike Air Max Impact 3 for anybody in the market for a budget sneaker. The only downside is that the impact protection could be better.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Air Max Impact 3 is just okay for the price. It's personally not my favourite, but I'd say go for it if you are a fan of Air Max units and strong traction.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Overall, the Jordan 36 might be my favourite basketball shoe to play in right now. The traction is one of the best on the market and responsive cushioning.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Jordan 36 is a fantastic overall shoe. It offers traction, support, and cushioning. I don't think you can go wrong, especially considering the materials.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Jordan 36 is one of my favourite shoes to play in right now. They're lightweight, they have a nice bite, and I love the cushion setup.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The latest entry in the Air Jordan line is a strong performer, just like the previous two models. The full-length Zoom Air Strobel is amazing. The traction is outstanding. Materials are durable. There really aren't any downsides to this shoe.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Jordan brand continues to deliver with the 36. The traction is consistent. There's plenty of impact protection, and the materials make it incredibly lightweight. It's a strong performer overall.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: Compared to many other releases this year, the Jordan 36 is a stand-out shoe. The shoe gives you a lot of push-off power and performance. The only downside is that the comfort doesn't keep up with the excellent performance.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Air Jordan 36 is a great performer. It's fun and bouncy, and I can't get enough of the cushion setup.

name: LZ Hoops
description: Overall, the Jordan 36 is a great shoe for big men and forwards. It provides impact protection, and there really aren't any major issues with the traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Puma Fusion Nitro is a responsive feeling shoe that provides solid traction. There is a nice amount of court feel. However, the caging of the midsole cushion takes away from the impact protection.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma Fusion Nitro is a letdown compared to the Clyde All-Pros. The traction and cushion are great, but they don't work well with the rest of the shoe.

name: SnB PH
description: The Adidas Trae Young 1 might be the best shoe available in its price range. I consider this pair to be the best Adidas shoe for 2021.

name: Shoeware
description: The Trae Young 1 offers extremely nice cushioning. The traction plays a little worse than expected, and the support isn't ideal with only two lacing holes, but it's still a solid performer with some premium touches for materials.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas Trae Young 1 is excellent for players that like to stay low to the ground and play fast in confined spaces. Just make sure to break them in beforehand.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Adidas Trae Young 1 is a stable sneaker. It feels low to the ground, which works well with the Lightstrike cushion in the forefoot. Just make sure to get the right size.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, the Adidas Trae Young 1 feels great on foot. When playing on clean courts, the shoe feels low to the ground, responsive, and comfortable.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Trae Young 1 is awesome in every way but the traction. I really like the materials, the fit and support are good, and the cushion shined.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: For the Adidas Trae Young 1, the traction works, the cushion offers impact protection and court feel, and the upper feels good for the most part.

name: RicheeKim
description: For the price, the Under Armour Flow FUTR X is a solid shoe. If you don't need a lot of impact protection, this shoe will be perfect for you. It has amazing traction, the fit is solid, and it's plenty supportive.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Under Armour Flow FUTR X is great for indoor courts and provides an above-average energy return while remaining lightweight and stable.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The traction is top tier, the cushion is responsive, and the support was good. Despite the materials, the Under Armour Flow FUTR X is a definite cop.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Exhibit A is a refreshing entry into the Adidas basketball lineup. It's lightweight with great traction and materials. The cushion is comfortable and playable but could be better. Overall, the shoe is a reliable performer.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Exhibit A is a solid performer for the price. It has a great cushion if you want to feel quick and shifty. The traction is reliable, and the support has everything need in a hoop shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas Exhibit A is good but is just below the top-tier. The traction gets the job done, the cushion is responsive, and the materials perform well for the quality.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Adidas Exhibit A is a shoe that offers an excellent cushioning setup, but the mediocre traction is a letdown.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $100, this is a fantastic option. It is one of the best D Rose shoes to come out in recent years. It plays quickly and offers plenty of court feel though the impact protection could be better. But for the price, it's hard to beat the Adidas D Rose Son of Chi.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, the Adidas D Rose Son of Chi has good traction and feels responsive. The support is good as well. It just isn't the most minimal feeling shoe in terms of materials.

name: Shoeware
description: The D Rose Son of Chi has nice traction, but the cushion isn't anything special. The support plays well enough, but you can tell the materials aren't the best.

name: SnB PH
description: Donovan Mitchell's latest shoe is a step up from last year's model, but the Adidas DON Issue #3 doesn't live up to the original. It has solid traction and adequate cushioning that will suit guard play.

name: MARKCHES
description: Overall, the D.O.N Issue #3 is a steady basketball shoe. It has dependable traction with a wide base. The cushion and support were also dependable for me.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Adidas D.O.N Issue #3 has great traction and comfortable materials. It felt comfortable on foot, but the cushion doesn't hold up after playing more than three games at a time. The heel slippage also takes away from the shoe a bit. Overall, it is a responsive shoe that feels light on your feet.

name: RicheeKim
description: As long as you consistently wipe, you're getting a good-performing shoe. The shoe feels light, the traction performs well enough, and the materials feel nice. The only issue to consider is that there is the potential for heel slippage.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The D.O.N Issue #3 is a lightweight shoe that provided a decent amount of court feel with the Lightstrike midsole. However, the traction, fit, and heel lockdown left a lot to be desired.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 3 provides a good amount of tech at an affordable price point. They're an upgrade both performance-wise and aesthetics-wise compared to previous models. The cushion feels great, the materials get the job done, and the traction performs well after breaking it in. These are definitely a shoe going into my rotation.

name: SnB PH
description: In my opinion, the Nike Zoom Freak 3 makes major improvements compared to the Zoom Freak 2. The traction is close to being a top-tier performer, and the cushion is nice and bouncy. I'd definitely recommend it.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 3 is one of my favourite shoes to hoop in right now. The cushion is bouncy, the traction is one of my favourites on the market right now, and in my opinion, they look pretty darn good.

name: Shoeware
description: The Zoom Freak 3 is good, not great. The traction is inconsistent. There is good breathability for your foot and good support.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Zoom Freak 3 is a solid shoe at its current price point. The traction was inconsistent, but the materials, fit, and support make up for it. Overall, Nike did a good job of upgrading the shoe from the Zoom Freak 2.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 3 is a lightweight and minimal shoe. The traction was inconsistent for me, and I was disappointed in the cushion. However, I did like the materials, and the shoe has a great fit.

name: LZ Hoops
description: Overall, the Nike Zoom Freak 3 is a decent shoe if you have a similar playstyle to the Freak himself. The traction performs well, but the support of the shoe was a letdown.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Run isn't too impressive straight out of the box, but after breaking them in, they slowly become better. There is plenty of cushioning, and the traction becomes solid.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall, the Nike Air Zoom G.T. Run is a really nice shoe. The only gripes I have are the less-than-premium materials and the traction when on dirtier courts. Other than that, you get tonnes of cushion, the support and lockdown are good, and the fit is solid.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: If you're looking for a crazy cushioning setup, the Nike Air Zoom G.T. Run is the shoe for you. It's a solid shoe for anyone who doesn't mind giving up some court feel and responsiveness to get more impact protection and bounciness.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike Air Zoom GT Run is a solid shoe for those that are looking for an explosive setup and rely on a lot of jumping in their game.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Zoom GT Run offers solid traction while it lasts and plenty of impact protection. It could be more premium, but it performs well enough.

name: Shoeware
description: The G.T. Run is the worst performer of the 3 Greater Than models. The shoe has good cushioning and traction. However, the support isn't easy to trust with how thin the materials are.

name: Gavriel Rupert Dela Cruz [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality is one of the best signature athlete budget models available. It performs just as well as some signature models despite lacking the same tech that they feature. Definitely a great bang for your buck type of shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: When you're playing in the Giannis Immortality, you feel very light and really quick. The traction is amazing, and the cushion is responsive. Support could've been a bit better, but it wasn't a deal-breaker. I really like this shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Giannis Immortality is a pretty decent budget model. However, there are other shoes at the price point that do outperform the shoe. The cushion and materials feel nice, but I did have issues with support.

name: Shoeware
description: The Giannis Immortality is a solid performer in the subline of Giannis's Zoom Freak line with Nike. These also provide lateral containment and consistent traction while also feeling light.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: Although I was disappointed in the cushion, the Nike Kyrie Low 4 still provides a smooth, lightweight experience. The traction, fit, and support combine to make this shoe a decent performer at a reasonable price.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Kyrie Low 4 is a pretty low to the ground, responsive setup, but doesn't provide much bounce or compression. It plays very fast and the shoe itself is very lightweight thanks to the thin materials. It's still a shoe I really liked playing in despite being a bit disappointed in the cushion.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Kyrie Low 4 is an overall good performer. One thing to note is that the shoe isn't the best for impact protection, but it does offer a lot of responsiveness, and the support is great.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Curry 3Z5 is an amazing shoe for only $80. The traction is phenomenal. The Micro G feels soft and responsive like the Micro G of old, and the fit was perfect. The only downside is that the heel area was a bit uncomfortable when I was breaking it in. Overall, the shoe felt amazing.

name: RicheeKim
description: At a retail price of $80, the Curry 3Z5 is a solid shoe. I have no complaints outside of the dust pickup on dirtier courts, but that's just nitpicking since it still performed nicely.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Air Zoom GT Cut is my favourite Nike basketball shoe this year. It offers a Kobe-like setup that's lightweight with fantastic cushioning. The traction holds up, and the shoe is comfortable right out of the box.

name: LZ Hoops
description: The Nike Air Zoom G.T. Cut is a perfect indoor basketball shoe. They are the definite best shoe to release in 2021 for shifty and quick players who emphasize lockdown, cushion, and traction.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: If you love the Kobe 8, you'll love these. The shoe does an excellent job of providing a low-profile, lightweight setup that still provides a decent amount of cushioning. However, I would recommend playing indoors to get the most out of the traction.

name: Shoeware
description: The Nike Air Zoom GT Cut is as close to a Kobe as it gets. The cushion is one of the best on the market, and the traction performed well. These kill it on the court.

name: MARKCHES
description: For people that like low-profile sneakers, this is a must-have in your collection. The cushion is an amazing combination of responsiveness and bounce, and the traction performs very well. The only thing to watch out for is that the shoe does fit snug.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This a top-tier performer. The cushion is phenomenal and the traction performs really nice as long as you wipe to keep dust from building up. It can get a little tight in the forefoot area, but not enough to take away from the performance.

name: Shoeware
description: This review is for outdoor performance. The Nike Air Zoom GT Cut is easily worth the money. I don't use the word often, but these are fantastic. The traction holds up well, and the cushion is one of the best available.

name: RicheeKim
description: The cushion in this shoe is one of the best setups for fast and shifty players. It's a great performer but is a bit expensive coming in at $170 retail. However, I feel the performance makes the shoe worth it.

name: KickGenius
description: The shoe very much feels like a budget model. There are certain aspects of the shoe that could have been done much better, but the mid-tier tech is what was put in the shoe instead.

name: Soled Out Reviews
description: The Jordan Zion 1 is one of my favourite shoes. The cushioning is comfortable, and the lockdown and stability are solid.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Every aspect of this shoe is solid. There is nothing amazing about this shoe, but there's nothing bad about it either. For $120 you get a solid first signature shoe that works for all types of players.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: If you want a comfortable shoe that provides a lot of bounce and protection, this is a great shoe to pick up. On the flip side, because the cushion is very bouncy, the shoe does feel a bit slow. Couple that with the traction not being the most consistent, this shoe may not be the best fit for everyone.

name: Shoeware
description: The Jordan Zion 1 is a good place to start Zion's signature shoe line. This is a well-balanced performer.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: Overall, if you like a firmer cushion setup, I think you'll enjoy the Jordan Zion 1. The shoe is super supportive, and the rubber is solid enough that it could be a decent outdoor pair.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Zion 1 is a solid first signature shoe and was fun to play in. I just wish that they had used more premium materials.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Jordan Zion 1 provides a smooth ride that leads you into the extra bottom-loaded Zoom unit in the forefoot for some extra nice pop. However, its shortcomings are a bit too much to overcome. The fit is not versatile enough to accommodate more types of foot shapes and I experienced quite a bit of slipping with the traction and in the heel area of the shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $90 retail this is a solid pickup. The firm cushioning feels like a downgrade to me, everything else is an upgrade from previous KD Trey 5 models.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The KD Trey 5 IX is a solid performer. This shoe might be for you if you are looking for a lightweight, minimal, and affordable shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas N3XT L3V3L is a good performer and I enjoyed playing in them. They are pretty expensive at $180 though, and they didn't perform well enough to crack my rotation. They also aren't the best for guards because they're pretty bottom-heavy.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Adidas N3XT L3V3L Futurenatural is a tremendous step forward for laceless performance shoes. The only obvious downside that I experienced was the weight of the shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: If you've ever tried the N3XT L3V3L line you know what to expect performance-wise with these. For $180, I probably wouldn't recommend them because of the price and the stiff cushion setup.

name: Shoeware
description: The Adidas N3XT L3V3L Futurenatural almost feels like the laceless version of the Harden Vol. 5, but with slightly better materials and a laceless upper.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike KD 14 is one of the best shoes of 2021 so far. The cushion feels like a springy marshmallow, the traction was fantastic, the support and lockdown were great. The shoe does everything well from a performance basketball perspective.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Every aspect of the KD14 performs really well and I like it better than the KD13. The cushion feels awesome and the traction and fit work well after a short break-in period. Also, the $150 price is fair considering all the tech you are getting.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The KD 14 might be my #1 favorite shoe to play in right now! Awesome traction, minimal materials, and responsiveness without compromising impact protection - I absolutely love playing in them!

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Nike KD 14 provides excellent grip, stability, and cushion - especially when moving from side to side. It also does this without compromising much at all performance-wise.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: I definitely recommend the Nike KD 14. They have one of the best tractions out right now and a fantastic cushion. The support is also solid with the cheap-feeling materials being the only con.

name: Shoeware
description: Overall, the Nike KD 14 is another step forward in Kevin Durant's shoe line. They're light on foot, breathable, and the traction is great.

name: RicheeKim
description: The KD 14 is very comfortable, a lot of fun to play in, and just a great shoe overall.

name: KickGenius
description: The KD 14 is one of the most versatile shoes out right now. It has the best technology that Nike has to offer, making it so that everyone can play in the shoe regardless of position. I feel like the KD 14 has something to offer for everyone and it's one of my favorite shoes to play in right now.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $70 retail, this is a banger of a shoe. If you are looking for impact protection, this shoe isn't for you. But everything else is really nice. The Nike Precision 5 is a great to shoe to play in and I honestly can't believe that it's only $70.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: If the Precision 5 was $120, I'd still recommend it because it performs extremely well. The only thing that's lacking is the cushion - and it's not that bad.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: Overall, the Nike Precision 5 has solid traction and a decent cushion. The materials also weren't bad for a budget shoe, but the fit is wonky.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: Guards that are looking for court feel and traction will enjoy this shoe. I highly recommend playing in the Puma Court Rider.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, it is a comfortable and cozy feeling shoe, but it wasn't very responsive because the traction didn't perform well. The cushion is also pretty minimal, but that's understandable for a budget shoe like the Court Rider. I didn't really like playing in this shoe considering there are plenty of good options in the budget shoe price range.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Under Armour Spawn 3 retails for just $100 and for the price it's a banger! A very very good performer - I have nothing bad to say about these.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Go get a pair! The Under Armour Spawn 3 is freaking phenomenal. My only minor issues are the heel curve and the durability of the outsole for outdoor use.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, I have loved playing in the Nike Cosmic Unity. They provide the stability and cushion I want and love. There's nothing I can complain about!

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity retails for $150 and is a really solid shoe for the price. The only thing I didn't like in these was the traction on dust. I'm hoping the other colorways have better traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Cosmic Unity is super nice! Similar to the KD 13, but better quality and a little bulkier. I feel like any position or type of player would enjoy playing in these. These will be in my rotation and I really liked playing in them.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Cosmic Unity is a great shoe. The cushion felt very good after breaking them in, and the materials feel premium. My only complaint about the shoe is the extra weight coming from the protruding heel cup.

name: Gavriel Rupert Dela Cruz [weartesters.com]
description: Whether youre a LeBron fan, a person who likes impact protection, or a newbie looking for a shoe thatll get you started, I can definitely recommend these.

name: RicheeKim
description: The LeBron 18 Low retails for $160 and they are a pretty good performer. The materials could've been a bit better, but from a performance standpoint, they are really good.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The LeBron 18 Low performs pretty well and I enjoyed playing in it. They will be in my rotation pretty loosely because I prefer other cushion setups, but overall these are solid.

name: AnotherPair [Youtube]
description: Overall the New Balance Two Wxy is a great all-around performer that any type of player can play in!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall the New Balance TWO WXY is very minimal and lightweight on foot and performs very well. Most types of players and play styles should be able to play in these. I'd 100% recommend getting them.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: For $110, the PG 5 has a good amount of tech, really nice cushioning, and performs well in all aspects. There is some room for improvement when it comes to the quality of the materials.

name: RicheeKim
description: The PG 5 is a very solid performer. I wish the materials were a bit nicer, but at a $110 price point, I can't complain!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The PG 5 is a very solid performer. They are lightweight and I never had to worry when I played in them. Overall, there weren't many bad things I could say about these.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The PG5 is very good in most areas with the only downside being that the cushion didn't really perform well outdoors. They should be very good if you are playing indoors.

name: PureKicks
description: The Nike PG5s cushion and traction are incredible. The materials perform nicely on the court as well. The shoe has just about everything you need from your hoop shoe.

name: MARKCHES
description: Overall, the shoe has durable materials, is very supportive, and the cushion provides very nice impact protection. The traction actually grips very hard and is very stable to play in.

name: RunStretchTech
description: Li-Ning's Way of Wade 9 Infinity is a pricey shoe, but it provides plenty of performance and durability for the price.

name: Foot Doctor Zach
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 9 performs well for players looking for front-to-back speed, but they aren't the best for those that like to feel low to the ground.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 9 Infinity is a solid all-around shoe. The traction bites, the cushion is alright, and the support is there too.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade 9 offers premium features and materials. It could be lighter, and the cushion could be a bit more responsive, but I have no complaints other than that.

name: Schwollo
description: The Harden Volume 5 uses "new tech" for the sake of using "new tech". At $130 these aren't super expensive, but they don't do anything better than their predecessors and that is generous. I don't recommend these.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really wanted to like the Harden Volume 5, but I'm super disappointed with the performance of these. I'll probably never ball in them again, and I don't recommend them.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Harden Vol. 5 retails for $130 and considering the problems I had, these are a no go. I highly recommend staying away from this shoe unless you are a big Harden fan.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Harden Vol. 5 comes in at $130 which isn't bad for a signature shoe but is too much considering the performance of these. Unless you're a diehard Harden fan I can't see anyone hooping in these.

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Kobe 6 Protro is an outstanding performer. It takes a few hours to break in, but I love the traction, cushioning, and fit.

name: Lukas Simoner
description: The Nike Kobe 6 Protro is my go-to shoe for games. I love the traction performance, and the cushioning moulds to my foot.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Kobe 6 Protro is a great performer and I really enjoyed every single aspect of the shoe. The traction is amazing and the cushion feels nice and smooth. It's a good blend of court feel, responsiveness, and impact protection. I don't regret getting these at all.

name: MARKCHES
description: I really liked playing in the Kobe 6 Protro. It is a low-profile shoe that has the right balance of responsiveness, bounciness, and impact protection. The only downside is that it's hard to get your hands on a pair.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Harden Stepback 2 retails for $80 and I would definitely recommend it. You get solid all-around basketball shoes that perform better than the much more expensive Harden Vol. 5.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For only $80 retail, the Harden Stepback 2 is a great performer. They are a little bottom heavy and I had some heel slippage issues, but other than that, I really like this shoe!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Why Not Zero.4 is a solid performer. I especially liked the double-stacked Zoom units!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $130, I wouldn't recommend the Why Not Zero.4 just because of the inconsistent traction. It was just enough to cause me to not enjoy playing in the shoe. If you are a very linear player who doesn't make a lot of lateral movements you can probably get away with these.

name: PureKicks
description: The Jordan Why Not Zero.4 does the job done, and it does it well. The materials and cushion excel, but the lack of a consistent laced-up fit leads to inconsistent support. If you can lace it up properly, the performance shouldn't be an issue.

name: ShadeSnSoleS [Youtube]
description: The Jordan One Take 2 is a good shoe for the price. The cushion could be a bit lower to the ground, and the materials could be of better quality. But, they perform well enough at the $100 price tag.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, the Jordan One Take 2 is a downgrade from the previous One Take. If you make a lot of lateral cuts, this isn't the traction for you. The materials feel cheaper than the previous model, and the cushion isn't as good either. It's definitely a disappointing follow-up to the great budget option that the Jordan Westbrook One Take was.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The forefoot cushioning makes this a great shoe for guards, but allows it to be versatile enough for bigs that like to use their quickness. If price isn't an issue, it's a really good shoe.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: At $160, you are getting a phenomenal hoop shoe. Pretty much every aspect of the shoe is really good. If I had to describe the Curry 8 in one word it would be fluid.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I absolutely love the Curry 8. The traction is amazing and will work outdoors. It also features great cushioning with the new Flow technology. There are 2 main differences between the 8 and previous Curry shoes. The first is that the upper is much lighter on the 8 and the second is that the 8 gives you both cushioning and court feel.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry 8 is $20 more expensive than the Curry 7 and it's totally worth it! The traction and the cushion are highlights of the shoe. If you pick up a pair of these I don't think you'll be disappointed.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Curry 8 is awesome. The traction is insane and the cushion is super nice. If you are a guard you will definitely like playing in these!

name: Schwollo
description: The Curry 8 was very close to being great. It was supposed to feel like a running shoe and it definitely did, but to a fault. I loved the traction and the shoe, but it fell short in too many categories to justify $160.

name: RicheeKim
description: Personally, I like the D Rose 11 better than the 10. For $120 I don't think you'll be disappointed with these. Just watch out for the break-in period with the traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I'm not a huge fan of the D Rose 11 (or any D Rose since the 7). If you have wide feet and like a roomier fit then you will probably enjoy these more than I did. The cushion and traction are nice though.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Zoom Rize 2 is my personal favorite shoe to play in right now. It has all the necessary features to be enjoyed by bigger post players like Marc Gasol or Nikola Jokic while also appealing to faster, downhill-type guards like Russell Westbrook.

name: MARKCHES
description: If you like minimal, lightweight, low-cut basketball shoes with a traditional look and lacing system, then the Nike Rize 2 is a great pick.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I've been calling the Puma Clyde All-Pro the Kobe 9 reincarnate since the first time I played in them. The Kobe 9 was one of the best basketball shoes of all time and the Puma Clyde All-Pro is a better version of it!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Puma Clyde All-Pro was one of my favorites shoes I've tested this year and it is only $130. Plus I feel like every type of player would enjoy hooping in these. I 100% recommend these.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Puma Clyde All-Pro is a beastly performer and very well balanced!

name: MARKCHES
description: Overall, I really like the All-Pro. The cushion and the upper are very good upgrades from the Hardwood. It's bouncy, responsive, and has plenty of impact protection. It's very stable and provides more than enough support. I'm really impressed with the Puma All-Pro.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 9 is a shoe that's definitely going in my rotation. I love this shoe. It can accommodate every position and playstyle.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Li-Ning Way of Wade All City 9 is a solid all-around sneaker. It has traction and cushion, and it's a fast shoe.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Kyrie 7 is the best hoop shoe in his line to date. Performance-wise, these do it all!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really like the Kyrie 7. They feel like an upgraded version of the Kyrie 6 with just okay traction. A very good performer overall!

name: RicheeKim
description: You are getting a very solid performer for $130. My only gripe with the shoe was the traction on dust, but overall the Kyrie 7 is a great hoop shoe.

name: KickGenius
description: The Kyrie is a very dependable sneaker. There really isn't much that it truly excels at and there are better options. It is one of the most consistent lines Nike has to offer. Overall, the shoe is going to do what you want and need it to do.

name: PureKicks
description: Like previous iterations, the Nike Kyrie 7 is a great performing shoe. Its traction is consistent, the cushion is responsive, and the fit and materials help to provide a good support system.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Lebron Witness 5 is a really nice shoe to play in even for a budget shoe at $100. I would definitely recommend these.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $100, the Lebron Witness 5 is a pretty solid shoe - I would definitely recommend them!

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: I'd recommend the Kawhi 1 to everyone who is okay with a little bit of break-in time. They will be good for any playing style and especially cater to bigger athletes looking for more support.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I didn't like playing in the Kawhi, especially for $160. If you need a rigid and supportive shoe then these are for you, but if not I'd stay away from these.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Kawhi retails for $160 and is a great performer. For the price I expected a little more, but overall these are nice.

name: MARKCHES
description: The New Balance Kawhi 1 is a good first entry in Kawhi's signature line. It's a supportive and secure shoe with a decent cushion that provides impact protection. The traction also grips nicely, and the compound appears to be durable.

name: RicheeKim
description: Personally, I wouldn't play in the Kyrie Flytrap 4 because of the stiff cushion, but if you want a pair of shoes to beat up these aren't bad for $90.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I'd recommend not getting the Kyrie Flytrap 4. I'd suggest the Flytrap 3 instead just because of the traction and cushion.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This is my favorite LeBron to play in! The only drawbacks are the weight, lateral stability, and court feel. Everything else performed well and I enjoyed playing in it. I'd 100% recommend these.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Lebron 18 is a bad boy with an amazing cushion and solid traction. The lateral instability was the only thing holding them back from being an all-out beast.

name: PureKicks
description: The LeBron 18 provides plenty of cushioning but is a heavy shoe because of it. Despite this, it's a good shoe that can fit a variety of play styles if you can handle the support and lack of court feel.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The LeBron 18 is definitely a big boy shoe. The cushion is by far the best aspect of the shoe and the traction is solid too. The digging of the tongue into my foot and lateral stability were issues though.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall for $200 I wouldn't recommend the LeBron 18. The tongue was pretty uncomfortable, the traction wasn't great, and the lateral containment was an issue. Pick these up if you want a crazy cushion setup.

name: KickGenius
description: I would not recommend this shoe to just about anyone. I'd only say get these if you need the extra cushion underfoot and are in dire need of impact protection. It really depends on your play style. Based on my personal preference, however, I didn't like the lack of court feel and responsiveness of the LeBron.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Jordan 35 comes in at $180 which is definitely expensive, but if you want a great performer these are it. This shoe excels in all areas and I think everyone can play in it.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan 35 is an updated version of the 34 and excels in almost every category. Unfortunately, the fit issue with the nylon cables ruined my ability to be comfortable in the shoe.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall, the Jordan 35 performs really well. It has better cushion and materials than the 34, but I didn't like the eclipse plate as much because it was uncomfortable at times.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan 35 retails for $180 which is pretty steep, but this is a really nice shoe that performs well. Everything about the shoe is amazing besides the traction on dust. Overall, it was extremely fun to play in the AJ XXXV.

name: MARKCHES
description: The strong points for the sneaker are that the forefoot Zoom unit keeps you close to the ground while staying bouncy, and the upper materials are comfortable and do a good job of keeping you contained. That being said, there are some inconsistencies with the traction, and the insole takes a little bit of breaking in. Overall, the Jordan 35 is an improvement from the 34.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110 the Dame 7 is definitely a recommended pickup. I don't think you'll be disappointed!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in these! Everything performed well and I think every position player can play in these.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Kyrie Low 3 retails for $110 and I think you get a pretty solid performer for the price. The only issues I had with these were the narrowness because of my slightly wide feet and the lack of impact protection.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall the Kyrie Low 3 is very similar to the Kyrie Low 2, but slightly improved. I liked the materials better and they were more comfortable.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The RS Dreamer is one of the best looking hoop shoes of 2020. If PUMA can improve their cushion setup then they will be a serious contender to Nike, Jordan, and Adidas. You will be satisfied if you pick up the RS Dreamer!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $120, I'd say go get a pair of the RS Dreamer because these are really fun to play in. Overall these are a solid pair of shoes if you like feeling light on your feet.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The RS Dreamer is a solid all-around shoe. The great traction and support make for a shoe that almost anyone can play in. My only issues were that they are pretty heavy and the cushion setup isn't great.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall the LeBron Soldier 14 is a very solid performer for $140 and a lot of fun to play in.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Lebron Soldier 14 wasn't my favorite shoe to ball in because of the traction and the stiff heel cushioning. Not the best fit for guards, but if you're a big dude then I think these would be pretty nice.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron Soldier 14 is a solid performing shoe. Despite not being a mainline LeBron signature, Nike didn't cut any corners on the cushion in this model. The traction is also what you'd come to expect from the Soldier line. It's grippy and durable. Overall, I really enjoyed playing in this shoe.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, I think Under Armour did very well with the Embiid 1. The traction and the cushion were high points of the shoe and everything else is solid all-around. Any player and position can wear these and they're good for outdoor use too.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Embiid 1! It's a really supportive and responsive shoe that you never have to worry about. Solid all around and will be loosely in my rotation.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Embiid 1 is a solid shoe especially for the price of $120. Every aspect of these performed pretty well and they were ready to go out of the box. Any position or player can play in these.

name: MARKCHES
description: The use of Micro G and HOVR provided a great cushioning setup that provided plenty of impact protection while still being bouncy. The traction played well after breaking in, and the materials feel nice when playing. Although, I do wish they were a bit more premium. Overall, the Embiid 1 is built well for performance basketball.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Embiid 1 retailed for $120, but I can't recommend them because of the traction issues I had. If you play on really clean courts then you should be fine, but otherwise, you'll probably have issues.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Kybrid S2 is a well-performing hoop shoe. I liked the combination of the Kyrie 4, 5, and 6! The cushion and the traction could have been a little better though.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Kyrie Kybrid S2 is a great performing shoe besides the traction. I wish they used the traction and cushion setups from the Kyrie 5 or 6 because I think those were better. I would recommend these if you play on mostly clean courts.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The D.O.N. Issue #2 definitely has some improvements over the #1, but some aspects were worse such as the traction. You're getting solid lockdown and support with these and a responsive cushioning setup. For the price of $100, you're getting a pretty good performance hoop shoe.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas D.O.N. Issue 2 is a surprise hit indoors for me. They are a great bang for your buck shoe at only $100!

name: RicheeKim
description: I had fun playing in these while I could tolerate the pain in the forefoot, but eventually I just had to switch shoes. These were solid for the price and are a good pickup if you don't have the same fit issue as me.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: It is kind of hard for me to recommend the D.O.N. Issue #2 as I didn't really enjoy playing in these. The cushioning was good, materials were a little too thick, and they are pretty heavy. If you don't mind bigger and bulkier shoes and want something that is really supportive with pretty nice cushioning than you should give these a try. They definitely weren't for me though.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: For $120, the Zoom Freak 2s is an affordable signature sneaker that offers a good amount of tech. It doesn't really have a weak point and should be good for all types of hoopers whether you are a guard or a big man. Definitely an upgrade over the Zoom Freak 1s!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 2 feels extremely light and minimal on foot and I really like it. It is one of those shoes you can put on and just focus on playing ball regardless of position. It isn't clunky or heavy on foot and just feels smooth. The only downside was that there isn't a lot of impact protection provided from this cushion setup. This shoe performs really well for the price!

name: MARKCHES
description: Nike really listened and made positive changes in the Zoom Freak 2. The support is better and your foot feels secure and locked in. The cushion is improved with the forefoot Zoom unit, and the traction grips well on most court conditions.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $120, I think you're getting a fantastic shoe with the Nike Zoom Freak 2. It's a perfect shoe for guards because you'll feel quick and responsive on your feet. If you are looking for a lot of impact protection this isn't the shoe for you. If you want to pick up a pair, I think you won't be disappointed!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The inconsistent traction never allowed me to feel safe in the Nike Zoom Freak 2. There wasn't anything else that was exciting or stood out in this shoe either.

name: RicheeKim
description: These retail for $150 which is $30 less than the original Adidas N3XT L3V3L. I think this is a step in the right direction and I you're getting a great performer for the price. This is one of the best implementations of Lightstrike and overall a unique shoe that is worth it.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall I was very surprised with the Adidas N3XT L3V3L 2020. I didn't think I would like them, but I got to playing and I really really like it. Everything was really nice and comfortable, but I did miss laces a bit. I would definitely recommend these and think that any position could play in them.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $80, this is a beastly performer. This is the best budget model available right now, even better than the KD Trey 5 VIII.

name: RicheeKim
description: For only $80, I can't complain. The materials feel budget and the Renew cushioning isn't as nice as in the KD Trey 5 VIII. But the fit, traction, and support are good.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Pro Boost Low is now my go-to hoop shoe for 2020. The traction, cushion, and fit are topped by none. I couldn't think of a bad thing about this shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Nothing stood out too much on the Adidas Pro Boost Low for me, but it performs like a beast. They were great in every category. If you're looking for a supportive, minimal shoe that you don't have to worry about than these are it. I'd 100% recommend these.

name: RicheeKim
description: At $110, the Adidas Pro Boost Low is definitely a good deal. I didn't expect a firm, responsive cushion setup out of these, but it wasn't necessarily a bad thing. Overall these have you covered if you want to feel light on your feet and quick.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Don't get it! My feet hurt a lot because of the super minimal cushioning. The traction isn't good, the materials are meh and you can get much better shoes - even at a budget price of $100.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I didn't get to play in these and I do like the design and the colorways, but for only $10 more you can get the PG4 with a much better cushioning and more premium materials.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Jordan React Elevation was a great pickup for $120. They were very, very fun to play in and I highly recommend them.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: These were a solid performer at a very good price. My favorite part was the cushion and overall the Jordan React Elevation performed well in every category. Pretty much every position can play in this shoe.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall the Nike Zoom BB NXT is a fun shoe to play in with fantastic traction and cushion! They aren't perfect, but its a good improvement step for Nike and a refreshing change of pace. I do wish they had been able to fix the lateral Zoom Air and lacing cable issues prior to releasing.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Almost everything about this shoe is awesome: the traction, the heel-to-toe-transition, the materials. But Nike just did too much with the React cushioning - it's super soft and comfortable but I didn't feel secure on lateral cuts because the midsole is so thick and unstable.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Air Zoom BB NXT is a very comfortable shoe with interesting new tech. The cushioning is insane and I really liked the traction too. The only downsides are the lacking stability on lateral cuts and the hefty retail price of $180.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike Air Zoom BB NXT is an above-average sneaker that is very comfortable and features awesome cushioning and traction. Materials and lockdown are solid but stability is an issue. Overall, a good pick for big hoopers looking for a lot of impact protection, but at a price of $180, there are better and more affordable options on the market.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Zoom BB NXT has an amazing cushion setup that feels plush and bouncy. It's a great all-around sneaker to hoop in, and it truly reminds me of the early setups of the Hyperdunk.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Under Armour HOVR Havoc 3 retails for $110 and I think you're getting a pretty solid performer for the price. I wish they had a little nicer materials and more impact protection, but everything else on the shoe was fine.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall the HOVR Havoc 3 was a solid performer for $110! It was great in pretty much all categories and didn't have any real low points.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The performance of the Adidas BYW 2.0 was really good. If you want a comfortable, supportive shoe with a nice cushioning setup and you don't mind the slightly too expensive retail price, then go for it!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $160, this is not the best shoe in this price range. But if you are a fan of a more responsive Boost cushioning or you can find this shoe on a discount - I would highly recommend it. This is a great performer and one of the best team models Adidas has put on the market in a while.

name: MARKCHES
description: I really like how the BYW 2.0 plays. It's low to the ground and still has impact protection because of the Boost. It's also well-ventilated and very stable.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Jordan One Take is a good option for anyone not looking to spend money on a signature shoe. It has solid, responsive cushioning, and the traction performed very well, even on dusty courts.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $100, the Jordan Westbrook One Take is incredible. If the traction held up better, it'd be amazing. That's my only gripe. The cushion was great for a budget model. I felt fast and responsive. The materials feel nice, and the support is there. There isn't much this shoe is missing.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Converse G4 are good performers that I enjoyed playing in. Personally they weren't as fluid or smooth as I would have liked, but I feel like all players can play in this shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $120 I would say the Converse G4 is a pretty good shoe. You get a unique shoe that performs well overall and I don't think you'll be disappointed unless you need a lot of impact protection.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The performance is off the charts: cushioning is awesome and traction is good too. The materials could have been a little bit more premium and supportive. Overall, the KD 13 is very similar to the KD12 and a phenomenal performance hoop shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: The KD 13 is a great performer! The materials are just okay, but everything else is really solid.

name: PureKicks
description: We'll say it again... arguably the greatest cushioning setup we've tested at PureKicks! Overall, this is the greatest out of box experience we've ever had. Don't miss out and make sure you cop these!

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike KD 13 improves on the KD 12 by improving stability and cushioning. It's one of my top shoes for 2020 and really has no flaws.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love this shoe! Traction seemed good, cushioning is incredible and the fit was perfect for me

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I really enjoy the Nike KD 13, but theyre not perfect. Cushioning and traction are awesome but containment and stability leave a bit to be desired.

name: RicheeKim
description: For only $90 retail, this is a really nice shoe. The cushion setup is great and traction works really well. Overall, the KD Trey 5 VIII doesn't feel like a budget model at all - I'd highly recommend picking these up if you're interested in them.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $90 this has to be one of the best budget shoes I have tried. The KD Trey 5 VII is super light and minimal and you feel very quick playing in these. This shoe doesn't feel cheap and the only downside for me was the support. Overall, a great shoe for the price and should work well for players who want to hoop outdoors.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, I found that the Nike Adapt BB 2.0 was better than the original Adapt BB, but I still dont feel that these are necessarily for me.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Traction, cushioning, support, and fit work well. But the cheap materials, the weight, and the bulkiness made it so that I couldn't enjoy playing in the Adapt BB 2.0.

name: MARKCHES
description: The cushion and support are fantastic, but the traction can be inconsistent on dustier courts. Despite this, I still enjoyed playing in the Nike Adapt BB 2.0.

name: RicheeKim
description: This shoe is nowhere near worth the $400 price tag.

name: RicheeKim
description: $170 is a steep price but I don't think you will be disappointed if you pick up the Lebron 17 Low.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The traction was really good and the cushioning was pretty damn nice. Overall, the Lebron 17 Low is a solid performer but probably not worth $170, especially considering the cheap upper materials.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 17 Low is an impressive performing sneaker. The traction is excellent, and the materials do a good job of helping you feel supportive. The cushion is not as plush as the regular LeBron 17, but they do offer more stability.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I was pleasantly surprised. For $100 retail, the Adidas Pro Model 2G performs really well and is a super solid shoe that will work for most player types!

name: Schwollo
description: The updated version of the classic Pro Model checks all the boxes compared to modern basketball shoes and gives you good traction, fun cushioning, solid support & stability, and a good fit.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Everything about this shoe is super solid. If you like the flashy and futuristic design this is a great shoe to pickup!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Why Not Zer0.3 is a really good performer. I like it a lot better than the first two models, but I still would have preferred it to be a little lighter and more minimal-feeling.

name: PureKicks
description: This is definitely my favorite Westbrook sneaker so far thanks to the amazing Zoom Turbo cushioning and aggressive traction pattern. But the main attraction of the shoe is the deconstructed style that looks amazing!

name: RicheeKim
description: The Why Not Zer0.3 is not a terrible performer overall, but the issues with lateral traction are a dealbreaker for me.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: If it wasn't for the horrible traction in my colorway I could have seen myself playing a whole lot in the Why Not Zer0.3.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Ten years later and the Nike Kobe 5 is still just as bad ass as it was before.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: This shoe truly is an updated and improved version of the Kobe V. I really like what Nike did by taking all the good things from the OG and updating traction and cushioning.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Kobe 5 again! It takes a little time to break-in, but then you get a super lightweight, minimal, and super comfortable basketball shoe.

name: Schwollo
description: Nike improved the traction of the OG Kobe 5 and changed it up with the Zoom Turbo cushioning. I give it a first-team rating!

name: Snkr Tech Talk
description: The Nike Kobe 5 Protro is one of my favourite shoes right now. The standout features are the traction and the support.

name: RicheeKim
description: This is still a great performer! But $180 is a little steep for the tech you get.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love the performance of the PG4. This is one of my favorite shoes to play in right now! Probably the most comfortable basketball shoe you can get right now.

name: PureKicks
description: The cushioning is perfect, the traction is beastly, and material, fit, and support are all above-average. If you need new shoes, I recommend the PG4!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Nike PG 4 was very solid, but not as well rounded as I would have liked. The cushion is super comfortable but the containment and support are lacking a little.

name: Schwollo
description: The PG4 is a good solid shoe with no major flaws at a fair price, but it isnt something that Id say wow, I want to hoop in these today.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Traction and cushioning are really good but materials and especially support are a little disappointing.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110, this is a really good shoe. I like the traction, the cushioning is amazing, and for a signature sneaker, the PG4 is super affordable!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $80 it's a good performer, but not as good as the Kyrie Flytrap 2.

name: RicheeKim
description: The cushioning is rock hard and the materials feel cheap. I would only recommend these for outdoor use.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall the Way of Wade 8 was fire! These are just a great hoop shoe and the traction was finally superb. These are a double thumbs up.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Way of Wade 8 surprised me and was a great shoe to play in. They are definitely expensive, but I feel like I got what I paid for in the materials and Carbon Fiber. If these sound interesting to you, I'd recommend trying them out and you might be pleasantly surprised.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, I fully enjoyed playing in this shoe and it will definitely be in my rotation. It is a very responsive shoe with great traction, cushion, and stability to back it up. The craftsmanship of the Way of Wade 8 is incredible.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: It's not my favorite hoops shoe, but it might work for guards with wider feet who are looking for a very responsive shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I don't recommend the UA Spawn 2. Cushioning was really bad, traction wasn't good, and the fit didn't work for me at all. Even at $100, there are much better performers out there!

name: RicheeKim
description: This is a great performer, especially for a budget model! I had a lot of fun playing in the Harden Stepback.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For an $80 shoe, this is a pretty good performer! Other than the traction on dust and the firm cushioning, I enjoyed the Harden Stepback a lot.

name: RicheeKim
description: If you are only playing on clean courts, I can absolutely recommend the Dame 6 because it's a great performer. If you play on dusty courts be prepared to wipe or better stay away.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Dame 6 is probably my favorite shoe in the Dame series. The Lightstrike cushioning is super nice, traction is really good on clean courts and you get all that for a very affordable price!

name: PureKicks
description: The Dame 6 is super light, comfortable and provides good traction. Unfortunately, it suffers a little from sizing issues and slightly lacking lockdown.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, I'm a fan of the Dame 6 and I think it's worth $110. But the traction of the translucent outsole and the durability of the upper material could be better.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Adidas Dame 6 is a good option for the price. The Lightstrike cushion does a good job of balancing bounce with responsiveness and court feel. It feels quick to play in because it is lightweight, but keep in mind that the traction can be inconsistent on dirtier courts.

name: Schwollo
description: Traction could be a little better and the tippy and unstable outsole might be a non-issue for a lot of players but is a no-go for my oft-injured ankles. Other than that, the Dame 6 plays very well in every category.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Traction and support should have been much better. Fit needs work and the materials are as cheap as they come. I can't recommend the Dame 6.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I like the looks of the Dame 6, but it just doesn't play good. The Lightstrike foam worked well, but the rest of the shoe was average at best and the traction was legitimately bad.

name: The Sole Brothers
