description: For $160, you get Nike's best tech: full-length Zoom Air, Flyknit materials and FlyEase lacing system.

name: RicheeKim
description: The cushioning and materials are great, but traction and fit were problematic for me. Overall, I couldn't enjoy playing in these shoes because they are just too narrow for my feet.

name: AnotherPair [Youtube]
description: These are nice shoes for casual wear, but don't wear these on-court!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Under Armour Curry 7 is a beast on-court.  Traction and support are awesome, materials work perfectly, and they fit me like a glove. Only the firm cushioning is slightly disappointing.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The performance of the Under Armour Curry 7 is really nice, especially if you are looking for a quick, minimal low-top shoe. But for $140, the materials and the cushion technology feels a little underwhelming.

name: PureKicks
description: The traction is outstanding and everything else is perfectly good. Under Armour really needs to share the secret to their rubber compound!

name: RicheeKim
description: This is a great performer with some slight problems: the materials don't feel worthy of a $140 signature model and the cushioning is very firm.

name: Schwollo
description: The Curry 7 is a solid all-around shoe with cushioning on the firmer side and some feedback/bounce.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Puma really surprised me with the Puma Clyde Hardwood. For $120, I 100% recommend this shoe!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: PUMA really nailed it with the Clyde Hardwood. A nice blend of old school leather and modern performance with beastly traction and decent cushioning.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Puma Clyde Hardwood is a great shoe. It's low to the ground, responsive, and has amazing traction. The materials are nice, and they help to create a solid fit. The only thing I wished Puma did was uncage the foam a little more.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: This is one of the best basketball shoes of 2019!

name: RicheeKim
description: This is a great performer. I would highly recommend picking up a pair, Kawhi Leonard and New Balance really knocked it out of the park!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Incredible! I really like the shoe, especially the super comfortable cushioning.

name: Schwollo
description: I loved the traction and the fit is pretty good, but cushioning is too dense for my liking and containment is seriously lacking.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kyrie 6 is a great shoe and an evolution of the Kyrie 5 with a few small improvements that are noticeable once you play in them.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: If you liked the Kyrie 4 or 5, you are going to love the Kyrie 6!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $130, I would highly recommend getting a pair of Kyrie 6's! These are one of the best performers of the year!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really liked the Kyrie 6, this shoe feels and plays like a Kyrie. The only downsides are the slight bulkiness and the traction on dusty courts.

name: Schwollo
description: The Kyrie 6 is one of the best all-around shoes Ive played in for a long time. It reminds me of the Hyperdunk line as it will work for every player type.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Kyrie 6 is an impressive performance shoe. It feels quick and provides great responsiveness. The cushion is bouncy in the forefoot while still feeling low to the ground, and the traction is amazing. There really aren't many weaknesses in the Kyrie 6.

name: PureKicks
description: We really appreciate the great traction and support and good cushioning. But fit and materials show some room for improvement.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: This is the best Air Jordan game shoe since the Air Jordan XX9. They fit well, respond perfectly and the cushioning is amazing.

name: PureKicks
description: The Air Jordan 34 is the highest-rated sneaker in the history of our youtube channel Perfect fit, perfect cushioning and near-perfect traction. It literally does everything well!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love playing in the AJ 34. This shoe feels like a Ferrari!

name: RicheeKim
description: This is the best performing Jordan model in the last few years - definitely worth the $180 price tag! This shoe is super fun to play in and should work for big guys as well as guards.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The AJ 34 is a great all-around shoe thats easy to recommend for anyone willing to pay its $180 price tag.

name: MARKCHES
description: I really liked the Jordan34. It's one of the best Jordan's in the signature line. The forefoot is bouncy, but remains responsive. They did a very good job with materials that are not only lightweight, but also supportive.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Combining fantastic cushioning, great traction, and a streamlined look - the Air Jordan 34 is worthy of the GOAT.

name: Schwollo
description: Finally, a new Jordan that does everything well and gets JB fans excited again! If you are looking for new hoops shoes, these are a safe bet because it performs well in every category, except price.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Jordan 34 is easily my favorite basketball sneaker of 2019! This shoe feels like a direct successor to my favorite shoe ever, the AJ 29.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Lebron 17 is an awesome shoe! Strongly recommended if you are looking for the best cushioning setup available and you can afford the steep $200 retail price.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: If it wasn't for the inconsistent traction I would have really enjoyed the Lebron 17. I liked everything, loved some things, but disliked the traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Lebron 17 is a great shoe - one of our favorite Lebrons. Insane impact protection, incredible traction - there's really nothing to complain about.

name: PureKicks
description: This might be the best shoe in the Lebron series!

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron 17 are very fun to play in. The combination of the traction and cushion was beastly. It is an impressive shoe 17 models into the LeBron signature lineup.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Lebron 17's just aren't going to be for everyone. How high you sit off of the ground is really jarring, but over time I did start to appreciate the Knitposite upper and the cushioning system that is pretty explosive. The Lebron 17 features the largest Air unit ever to be in a basketball sneaker, so if that caters to your playing styles I'd say check these out.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The Harden Vol. 4 is fast, controlled, and has been a personal joy to play in. In my personal experience, this is a top performer!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Harden Vol. 4 is a nice shoe - the traction is good on most surfaces, Lightstrike works but isnt overly bouncy or plush, and fit and support are good. But overall,  I can't help but feel the Harden Vol.4 took a step back from the Vol.3.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 4 is a really good performer! A perfect shoe for guards looking for a low-to-the-ground and supportive basketball shoe.

name: Schwollo
description: I think this is the best Harden so far! Outstanding traction when clean, great fit right out of the box, very stable and $10 cheaper than the V3.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I loved everything about the Harden 4 except the Lightstrike cushioning which was a little too soft and the elastic band in the midfoot which felt a little too tight and snug.

name: PureKicks
description: I am not a low-top fan, but this is the best low-top I've played in a long time!

name: MARKCHES
description: The Adidas Harden Vol. 4 is a great performer. Adidas used something other than Boost for the first time in a Harden shoe, and the Lightstrike actually felt good. It's lighter than Boost but still felt bouncy. Combined with its consistent traction and solid fit, the Harden Vol. 4 doesn't disappoint.

name: RicheeKim
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Harden Vol. 4. If you are not looking for a ton of impact protection, this is a great performer!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The D Rose 10 is much better than the D Rose 9 and will make any Derrick Rose fan happy. But if you are looking for the best bang-for-the buck shoes, there are much better options out there.

name: RicheeKim
description: Me personally, for $140, I wouldn't pick these up because there are much better performers in the same price range.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: $140 for budget tech - I don't think the D Rose 10 is a good deal.  The only thing I really liked about these shoes is the cushioning. I won't be playing a lot in the D Rose 10.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The ANTA KT signature line is very consistent, similar to Nike's Kobe signature line. Even with changing aesthetics, the performance of the shoe remains very similar. The KT5's highlights are traction and cushioning, but overall stability and fit are great as well. If you like these I would definitely recommend them as they should work great for any position or style of play.

name: MARKCHES
description: For the price, the Anta KT5 is a great performing sneaker. It offers quite the bang for your buck with excellent cushion and traction. The materials are also comfortable and help provide solid support.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $130 you're getting good materials and a comfortable signature shoe with the Anta KT 5 that is a very good overall performer. There are no real weaknesses and I really enjoyed playing in it!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Lebron Witness 4 is a very solid performer - especially for $100. If the traction was a little better, this would be a complete banger!

name: RicheeKim
description: For a $100 you get a decent performer, but even at this price range there are much better shoes out there. I didn't like the cushioning and had some issues with the traction - I can't really recommend these.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The Jumpman 2020 offers signature-worthy performance for a much lower price.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $110, this is a really good performer - highly recommended! Just watch out if you are playing a lot on really dusty courts.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110, this is a really nice performance basketball shoe! The traction is solid on clean courts and the cushioning was surprisingly good.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Zoom Rize is an outstanding shoe that works for all types of players.

name: MARKCHES
description: Overall, the Nike Zoom Rize is a great performer that is definitely worth the price. You get a very nice cushion setup, amazing traction, and solid support.

name: RicheeKim
description: I would highly recommend the Nike Zoom Rize. I really loved the traction and especially the cushioning - this is the best implementation of Zoom and Phylon ever!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Nike Zoom Rize because of the good traction and amazing cushioning. This shoe will work very well for big guys, but for my style of play, the court feel could have been a little better and the shoe was a little too bulky.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I enjoyed the Kobe AD NXT FastFit much more than I expected. The shape of the outsole is more traditional compared to the Kobe AD NXT 360, the traction durability is better, and the Fast Fit system improves upon the AJ 33.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: You are getting nice materials, futuristic tech, comfort, and great lockdown. But $200 is just too expensive.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $200, the Kobe AD NXT FastFit is a pass. It's a nice shoe to play in and looks really, really good, but the performance isn't worth $200.

name: RicheeKim
description: The performance of the Kobe AD NXT FF is really, really good, but if you care about money, $200 is just too expensive.

name: RicheeKim
description: $180 is a huge price for an average performer like that. The traction is just too bad - I can't recommend the Nike AlphaDunk.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Nike AlphaDunk is not a good performance basketball shoe! This shoe is way too bulky and the traction is horrible. I can only recommend this shoe to slow and heavy big guys.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: No! Don't get it! Especially for $180, this is a no go. The traction was just horrible and I don't like the aesthetics either.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: 100% recommended, especially for $90!

name: RicheeKim
description: Even for only $90, I wouldn't recommend this shoe. The materials are absolute trash and there are just too many stability and containment issues.

name: RicheeKim
description: I think the Diamond Mid is a great performer with premium materials, awesome traction, and a unique look.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: Jordan Brand has really stepped up their game lately. The Jumpman Diamond is a dynamic shoe with great build, fit and materials - and it comes at a very fair price!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The ankle area was pretty uncomfortable for me, everything else about this shoe is incredible!

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: Traction, cushion, and textile choice are all very good but the break-in and fit of this pair were difficult to overcome.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Don't get it! Traction is trash. Even for $100, this shoe is too expensive for what you get.

name: PureKicks
description: The Pro Bounce 2019 is a good shoe but doesn't live up to the Pro Bounce 2018.

name: RicheeKim
description: I can't really recommend the Pro Bounce 2019 because of the cheap materials and bad traction.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Zoom Zero Gravity is a fast, lightweight, low-top performer at a very affordable price!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $100 you get a solid performance hoop shoe. The Zoom Zero Gravity features great traction and solid materials - the only downside is the firm cushioning.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Zoom Freak 1 is a solid first signature sneaker for Giannis Antetokounmpo. Support and lockdown are great but cushioning and traction feel pretty standard and the quality of the upper materials could be better.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I enjoyed the Zoom Freak 1, but the cushioning and traction could be better. Unfortunately, this shoe is one tier below the top-performers and, at $120, a little too expensive for what you get.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: A solid on-court performer. I' give it a B performance-wise, because there are better shoes out there that give you more bang-for-the-buck.

name: PureKicks
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 1 has definitely a place in my sneaker rotation because it is super comfortable to play in.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 1 is a good shoe, but not a great one. Court feel and one-to-one fit are great, but impact protection and traction are disappointing.

name: Schwollo
description: The Freak 1 does nothing outstandingly well but thats okay because it does everything well enough.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike Zoom Freak 1 is a very low-to-the-ground sneaker. It's lightweight and provides a good amount of court feel, but the cushion could have been better in the forefoot area of the shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: If you like Kobe models - you are probably going to enjoy the Zoom Freak 1. But for $120, there are better performers out there.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I am pretty satisfied with the performance of the DON issue #1. My favorite aspects are the traction, the super-responsive cushioning and the awesome price point of $100.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I actually loved the D.O.N. Issue 1 with the exception of the traction.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: At $99, this shoe provides a ton of performance! I'd say this is the best under $100 sneaker currently on the market. The DON issue 1 is a very versatile shoe and should work for all players!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I didn't like the DON Issue 1 too much. It's heavy and chunky and the traction is too inconsistent.

name: MARKCHES
description: The Adidas DON Issue #1 is a great shoe for anyone who is looking for a quick, responsive and supportive performer. It has plenty of court feel and the traction was consistent. My only gripe is that they could've made the cushion a bit bouncier.

name: RicheeKim
description: I will keep this shoe because of the good-looking Spiderman collaboration but I think there are better performers, even at $100.

name: PureKicks
description: The DON Issue 1 is a very comfortable and supportive shoe that works perfectly for explosive basketball players.

name: RicheeKim
description: For only $90, this is an amazing performer! A minimal shoe for players who like court feel over impact protection.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Great performer! I would not change anything about this shoe, besides the traction.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Under Armour HOVR Havoc 2 is another solid basketball shoe with traction that's built Ford tough and cushioning that's a little firm but kept me stable and made me feel faster than I really am.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The HOVR Havoc 2 is a good performer but a step down from top-tier performers. I liked almost everything about this shoe but the traction was a little too inconsistent for me.

name: RicheeKim
description: Except for the occasional slip out, the HOVR Havoc 2 is a very good performer. But I think that you can find better-performing sneakers at $120.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Lebron Soldier 13 performs well in every category - on hardwood and blacktop!

name: RicheeKim
description: For a pretty solid price of $140, you get awesome cushioning, great traction, great fit, and great materials. The straps also work really well on this version of the Lebron Solider and don't come undone like on previous models.

name: PureKicks
description: This is one of the best-reviewed shoes in the history of our Youtube channel!

name: MARKCHES
description: The Nike LeBron Soldier 13 features one of the best traction setups to go with the plush cushioning. The materials get the job done. Support and lockdown perform well, with the only complaint being that the lateral containment could be a tad bit better.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I enjoyed playing in the Lebron Soldier 13 - it's a good performer. But cushioning could have been better and the $140 price tag is pretty expensive.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Get them! The Converse All Star Pro BB is freaking awesome.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Converse All Star Pro BB is a really good basketball shoe. I especially liked the one-to-one fit and the lightweight feel but the traction and the insole lining could be improved.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $140, I would not recommend the Converse Pro BB just because of the inconsistent traction.

name: PureKicks
description: The traction and cushioning are A1, but the fit and support are a real lockdown. Wear double socks and an ankle brace and you will have a lot of fun.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The CP3 12 is a no-nonsense type of shoe that offers a lot of performance for its $100 price point. I'm pleasantly surprised!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This is a top-tier performer with premium materials at a great retail price of only $100!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $100 this shoe is a freaking steal! It's an absolute beast of a performer - highly recommended!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: If you want a fairly light, low and fast shoe without any weaknesses then the Kyrie Low 2 is a great choice!

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: The Kyrie Low 2 ticks all the boxes for me. My favorite Kyrie I have played in so far!

name: PureKicks
description: A supportive low-top, with great traction and good cushioning - it's all I ever wanted!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For only $110, get them! This is probably the best Kyrie model out there right now. The only thing that should have been better, is the stiff and uncomfortable cushioning.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110, this is an absolute steal. Traction is the most important thing in a basketball shoe for me, and the traction of the Kyrie Low 2 is absolutely money!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Mamba Focus is really cheap and the performance is okay, but there are much better shoes even at similarly low prices (Nike PG3, Kyrie Flytrap 2).

name: RicheeKim
description: I wouldn't recommend the Kobe Mamba Focus. The traction isn't good, impact protection is very minimal, and the fit was really uncomfortable for my wide feet.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike KD 12 is just an all-around good shoe that should cater to most players needs.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: When theyre this nice, you might want to buy em twice. I can't stop playing in my KD 12's!

name: RicheeKim
description: This is the best performer of this year so far! A huge step up from the disappointing previous KD models.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The cushioning alone is worth the $150! But I would have preferred a little more premium materials.

name: Schwollo
description: The directly-underfoot Zoom set up makes the KD 12 feel fun and exciting. Other than that, this shoe does everything well from A-Z.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: They fixed a lot of things that I didn't like in the predecessor KD11. The cushioning is amazing, materials are solid, fit and support are great! The only downside is the inconsistent traction of the translucent rubber on dusty courts.

name: PureKicks
description: This shoe is not a joke! You never felt anything like this full-length Zoom cushioning system and there is finally solid support in a KD shoe.

name: PureKicks
description: Insane traction and amazing cushioning -  this shoe is an absolute madness!

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: No matter what position or style you play, you won't be disappointed with the Adidas Pro Bounce Madness!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really like the casual look and the performance on clean courts. Just make sure you don't play on dusty courts with these.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Pro Bounce is a solid shoe but the traction just didn't do it for me on dusty courts.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: Paul Georges signature sneaker represent him well: these are the perfect shoes for a smooth, two-way player that can get busy when necessary.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The PG3 performs exceptionally well! I really, really enjoyed playing in these. Definitely one of the best basketball shoes out right now.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I really like everything about the PG3 except the materials and the looks.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I hated the PG3 after my first few hours in them. However, Im glad I stuck with them as by the end of the week I was just excited to lace them up for another few hours of pick-up runs

name: PureKicks
description: Easily the best PG sneaker so far! This is one of my favorite Nike shoes in a long time.

name: Schwollo
description: The PG3 gives you everything you want in a low top for a lower-than-average price. I have zero complaints!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I promise you will not get disappointed if you pick the Dame 5. If the cushioning was a little softer and the traction a little better on dusty courts, this shoe might have received the first ever perfect rating from me.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: This is the best Dame shoe yet and that is saying a lot! The Dame 5 combines the best categories of the previous models and gives us a shoe that any player can wear and feel strong.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Dame 5 is solid all the way around: great traction, great cushion, superior lockdown, wonderful support, and stability.

name: RicheeKim
description: At $115, the Dame 5 is a very good performance basketball shoe. The traction took a while to break in, but other than that, everything about this shoe is really nice.

name: PureKicks
description: The Adidas Dame 5 is an incredible shoe. The Bounce cushioning is absolutely amazing and the herringbone traction pattern is close to perfect.

name: Schwollo
description: Get the basics down and you have a great shoe. Thank you Adidas and Dame! This is the best Dame ever, as Adidas finally found the right combo of everything, especially traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Dame 5 on clean courts. The cushion is pretty damn nice, materials are nice, fit is good and it's also very supportive. This is a solid performer at a very fair price. Just make sure you don't get the translucent rubber versions if you plan to play on dusty courts.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This is a solid, solid performer, especially at the price of $110. The traction is excellent, the cushioning is soft, and the materials are pretty nice and comfortable.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The traction on this shoe is absolutely awesome and the Micro G cushioning feels really good. Unfortunately, the fit wasn't perfect for my feet.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110 you really can't go wrong with the Anatomix Spawn Low. It doesn't have the big-name brand attached, and the looks might not be amazing, but the performance is top notch!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you are looking for a low, fast, cushioned ride that will draw some attention for the looks and colors, the Anatomix Spawn is it.

name: Schwollo
description: Even though this shoe has very little in common with its predecessors, it performs very well all around with excellent traction and a pretty good fit if you ignore the bubbles in the forefoot. I prefer these over the Curry 6 when it comes to performance.

name: PureKicks
description: This is my favorite Under Armour shoe so far! I love the fit, the Micro G cushioning, and the excellent traction.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Even though this isn't really a performance upgrade to the Kobe 4, this is still a really good performance shoe. However, I don't think they are worth $175.

name: Schwollo
description: I love that Nike didnt change a thing. And why should they when its one of the best low tops of all time?

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This shoe feels more Retro than Protro. They will probably make it into my rotation, but the price of $175 is pretty steep.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kobe 4 is one of the greatest basketball shoes of all-time but I expected the inclusion of forefoot cushion for a performance-upgraded shoe. For $175 they could have, and should have, given us more.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Protro 4 is a very solid performer - if you are a Kobe fan get them! But at the price of $175, there are way better shoes out there.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: For $175, these feel like a sneaker from 2009 trying to keep up in 2019.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma Uproar is a fun shoe! If you are looking for a moderately-cushioned shoe with near-perfect lockdown and traction, look no further.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Puma really has impressed me quite a bit. The cushioning could be a little better, but everything else worked perfectly!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I enjoyed playing in these. This shoe is a jack of all trades but master of none.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Even ignoring the fast-fit adaptive lacing system - this is a really nice performance basketball shoe. On top of that - this is a real head-turner!

name: PureKicks
description: The first-ever self-lacing basketball shoe is here - and it's one of the best basketball shoes we have ever played in.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Nike Adapt BB is a good performance basketball shoe. But there are better performers for much cheaper. So if you are a sneakerhead, or really into innovative tech, then this is a great shoe!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I had a lot of fun playing in the Nike Adapt BB. The self-lacing system works well and the overall performance is really solid. Pick these up if you are interested in the latest tech and you can afford the hefty price tag!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 6 is easily the best shoe in the Curry signature line.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: I am loving the Curry 6! Definitely the #1 in my rotation right now.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: In my opinion, this is the best Curry signature shoe since the Curry 2. Everything about this shoe is great, except the pain I experienced on the top of the feet when cranking the laces tightly.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry 6 is a really fun performer that has everything I want from a basketball shoe: amazing cushion, amazing fit, and while the traction is not quite on Curry 2 level, it is still pretty nice! The durability of the rubber on my pair was an issue though...

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 6 brings a great combo of traction, cushioning and support to make fast basketball player very happy!

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: This is easily the most well-rounded Curry weve had since the 1.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoy playing in the Curry 6. The cushioning is pretty nice, the traction, fit, support and the minimal upper are really fun. The only problem is the durability of my pair - let's hope the glue work is better on future colorways!

name: PureKicks
description: Easily the best Curry signature shoe! The cushioning is amazing, materials are really nice, the traction took care of us, only the support was a little bit of a letdown.

name: Schwollo
description: The Curry 6 looks good, has great traction and is very stable, but the constant lace pressure, bad heel fit, and a really dumb outsole design make these far from perfect.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Why Not Zero.2 is quick, comfortable, supportive, and breaks in quickly.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Traction is superb, materials are 50:50, support is solid, cushioning is responsive in the forefoot and comfortable in the heel. There is nothing bad about the Why Not Zero.2, but there is also nothing phenomenal. Not the best shoe I ever played in but a good performer overall.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Jordan Why Not Zero.2. They look great, the price is right, whatever position you play - you are going to enjoy these!

name: Schwollo
description: Ive literally got nothing to complain about with this shoe. Jordan made the Why Not Zero.2 a lot more fun with a bouncier cushioning set-up while keeping the shoe just great all around.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $125 this is a really nice shoe - highly recommended! The traction and fit are the outstanding features for me.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall this shoe is really dope. The only downside is that the traction is a downgrade compared to the first Russell Westbrook sneaker.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I think the Jordan Why Not Zero.2 are a solid performer, and fun to play in. But the hefty materials, the uncomfortableness I experienced in the collar area and the uneven support in the heel to forefoot throw them off.

name: PureKicks
description: The cushioning is absolutely amazing and reminds me of the AJ29. This is an amazing overall performer, Russell Westbrook and Jordan Brand should be proud!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really liked playing in these shoes! If just wished the cushioning was a little more comfortable.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kyrie Flytrap 2 is a very solid shoe in most aspects, but cushion could definitely use some improvement.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The $165 is justified by the premium materials and great build quality. This is a great performer with very comfortable cushioning - I thoroughly enjoyed playing in these!

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Wade 7 is a fun shoe to play - definitely recommended!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I am not a big fan of the Wade 7 on-court and I definitely dont want to play in them again.

name: Jalique Gabay [weartesters.com]
description: This modern take on an old school hoop shoe is a great all-around performer but needs a little patience to break-in.

name: Schwollo
description: This might just be the shoe of the year 2018!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Marquee Boost is a very nice performer at an affordable price - I am impressed!

name: RicheeKim
description: The Marquee Boost is a great performer but I would recommend the Low version if you like freedom of movement around your ankles.

name: PureKicks
description: The most comfortable shoe in the game. Adidas is doing a great job lately!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas Marquee Boost is definitely one of the more comfortable basketball shoes currently available.

name: RicheeKim
description: Adidas really knocked this one out of the park. Really fun to play in!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Adidas has made a really, REALLY fun shoe. Luckily, the price matched the performance and was truly N3XT L3V3L.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really, really want to like this shoe, but traction is the most important aspect for me, and the Adidas Next Level didn't work on dusty courts. On clean courts, I liked it a lot!

name: PureKicks
description: Amazing cushion, fantastic herringbone traction, and comfortable Primeknit upper. The fit works out great, even without laces!

name: Schwollo
description: The N3xt L3v3l is super comfortable and has a nice cushioning setup, but during play, the laceless system just doesnt work like it should or could.

name: RicheeKim
description: This is a pretty fun shoe to play in! If you are a T-Mac fan go for them, but there are better bang-for-the-buck shoes out there.

name: Schwollo
description: I really enjoy playing in this shoe because it does everything well. I especially love the cushioning set up, traction, and as shallow as this sounds, its looks.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I was super-impressed by the performance of the T-Mac Millenium. Much better than the original T-Mac! This is a very durable shoe, that should work well for big guys who need a lot of support and cushioning.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $100 this would have been a really, really solid performer if it hadn't been for the cushion.  Only recommended if you play on clean courts.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: For under $100 retail I can't think of a more versatile shoe. However, I think there are other decently priced sneakers that perform much better.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: Simply put, the Kyrie 5 is a fantastic shoe for the money, and would be a fantastic shoe at any price.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I really like the Nike Zoom Air Turbo and the Flytrap shroud. The Kyrie 5 is an upgrade over the Kyrie 4 and works best for quick players who prefer court feel over soft cushioning.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love these! If you liked the Kyrie 2 or 4, then you are going to love the Kyrie 5.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Kyrie 5 offers plenty of court feel, a little bit of cushion, great lockdown and aggressive traction wrapped up in a lightweight package.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Kyrie 5 is a fun shoe that caters to the needs of those that play a more grounded game and require unrestricted mobility.

name: Schwollo
description: This is a very good shoe that does everything well with great traction, fit, and decent cushioning.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: The Kyrie 5 is a very solid shoe. The main pros are lockdown and court feel, cons are the cushioning of the outsole and the lacking padding of the inner material.

name: PureKicks
description: The Kyrie 5 is a solid shoe. The support and cushioning are great, but the traction is disappointing.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Kyrie 5 probably won't find its way back into my gym bag any time soon - the traction was just too bad in my pair.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Puma Clyde Court Disrupt wound up being one of the more fun models to play in this year (so far).   Not in the Top 5 discussion but you receive solid performance and cushion for the price.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: The Puma Clyde Court Disrupt is a very vibrant and well-rounded sneaker. I really like them and I am pleasantly surprised by their performance.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall the Puma Clyde Court is a really fun shoe to play in. Great job by Puma!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: It's really impressive what Puma was able to do in their first basketball sneaker in a long time. The materials and fit are absolutely A1, the support and traction, however,  could use a little tweaking.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The performance is middle of the road. They won't stay in my rotation but they might work well as a big-man shoe or as an outdoor shoe.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I am very impressed by the first hoops shoe by Puma after their comeback to basketball. The cushioning and traction could be a little better, but everything else was great!

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The Puma Clyde Court Disrupt is a great first impression for Puma's relaunched basketball division.

name: PureKicks
description: Welcome back Puma! This is a strong shoe that is only let down by the lacking ankle support and bad traction on dusty courts.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The traction and cushion are very solid but the FastFit lacing system has room for improvement and may throw some people off.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: We love the new FastFit lacing system. The Air Jordan 33 will definitely be in my rotation even though it is a bit heavy and clunky.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Air Jordan 33 is a great shoe, especially for big guys looking for impact protection and support. Quick guards looking for a light and minimal shoe should look elsewhere.

name: RicheeKim
description: Even at the hefty price of $175, I really enjoyed playing in these. The AIr Jordan 33 is a great performer that really stands out on the court thanks to the fast-fit lacing system.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I can't recommend the Air Jordan 33 because they never really broke in for me. The midsole remained extremely stiff and uncomfortable, even after 30 hours of 5 vs 5 play.

name: Schwollo
description: Overall, the Air Jordan 33 is a good shoe if you love the looks and the innovative sneaker tech. It performs well in almost every aspect but I think $175 is too expensive for what you get. $130 would be a much fairer retail price.

name: PureKicks
description: The Fast Fit system is no gimmick, the support is great, but the materials are a letdown - there are just too many!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I am very disappointed in the Air Jordan 33. The traction is inconsistent, the materials are subpar and the comfort is a disaster!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This is the best performer of 2018. I am going to get five pairs of these!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The performance of the Adidas Harden Volume 3 on the court is nearly perfect. It's a special shoe in that it's so simple that it does everything right!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: This is the best Harden we have seen so far. Works for players at any position who enjoy freedom of movement, court feel with above-average impact protection, and a great fit.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: This is by far the best shoe in the Harden signature series. Pretty much everything was improved - I especially like the cushioning and materials.

name: RicheeKim
description: Definitely an upgrade over the Harden 2. This shoe has pretty much everything I want in a performance sneaker!

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The Harden 3 is a standout when it comes to performance! It checks all the boxes for comfort and fit and does so at a relatively affordable $140 price point.

name: Schwollo
description: Great traction, pretty good fit and fun Boost cushioning - sign me up! Im going to give this a first-team rating.

name: PureKicks
description: Fit and cushion are awesome, but the traction was a little too inconsistent and the support a little too low.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta KT4 is a ton of fun to play in. Youve got to try them for yourself.

name: MARKCHES
description: Overall, the Anta KT4 is one of the best performing sneakers available. The cushion is both bouncy and responsive. The traction is awesome, and it has all the support you need.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $125 you get premium materials and modern tech. I enjoyed playing in these a lot! The only issues are the slightly mushy cushioning and the problematic containment on lateral cuts.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The LeBron 16 will suit any play style or move  be it slashing, cutting, shooters, defense, rebounding.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really, really like the Lebron 16. The price is expensive but justified by the amazing tech and ultra-premium feel.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Lebron 16 is an upgrade in every aspect! They look better, they feel better, and they perform better!

name: RicheeKim
description: The Lebron 16 is an outstanding performer!

name: Schwollo
description: Everything I didn't like about the Lebron 15 was fixed! Better traction, better stability, and containment. This is the best Lebron to come out in years!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The cushioning setup is super fun to play in, the traction worked on every court and the Battleknit 2.0 is super comfortable. The Lebron 16 is a very versatile shoe, but explosive and fast wing players will particularly love this hoops shoe.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: Awesone impact protection, really good traction, but the court feel is minimal and the Lebron 16 is pretty heavy.

name: PureKicks
description: Cushioning and traction are awesome but the fit and support were a bit of a letdown for me.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Adidas Pro Bounce Low is a great shoe that is absolutely perfect for me. Everything about this shoe is amazing and the cheap price point makes it even better!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Adidas Pro Bounce Low is a great all-around shoe that should work especially well for guards.

name: PureKicks
description: Right now, this is by far my favorite shoe to hoop in. If you enjoy playing in low-tops then this is the perfect shoe for you!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Pro Bounce Low is a very solid shoe that can be used for all positions.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: These are up there on the budget category. I would totally recommend the Jordan Jumpman Hustle, as they are one of the best performers of the year!

name: RicheeKim
description: I think the Jordan Jumpman Hustle is a great performer, especially after you break-in the traction a little bit.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Jumpman Hustle is super comfortable, very lightweight and the shoe wont break the bank. Traction and cushioning are great but support could be better.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Jordan Jumpman Hustle was a delight to play in.

name: RicheeKim
description: Personally, I would not recommend the KD11 for basketball because of the missing lateral support. Playing in these shoes had me scared about my ankles.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The KD 11 is a decent performer, but it just wasn't for me. I would recommend this shoe only to bigger pull-up shooters - there just isn't enough support for quicker players like me.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I was really disappointed because I expected more. The KD11 looks nice and is very comfortable but the performance aspects like support and traction just aren't as good as I had hoped.

name: Schwollo
description: If you want a sock-like shoe with great cushioning then you are going to love the KD11. Unfortunately, the missing support and lacking containment are issues I personally can't ignore in a performance basketball shoe.

name: PureKicks
description: Cushioning, materials, and traction are great. The only problem is the lack of support.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The Nike KD11 looks like a comfortable casual sneaker but doesn't work on a basketball court for me because of the lacking support and stability.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The KD11 is one of the most disappointing shoes I reviewed in a while. The fully knit build is just not supportive enough for a performance basketball shoe - use some leather Nike!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Good traction, good cushioning and the support and lockdown are on point. The materials may look cheap but they perform well.  Overall, a very solid hoops shoe!

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The latest Nike Kobe A.D. isn't spectacular, but it is an easy recommendation for players whose priorities lean towards light, minimal, and low shoes.

name: RicheeKim
description: It's a great performing shoe, but for a Kobe signature model, the look and in-hand feel of the materials are disappointing.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: I like everything about this shoe! I just wished they would have taken the cushion from the Kobe AD NXT 360, because then it would have been my shoe of the year!

name: Schwollo
description: It doesn't have the latest and greatest tech but this is definitely one of the more fun shoes I played in this year.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Kobe AD Exodus isn't the best Kobe ever, but it does almost everything well on-court and is smooth on foot. Works especially well for quicker "Kyrie-like" guards.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I like the Nike Kobe AD Exodus but I dont love it. The Exodus is lightweight, low profile, and provides aggressive traction  its a shoe built for a fast-paced player that gets up and down the court.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I am having fun in the Kobe AD, but the traction is problematic.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Tech-wise it's not great but performance is solid and it looks good. Overall, we are a little underwhelmed though and the Kobe AD Exodus probably won't make it into our rotation.

name: RicheeKim
description: For a retail price of $100, this is an outstanding shoe.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: If the Curry 3 Zero2 came with a heel counter it would be the perfect guard shoe.

name: Schwollo
description: The Steph Curry 3 Zero2 does almost everything exceptionally well with traction, fit and stability being the very high highlights.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The performance is okay for a budget model, but these won't make it into the rotation.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The HOVR cushioning was a bit disappointing, but other than that, the Under Armour HOVR Havoc is an amazing performer with awesome traction and a very minimal, low-to-the-ground feel.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you are looking for a seriously quick, responsive, biting-traction shoe, the HOVR Havoc Low will more than satisfy.

name: RicheeKim
description: This is one of my top 5 performance basketball shoes of 2018 so far!

name: Schwollo
description: Okay overall, but nothing great aside from traction, stability, and containment.

name: RicheeKim
description: I would not recommend this shoe as it felt super stiff and clunky.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I didn't really enjoy playing in these shoes. Probably works better if you are a big guy who plays in the low post.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110, you will not be disappointed! The Kyrie Low is a good all-around performer and a lot of fun to play in.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The package of traction, court feel, and fit make the Kyrie Low ideal for most guards and any other player not needing a wide shoe or supreme cushioning.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Kyrie Low. If you don't need a lot of impact protection then this shoe is a great choice!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Better than the Kyrie 2 and 1, but not as good as the Kyrie 3 or 4.

name: RicheeKim
description: I would not recommend this shoe for $140. The traction is pretty bad and the fit didn't work for me.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The D Rose 9 is a solid performer, but there are better performers at a more affordable price out there.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: We loved the cushioning! Unfortunately, the traction is lackluster and the fit works only for players with very wide feet.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you require traction and lockdown from your basketball shoes you need to look elsewhere. You should only get the D Rose 9 if you are a stationary shooter, you don't rely on quickness and you like the look and casual appeal of the D Rose 9.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: This is an awesome performer with great tech at an affordable price. Cushion, traction, and materials stayed the same but the fit and support are slightly improved!

name: RicheeKim
description: I would pick the PG 2.5 over the PG 2 as they look better and provide a more customizable fit thanks to the forefoot strap.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The performance stayed exactly the same but we think the PG 2.5 looks better than the PG2.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you need a dependable shoe for any indoor surface, with great cushioning, a semi-durable upper, and killer fit, look no further than the Nike Hyperdunk X

name: RicheeKim
description: For a fair list price of $130, this is a very solid performer.

name: Schwollo
description: The HD X is a jack of all trades which I really love. If the traction and containment were a little better, these Hyperdunks would be close to perfect!

name: PureKicks
description: The Hyperdunk X is an above average performer. The fit, materials, and support do very well. Unfortunately, the traction on mildly dusty courts is a bit disappointing.

name: RicheeKim
description: I would definitely recommend the Hyperdunk X Low, the only downside is the inconsistent traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The traction could have been a little bit better, other than that, the Hyperdunk X Low is a good performer!

name: PureKicks
description: The Hyperdunk X Low gets the job done. I really enjoyed playing in these!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $110 this is a steal! This might be one of the best performance basketball shoes I played in this year.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Lockdown is not only a great bang for the buck but also one of the best shoes released in 2018 so far.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Fly Lockdown is a budget Jordan model that performs like a signature shoe. Works best if you need a stable, low-riding foot rocket.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you need traction for days, cushioning that is stable but provides great impact protection, and a supportive, stable base look no further  the CP3.XI should be a shoe for you, no matter the position.

name: RicheeKim
description: The CP3.XI is one of my favorite shoes to play in right now.  Great cushioning, comfortable fit and nice low-to-the-ground feel. This shoe has everything I like in a shoe and nothing that I don't.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The CP3 XI is definitely a step in the right direction as cushion, comfort, and traction have all been upgraded compared to the predecessors. It's a very well-rounded shoe that should appeal to a lot of players.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The CP3.XI is a solid performer that works very well for guards who look for a supportive low-cut shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love playing in the Curry 5. This shoe excelled in every single category. Sole Brothers recommended, just not on dusty courts.

name: Schwollo
description: The Curry 5 is what I call a pretty average shoe with some minor flaws and poor dusty floor traction performance.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The horrible blisters made me not want to hoop in the Curry 5.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 5 is simply not a shoe I can recommend. Traction is very inconsistent, and the fit is horrendous.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry 5 is the worst Curry model I have played in. Stay away from this shoe if you don't have narrow feet!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I am really confused how this shoe got by the initial testing phase. The fit of the Curry 5 is way too specific and doesn't work for me at all.

name: PureKicks
description: Materials and fit are fantastic, the traction is pretty good, but the support and cushioning are a letdown.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: I cannot recommend the Curry 5 to a player of any position or size.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This is a top-tier performer for a very affordable price. This is going to be on the list of shoes with the best traction!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Very good traction and perhaps the best Boost cushioning in a basketball sneaker. Make sure to go down half a size because the fit didn't work for me in my true size.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Insane traction, responsive cushioning and a very affordable price. I actually prefer the Crazylight Boost over the more expensive Adidas Harden 2.

name: Schwollo
description: It's almost as if Adidas read my blog and fixed all the issues I had with the predecessor. Great shoe that almost any player will enjoy - especially at the affordable price!

name: RicheeKim
description: Amazing cushioning, good traction and solid materials -  this could have been a 9.0! But dead space in the toebox and excessive heel slippage killed the Crazy Light Boost 2018 for me.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: It may be an opinion clouded in sentiment, but there is no denying it: the Protro is a great, great, great performer.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I miss shoes that are built like this. Nike reduced a bit of bulk from the original and created a shoe that I didn't want to take off again.

name: RicheeKim
description: At $175, I wouldn't really recommend the Kobe Protro for on-court use. This is a great performer, but there are cheaper shoes that perform just as well. If you are a big Kobe fan or you like the old school materials, then go ahead and buy these!

name: Schwollo
description: The Kobe 1 Protro feels and plays like the OG which is a good thing! From traction to containment and balanced cushioning - it does everything right and gets a first-team rating from me!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: At the end of the day, the Kobe 1 Protro still feels like a throwback sneaker. The materials feel heavy and restrictive compared to current basketball shoe models.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Kobe 1 Protro is a decent big-man shoe. But for me, it was way too clunky and heavy. I feel like this is more of a lifestyle sneaker.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Kobe NXT 360 is the best Kobe shoe since the Kobe 9, in my opinion.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: There is no other shoe I want to play in as much as these. Even though the traction of the translucent rubber is not the best this still might be the best basketball shoe we ever played in.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Kobe AD NXT 360 is a great performer and looks amazing!

name: PureKicks
description: This is officially PureKicks best-rated shoe so far!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Kobe NXT 360 is a true next-generation shoe and incredibly fun to play in!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The traction is subpar, the 360 Flyknit concept is cool but nothing spectacular and the price is too expensive for what you get.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I absolutely loved playing in these shoes! The Kobe AD NXT 360 truly feels like a high-performance shoe with cutting-edge technology and will be in my rotation for a long time.

name: Schwollo
description: So is the NXT 360 worth the price of admission? In a nutshell, no. The Mamba Instinct delivers similar performance, at a fraction of the price!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Lebron Soldier 12 is 100% worth its price! It's just nice to play in a shoe with gnarly traction like this!

name: Schwollo
description: If you want a shoe that does everything very well, this is your shoe.

name: PureKicks
description: The traction was surprisingly fantastic! The fit was brillitant, the support was good, if only the materials would have been better!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This is by far the cheapest signature model on the market but it's still a very good performer. We enjoyed it a lot!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Considering that the Kyrie Flytrap is a budget model it gets the job done, but it's nothing spectacular. Save some extra money and get the Kyrie 4.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Not a bad shoe for $80, but I would opt for discounted Kyrie 4s  unless you happen to have a wide foot.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: I can't recommend the Kyrie Flytrap from a performance standpoint. The Flytrap feels so cheap that it doesnt even feel like it was made by Nike.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Is it worth your $80 bucks? I dont think so.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Lebron 15 Low fixes the issues of the mid version with stability and support on lateral movements. This is a shoe that will for everyone.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Lebron 15 Low is a vast improvement over last year's Lows. It's a little more guard-oriented with less cushioning and better stability and traction during lateral cuts. It also works well for lighter players that didn't like the bulky High-top version of the Lebron 15.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I am not a big fan of the Lebron 15 Low. Expensive, heavier than most Lows and the high ride won't work for quick guards who rely on lateral cuts.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The PG 2 is a really fun shoe to play because it enhanced nearly every feature found on the PG 1.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The PG2 has slightly improved in every aspect: better cushioning, nicer materials, more comfortable fit and slightly improved traction make them a contender for best shoe of 2018.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike PG 2 is a well-rounded shoe and great for people all shapes and sizes. Id say its definitely an upgrade from the PG 1.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The PG2 is honestly the best all-around shoe that Nike has on the market right now (especially at $110).

name: RicheeKim
description: The PG2 performs well across all aspects and comes at an extremely fair price.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Nike PG2 is a slight improvement over the PG1 and in the competition for the best bang-for-the-buck basketball shoe on the market.

name: Schwollo
description: The Nike PG2 is all any player would need, everything about it is solid.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: Lockdown and fit have been greatly improved, the cushioning offers exceptional response after a break-in period and $110 remains a great deal! Unfortunately, the shoe still isn't the most comfortable and traction has taken a small step backward.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: At this price point, you will have a hard time finding another shoe of this quality.

name: PureKicks
description: This shoe is an absolute steal! I especially loved the incredible fit and traction.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: We really enjoyed playing in these. The Harden Vol. 2 should work well for everyone - responsive enough for guards but the support and comfortable cushioning will work well for bigger guys too!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall a great shoe, but unfortunately, the inconsistency that I experienced with the traction will likely keep the Harden Vol 2 out of my rotation.

name: Schwollo
description: The Harden Vol2 is extremely fun to wear! Overall I feel that Adidas improved everything compared to the V1.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Unless you play on crispy clean courts I wouldn't recommend the Harden Vol 2 because there are a bunch of better options on the market.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Harden 2 will defintely stay in my gym bag for a while! I especially loved the comfortable materials and the Boost cushioning. Everything about this sneaker just worked for me - and they are just flat out fun to play in!

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall the Harden Vol. 2 is a great performer. Some nitpicking: I would have liked the heel to be a little less clunky and the Boost cushioning to be a little softer in the forefoot.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall, this shoe is pretty good. Great shoe if you have bad knees, you need a lot of comfort and impact protection and you can live with the lackluster traction.

name: PureKicks
description: Amazing cushioning, very nice materials and support. Traction is solid but I wasn't happy with the fit.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really like everything about the Adidas Crazy BYW X. The performance is great and should work well for players of all positions.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I think the Crazy BYW X is very good, but the traction definitely could be better.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: Overall, the performance of the Adidas BYW X is solid. But the uneven ride and the lacking outsole durability are no-gos considering the hefty price tag.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The full-length zoom setup is worth the $125 alone. A great big-man shoe as the cushion is amazing!

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: I didnt expect the shoe to perform this well, but damn! Solid traction, great cushioning, great fit and lockdown, support was on point.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: What a fantastic shoe this is. Im not a fan of Russell Westbrook, but man, do I love playing in his shoe.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you are looking for great fit and support, great cushioning, and (almost) great traction, you have got to check this shoe out!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: To me, this will be one of the top performance sneakers of 2018. Full-length zoom at $125 - you can't beat that!

name: Schwollo
description: The Why Not Zero.1 is a very nice start for Westbrooks signature line from a performance standpoint.

name: Analykix.com
description: I really enjoyed the full-length cushioning, and the support and lockdown. Overall, I'd wish this shoe was a little less bulky.

name: RicheeKim
description: The cushion is great, but the lacking traction and the uncomfortable strap hold back what could have been a top performer.  I am a bit disappointed by Russel Westbrooks first signature sneaker.

name: PureKicks
description: The Why Not Zero.1 is a good first edition of Russell Westbrooks signature line. Full-length Zoom is very nice, but materials could be a lot more comfortable.

name: RicheeKim
description: At $120, the Kyrie 4 is an absolute steal! This is a very well constructed shoe and an absolute beast on the court. Probably my favorite shoe to play in right now!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Nike Kyrie 4 is Nikes best performer this year. Theres just enough cushion for most, solid traction, fantastic fit and adequate support  and all of comes at a team friendly price point of $120.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Kyrie 4 is the best Kyrie to date. This shoe has everything and is Nikes best all-around hooping kick right now.

name: PureKicks
description: This is the best Kyrie signature shoe ever. The traction is amazing and the cushion and materials are vastly improved.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Kyrie 4 is one of Nikes best-performing signature shoes that works well at all positions.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Kyrie 4 is a phenomenal addition to the Kyrie line. It comes with improved cushioning and materials, great fit and support. The traction is a little disappointing, but for $120 these are a great pickup!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Definitely the best shoe in the Kyrie signature line so far. Perfect for quick guards who don't rely a lot on impact protection.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I had a lot of fun in the Kyrie 4! I give them a B+ - it's not quite elite, but almost there. However, at a $120 price these offer great value!

name: Schwollo
description: All in all, the Kyrie 4 is a solid shoe that does everything fairly well, while doing nothing outstanding or really poorly. Cushioning has improved, the traction is decent overall and I really liked the comfort of the plush interior.

name: KickGenius
description: Overall, I am satisfied with the Kyrie 4. Minimal break-in time, great traction and a fair price. The Kyrie 4 gets the job done!

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Way of Wade 6 is a solid performer, and I enjoy this shoe a lot. I find myself going to this sneaker just about much as I go to my Dame 4s.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Materials and cushion are great, support and traction are solid. With a few tweaks this could have been the sneaker of the year!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Way of Wade 6 competes with most of the top-tier shoes offered from other brands.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Very comfortable, really nice traction - I love the performance of these. The only downside is the lateral containment and the excessive toe room.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Kyrie S1 perform pretty similar to the Kyrie 1 but feels a little bit bulkier.

name: PureKicks
description: This is a really nice concoction of the first three Kyrie models.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I was surprised with how much I enjoyed the shoe on-court.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I love how light and minimal the Curry 4 Low feels. Traction and cushion remained unchanged from the High-Top, but materials and fit are much improved.

name: RicheeKim
description: I think the Curry 4 Low is an upgrade to the original version and I really love to play in them.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 4 Low offers great traction and stability for low-to-the-ground guards that prefer to be quick on their feet.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Better materials and fit compared to the Highs. But the same lackluster cushioning prevents these shoes from being a top performer.

name: Schwollo
description: On the court, the Curry 4 Low doesnt really do anything better than the mid, plus I had some heel slip.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The Curry 4 feels super-duper responsive. As one of the lightest shoes on the market, it provides great traction, tight fit, and low-to-the-ground feeling which makes it the perfect shoe for quick guards.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry 4 is a great shoe for guards that rely on quick, responsive movements. I really liked everything about it except the very minimal impact protection.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 4 is a great shoe for quick, ball-handling point guards who need speed with no lag.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Under Armour Curry 4 is a fantastic shoe for anyone looking for court feel. For the people who want impact protection Id say stay clear from the Curry 4.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 4 feels like it should have come after the Curry 2. It provides a better fit, greater stability, and more control.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I have mixed feelings about the Curry 4. Traction is a strong point, materials are 50:50, support and cushion are decent. However, I can't help to be a little disappointed.

name: KickGenius
description: These get the job done - especially if you are looking for a shoe that is really supportive.

name: PureKicks
description: This is the best Curry signature shoe so far. Great traction, good cushioning and support - perfect for quick guards.

name: Schwollo
description: The Curry 4 is for the quick guard who likes a low to the ground ride with responsive cushioning, tight traction, stability and containment for quick cuts and movements.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: Overall, I am a little disappointed by the Curry 4, mainly due to the very firm cushioning and budget material.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: One of the best performance shoes I have played in this year, especially at this price. A very nice shoe that will work for every type of player.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Anta KT3 is a great shoe. Between the Dame 4, Curry 4 and KT3 I have one hell of a lineup to choose from on any given night.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: I think Anta killed it with the KT3. This is a very affordable signature sneaker with a premium knitted upper, great traction and responsive cushioning.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Premium materials as well as improved cushioning and traction - a definitive improvement over the KT2.

name: Analykix.com
description: I enjoyed playing in the Anta KT3 and I would easily recommend the shoe for multiple player positions because of it's adequate cushioning.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The LeBron 15 is one of the best LeBron shoes ever. Materials, fit, and cushion are the definite highlights of the shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: I think this is one of the best Lebrons ever. Material usage is great, cushioning is great, support is great -  basically, everthing is really nice! But keep in mind that this shoe is made for big and heavy players, and won't work as well for smaller guards.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the LeBron 15 is a fun shoe to play in. Especially, the cushion is fabulous!

name: PureKicks
description: The Lebron 15 is the best Lebron of all time. This shoe ticks all the boxes, the only slight downside was the traction.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: This may be the best playing LeBron shoe ever. If you are looking for the absolute best Nike cushioning in basketball and a shoe that bleeds technology, the LeBron 15 is your ride.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I love pieces of the LeBron 15. Materials and fit are highlights, and the cushion is the best Nike has offered in years. Stability made them a bit concerning for me while on the floor and I never ended up feeling as comfortable as I wanted to be.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: My favorite Lebron ever - I really enjoyed playing in the Lebron 15. The cushioning is insane, the materials are as premium as it gets, unfortunately, the price is too.

name: Schwollo
description: There are a lot of positives with the LBJ 15 especially the cushioning, the fit, and the soft materials. Traction isnt horrible but it definitely isnt King worthy and needs some serious break in and wear to improve.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The LeBron 15 doesnt offer anything truly groundbreaking in terms of its design, but its taken existing concepts and improved on nearly everything. The traction was the only real downer for me, but it wasnt bad enough to ruin the things I did like.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: As a small guard, I didn't love the high-off-the-ground feeling and the laggy cushioning. However, if you are a bigger, heavier and powerful player than you will love the Lebron 15.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Air Jordan 32 is a huge step in the right direction. Everything feels refined. If Jordan Brand can keep the stability but increase the flexibility then it will have perfected the Flight Speed setup. I think people are going to like this one.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Air Jordan XXXII is a banger for real. This shoe has everything you need: good traction, good cushion, excellent materials, and amazing support.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: This is hands down the best on-court Air Jordan Model to date, as it should be. Every feature fits the mold to near perfection. Jordan Brand took a huge step in the right direction across all performance aspects.

name: Schwollo
description: The AJ XXXII is a great shoe that should satisfy everyone except the minimalist hoop crowd that love shoes like the Kobe 8, Mamba Mentality, Instinct etc

name: RicheeKim
description: Across the spectrum, this shoe performs very well and should work for all types of players. Pretty pricey, but worth every penny!

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: The Air Jordan 32 is a great performer and I was a little sad when I had to put these aside to test other performance shoes. The only two downsides are the long break-in period and the hefty price tag.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: Despite sky-high expectations, the Air Jordan 32 mostly delivers. I liked the more minimal collar and feel of the 31s cushioning better, but thought the 32 offered far superior traction and a smoother transition.

name: KickGenius
description: I think this is a great shoe for in-between players who are looking for a good mix of comfortable cushioning and responsiveness.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: I think Jordan brand did a great job with the XXXII. This has taken over the Nike PG1 as my go-to basketball shoes.  Traction, cushioning and lockdown are all great - what else do you need in a performance sneaker?

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Pros: Great Traction, Cushioning provides a good balance between impact protection and res

name: PureKicks
description: Overall, I would describe the Air Jordan 32 as a responsive shoe with ultimate support. Great for big guys, but unfortunately, the traction was pretty disappointing.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Nice shoes with premium materials and nice cushioning. I was a bit disappointed by the traction and the lateral containment. At a steep $185 I wouldn't recommend these.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Dame line continues to be the best signature you can get for your money. Bang for your buck like no other.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: This is a really good performance basketball shoe - probably one of the best basketball shoes of 2017! Especially at the low list price of $115.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: I was having so much fun in this kick I didnt want to stop. If there was a category for fun to play in I would rate the Dame 4 Hall of Fame!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: With good cushioning, good fit, and good materials, the Dame 4 is good at everything. As an overall package, this is one of the most complete and fun shoes to play in that you will ever find.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: Decent cushion, good fit, good materials  the shoe is good for everything on the court and gives you a great overall package.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I loved playing in these. Perfect for guards who want to be low to the ground and are looking for a very responsive shoe.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Dame 4 is the perfect shoe for quick guards and offers amazing performance at a very affordable price.

name: Schwollo
description: I really really really enjoy playing in this shoe but only on clean or slightly dusty floors. But the fact that I would even consider playing in these despite the meh traction speaks volumes about how fun this shoe is overall.

name: PureKicks
description: The Dame 4 is an underrated shoe that works very well for quick guards.

name: KickGenius
description: This is probably the best performing shoe to hoop in right now! This shoe is really smooth and I come back to it all the time.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: Traction, cushion, fit were all great, and the support system is all I need. This is one of the best-value sneakers I have ever worn!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Air Jordan 32 is a huge step in the right direction.

name: RicheeKim
description: I think this shoe is worth every penny and I like the low-top version better than the regular mid. The Air Jordan 32 Low offers slightly better traction and more freedom of movement.

name: PureKicks
description: You get amazing cushioning, and premium materials. Unfortunately, the traction is a real dust collector. Decent performer, but probably not worth the hefty price tag

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed playing in these! The Air Jordan 32 Low is super comfortable and performs very well.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The performance of the D Rose 8 is stellar. Feels like a lighter, streamlined and more minimal D Rose 7. I love these shoes and put them on the top of my list of Adidas performance sneakers.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: By combining great traction, awesome cushioning, and serious fit, the Rose 8 is built for every player.

name: RicheeKim
