description: For $140 this is a really good shoe. It brings everything you want: impact protection, responsiveness, ventilation, support and really good traction. If you like supportive high-tops, then this is the perfect shoe for you!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Adidas D Rose 8 is a very solid shoe. Traction is my main gripe with the Rose 8, but everything from the midsole up worked really well.

name: Schwollo
description: Since the D Rose 5, weve gotten great cushioning, traction, support and stability, and a reliable fit year over year and the D Rose 8 is no different. Materials arent always the best but thats always been a non-issue for me.

name: PureKicks
description: No distractions! This is a traditional basketball shoe and a great overall performer. This shoe worked very well for my style of game!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: You feel super fast in these shoes. The Hyperdunk 2017 is one of the top performers of 2017

name: KickGenius
description: I am a big fan of the comfort and amazing traction of the FlyKnit version of the Hyperdunk 2017.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall, I can highly recommend this shoe for players of every position. Me, as a guard, I love this shoe as I get decent impact protection and a great court feel!

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike React Hyperdunk 2017 is by far one of the most solid shoes Ive played in this year

name: Schwollo
description: HD2017 has taken the top Hyperdunk spot. Better traction than previous Hyperdunks, better cushioning than the 2012-14 version, great fit, good stability and excellent containment what more do you want?

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall, this is a really good shoe. Good traction, nice material and solid lockdown. Support could have been a little better. At $160 it is a little expensive.

name: PureKicks
description: Amazing traction, good support and the addition of React cushioning is welcome. I like shoes you can just put on, and they don't get in the way.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike Hyperdunk 2017 Flyknit isnt a bad shoe. The cushion isnt what I expected, but its tolerable. The lateral containment wasnt the best, but it wont keep me from hooping in these again.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: Id say the React Hyperdunk was disappointing. It is a hard shoe to recommend when better options are available at all price points.

name: KickGenius
description: I think the Kobe AD Mid is the best Kobe shoe out right now! Better than the NXT or the regular AD.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall, the Kobe AD Mid is a solid performer with phenomenal traction, nice cushioning and solid support. The suede material is a little too stiff for my liking, but hopefully, future releases with a Jacquard or Flyknit upper will fix this issue.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Kobe AD is an amazing performer but I just wish they had used a different upper material.

name: Schwollo
description: I think the Kobe AD Mid is an excellent all-around performer on the court. Not surprisingly, its one of my top five for the year due to its great overall performance.

name: PureKicks
description: The Kobe AD Mid is a beautiful and comfortable shoe that unfortunately suffers from bad ventilation and a small amount of heel slippage. Otherwise, I really like this shoe!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This shoe feels very different than any other Kobe shoe I ever played in. It provides less responsiveness and court feel than other Kobes. It seems like after his retirement, Kobe wants a little more cushioning and a more "old school" vibe from his shoes.

name: JAHRONMON [Youtube]
description: This is a very well performing shoe but there are no standout features. Great pickup for Kobe fans, but there are cheaper shoes that perform just as well.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The shoe plays and performs really well. Traction was awesome and the cushion was solid  especially for guards. Ventilation and material quality are where the Kobe AD Mids could improve.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The Kobe AD Mid is a beautiful shoe. The only real complaint I have is with the lacing system digging into my foot.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: A budget model that performs like a top-tier model. Traction is amazing, the cushion is okay, materials are really nice and they fit me very well. I think this is one of the best-performing Under Armour shoes out right now!

name: AnotherPair [Youtube]
description: Overall, this is a great shoe that will work for every type of player. Good job Under Armour!

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Drive 4 is a decent, serviceable shoe  nothing except traction really stands out, yet the shoe is good for players at all positions.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: This shoe is for the every day, every position player and it is a solid performer. If you require more cushion like myself, then you may have to look elsewhere.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The Under Armour Drive 4 is a solid hoops shoe for a low-budget price. I like them more than the Steph Curry 3 Zero. They feel lighter, are more flexible and the traction is on point. The cushioning is not a strong point but is still fairly good.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: The Drive 4 has some things going for it (traction) and then there are some things that need work (fit and materials). If youre someone who plays low to the ground, prefers a stable ride and has a wide foot, these are going to be great for you.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Outside of the lacking cushioning the Jordan Super.Fly 2017 is so close to being perfect its kind of scary,

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Jordan Super.Fly 2017 was an absolute delight to ball in.  If youre okay with the firmness of React cushioning and enjoy a low profile on-court ride, this has you covered with traction, lockdown, and stability.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: It's a good performer made for bigger dudes. Very durable because of the strong materials and hard rubber. However, I wouldn't recommend them for a shifty guard.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Super.Fly 2017 is a decent shoe, but I would rather go with the Nike Hyperdunk 2017 as it comes with the same technology but more premium materials and better-feeling cushioning.

name: PureKicks
description: Some things are good, some aren't. This shoe doesn't quite get my approval.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Crazy good performance, looks dope, premium materials. Overall, an amazing shoe, get it!

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: The adidas Crazy Explosive 2017 Primeknit is a great shoe! I love this thing like crazy and it is by far my favorite hoop shoe of 2017 so far. Its number one in my rotation and Im pretty sure it will be in many of yours as well.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Improved fit and killer cushioning should put the Crazy Explosive 2017 PK on everyones radar this year if you play basketball. Grab this shoe if you need traction for indoor courts, #Boostislife cushioning, a locked-in fit, and quick support.

name: KickGenius
description: Feels like playing in a sock with good traction and Boost cushioning!

name: RicheeKim
description: Great shoe! If you can - get the solid rubber version as it offers slightly improved traction.

name: PureKicks
description: I am really happy with the Crazy Explosive 2017. Crazy comfortable, great cushioning and traction.

name: Schwollo
description: I think most players will enjoy the Crazy Explosive 2017 because it does everything well if not great and really gives the player an excellent one to one fit with a low to ground yet well cushioned ride.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I prefer the 2016 version over the Crazy Explosive 2017. The traction is identical, cushioning is a lot firmer and less plush, lockdown and support are a little better and the materials are a lot stiffer and less comfortable. Overall, still a very solid shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: This shoe is pretty nice and works well for guards who need a responsive shoe. Feels a little like a low-top Kyrie 2 with nicer materials and worse traction.

name: KickGenius
description: Overall this is a solid shoe that has signature model-like qualities at a retail price of $100 - you can't really beat that!

name: PureKicks
description: Overall, this is a pretty good shoe. Nothing crazy, but very good value for the money!

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: While the Nike Zoom Shift is aesthetically pleasing, the inconsistent traction and the brick-like cushion makes the shoe very unpleasant on-court.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the Nike Lebron Soldier 11 is the bomb, I love it! I have no complaints about it whatsoever. This shoe jumped up to #2 on my rotation, that's how much I liked it.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: While traction could still use a little bit of work, the cushion is immensely better than the last go-around. Suitable for every position on the floor and a great option for players than want a little bit of everything with their on-court shoes.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: A well-rounded shoe that provides a ton of support and lockdown. Traction is decent. Not recommended for shifty guards because it feels a little bulky, but a very good shoe for bigger players who value impact protection, lockdown and support.

name: Schwollo
description: Although the Soldier XI doesnt do anything extremely well, its a very solid shoe all the way around.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The LeBron Soldier 11 in many ways is just the LeBron Soldier 10.1. Thats really not a bad thing though, as the Soldier 10 was a great shoe, and the 11 improves on almost every aspect of its design with very minimal compromise.

name: KickGenius
description: Good for what it does, doesn't quite get the Kick Genius stamp of approval but definitely gets the job done. The best Lebron Soldier I ever played in for sure.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike LeBron Soldier 11 is a very versatile sneaker. Any guard or slashing forward will find something that they like. It is a solid option both indoors and on the black top, yet it isnt quite elite. Had Nike went all out on the cushioning and made it a little more stable, it would have easily been a top-tier performer.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: It's a really, really solid shoe. I loved the cushioning and responsiveness, the support and lockdown were really solid, but traction was very inconsistent. Not my go-to shoes but definitely in the rotation.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall the shoe is very similar to the KD 9. I like the firmer cushioning, the soft and flexible upper, but the support could be better.

name: PureKicks
description: The KD10 is a great shoe overall but there are some downfalls like the lacking of lateral support.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I like the shoe a lot! If you are not looking to do heavy lateral cuts or be really shifty then this is a great shoe! Very comfortable fit and great cushion make these perfect when you want to give your legs some extra comfort.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Compared to the KD9, the Zoom is toned down, for good and bad. The materials are definitely improved. The looks  lets face it, this is a beautiful shoe. But the traction slid a little and the overall playability seemed a step back from the KD9.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The KD10 just misses being a great shoe due to minor flaws in construction and traction  but they dont deter it from being a good performance shoe.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: Overall, the KD10 is a decent shoe, it just not as good as the KD9.

name: RicheeKim
description: Overall, this is a good shoe. Unfortunately, traction and support keep it from being great.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike KD 9 was an amazing shoe. The Nike KD 10 was almost an amazing shoe. It looks amazing, but it suffered in a few areas due to the bold new design.

name: KickGenius
description: Overall the KD 10 performs solid in all categories. There is nothing phenomenal but on the flip side there is also nothing bad.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Is the Curry 3ZER0 leaps and bounds better than the Curry 3? No. However, the cushion feels more refined and offers a better balance between stability and protection.  If youre a guard or a shooter and plan on trying out the Curry 3ZER0 I think youll be pleasantly surprised.

name: Schwollo
description: Out of the three Curry models released this year, Id put the Low first, the 3Zero slightly behind at second and then the Mid. The Curry 3 Zero is a more minimal shoe that doesn't rely on bells and whistles or tech mumbo-jumbo, which I personally enjoy.

name: RicheeKim
description: For a $120 this is not a bad shoe! Really good on-court performer and I like the fit much better compared to the original Curry 3. I just wish they hadn't downgraded the material from Threadborne to Mesh.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: The SC 3Zero is a solid second line shoe. Overall, I wasn't a big fan of the new cushioning setup and the inconsistent traction. However, I did like the improved ankle support.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Just like the Curry 3, nothing special. I wasn't happy with the fit and the traction. Let's hope for an improved Curry 4.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The ANTA KT Outdoor 2 Low is a very good hoop shoe that offers a little bit of everything  court feel, semi-plush cushioning, durable traction that works on a variety of surfaces, and materials that are very much in line with what other brands are offering.

name: Analykix.com
description: The Anta KT Outdoor 2 Low is a solid shoe. It's very light, has good impact protection and superb traction. I highly recommend this shoe for hoopers who love to play in both indoor and outdoor courts.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I was really impressed with this shoes, especially at $80! This will be my go-to outdoor shoe.

name: KickGenius
description: I think this is a very good shoe. Great traction, nice materials and an outstanding fit (for narrow feet). This is a BIG upgrade over the original Kobe AD

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The NXT version of the Kobe A.D. has much more in common with the Kobe 11 than with the ori

name: Schwollo
description: It is just a well-rounded performer with great traction, fun cushioning, excellent fit and stability and decent containment. These edge out the Curry 3 Low for my favorite of 2017.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $200 this shoe is a no-go. Disregarding the price, the Kobe AD NXT is a really good performer.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The Kobe AD NXT has some exciting high points and I truly enjoyed playing in these thanks to the fantastic upper comfort. Unfortunately, at $200 this is the most expensive basketball shoe model in the 2017 Nike lineup. There are far better values out there.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: User didn't add a summary.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: At $110 these are by far the best value performance basketball shoes available right now.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: The Nike PG 1 features a consistent traction experience that holds up on a wide variety of court conditions as well as a decent cushion setup that favors quick, low to the ground players. At $110, its worth a shot right?

name: KickGenius
description: Overall I thought that shoe performed great! It's my go-to shoe right now and I will be hooping in them for a while!

name: RicheeKim
description: For $110, I can absolutely recommend these shoes.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The PG1 performs on a level that far exceeds its relatively low price tag.  Its cushioning and stability are top-notch, making it my favorite Nike of the season at any price.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: I will say that the Nike PG1 is very good if youre looking for a shoe that feels like an extension of your foot without breaking the bank.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The PG1 is a wonderful shoe to play in, as long as you dont have wide feet and you can get your foot into the shoe. For a first signature model and its $110 price point, I think the shoe is fantastic.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really like to play in the Nike PG1. Cushion and fit are nice and the traction gets good after breaking them in.  At $110 they are a real steal!

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: For only $110 it  is a very, very good performance basketball sneaker.  You won't worry about sliding around, slipping on the floor, or the lockdown of the shoe. A

name: Schwollo
description: Overall, the PG1 is a great start to a new signature shoe, far better than the Kyrie 1 in my opinion. Cushioning isnt the best or very fun but it works fine while  the rest of the shoe performs very well.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: When it comes to performance the KD9 Elite is very similar to the original KD9. The most notable difference is the strong lacing cables which slightly enhance support and lockdown. However, this new lacing setup also makes the shoe even narrower which led to some pain on the side of my feet.

name: KickGenius
description: A great shoe with slight improvements over the original KD9. The upper material is softer and more comfortable and the new lacing system provides more lockdown and support.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: It's a very specific shoe. Great if you have narrow feet and you are looking for a shoe with a lot of cushion and impact protection. If you are a shifty guard who does a lot of crossovers and cuts then the lacking support of the upper and the slightly unstable platform are not ideal. Not recommended if you have wide feet.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: The traction, cushion, and materials all bring out the best of Nikes technology, unfortunately, the KD 9 Elite doesn't perform as well when it comes to support and fit.

name: Another Pair [weartesters.com]
description: At a retail price of $120, the Jordan Ultra Fly offers great bang for the buck.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: This is the first Jordan Brand performance model Ive bought in a long time that doesnt make me feel like I was ripped off.

name: KickGenius
description: For $125 this is a great performer. I don't feel like the Ultra Fly series gets enough respect. Heel and forefoot Zoom, mesh upper, nice traction - I can't ask for much more.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Charged Controller is quick, low-riding, well-cushioned but not super soft, with a locked-in fit just stable enough to make me feel bulletproof.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Under Armour Charged Controller is a fantastic shoe. It rides low, is responsive, locks you in and keeps you stable to do battle on the hardwood.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: When you take price out of the equation and put the Charged Controller up against some of the top-tier performers on the market today, it doesnt quite belong in that group. But right below it? Absolutely. Oh, and did we mentioned that the shoe is only $100?

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall, a solid shoe. Nothing super spectacular, but also no deal breakers. I wasn't happy with the traction and the cushioning wore out pretty quickly.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Even at a $100 bucks, we don't recommend this shoe. There are many other shoes out there that provide far better value.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I didn't like the Melo M13. As a guard, don't get these! The cushioning and the materials are good, but the traction was a dealbreaker for me.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Nice try, but not quite. Felled by traction and support, the Melo M13 had potential.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: An improvement over the last year, but I didn't like the clunkiness of the transition and the $175 price tag is pretty steep.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: Ultimately, the things I like about the 14 overshadow those that I dont. Because of that, I thoroughly enjoyed playing in it.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The LeBron 14 isnt perfect, but no shoe is. Impact protection and overall mobility are great, traction wasn't bad either.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: I value impact protection heavily, therefore, they are one of the best sneakers available right now.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The overall court feel, transition, cushioning, and clean-floor traction make the LeBron 14 feel fast and smooth to play in.

name: Schwollo
description: I consider the Lebron XIV one of the most comfortable but under performing Lebrons Ive ever worn. Great cushioning and soft materials can only cover flaws to a certain extent.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: As a guard, I did not enjoy the shoe. But for big guys this should be a great shoe.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: As a guard, I don't like playing in these very much. Slightly bulky, and higher off the ground than I prefer. It's definitely a decent shoe, but it just wasn't for me.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: If youre looking for a cloud-like ride, with great materials and a glove-like fit, the Zoom Rev 17 is going to get the job done really well.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Zoom Rev 17 is an extremely solid option for someone looking for quickness, forefoot cushioning while still riding low, and a great fit.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: A really nice shoe, I enjoyed playing in it a lot. This should have been the Kyrie 3. Guards - you will love it!

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Taking the $100 price tag out of the equation, the Nike Zoom Live 2017 stands up against Nikes higher priced models and outshines them. If youre a fan of low tops then youll likely be a fan of these.

name: Schwollo
description: This is my first pass at the Mentality, I mean Instinct line and I am pleasantly surprised. I had a hard time differentiating performance wise between the Kobe 8; both sit low to the ground with excellent traction and fit.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: At $100 you can't go wrong! A very minimal and responsive shoe for guards who don't need a lot of impact protection.

name: Analykix.com
description: I really enjoyed playing in the Nike Mamba Mentality. You get to enjoy a Flyweave upper and a full-length Lunarlon midsole which is perfect for all-around players.

name: RicheeKim
description: If you are a quick guard and you don't need a lot of impact protection then the Kyrie 3 is a great choice.

name: KickGenius
description: Probably my favorite shoe to hoop in right now!

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really love to play in them, but I can't play a lot because of the lack of cushioning. Incredibly responsive shoe with excellent traction.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Surprisingly enough, I enjoyed playing in the Kyrie 3,  If cushion is your main need then you should already know what that means for you and the Kyrie 3. But if court feel and traction are your only concerns then these might be your new best friend.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Decent, affordable shoe, especially if you are a small guard. Personally I didn't really like these shoes but at $120 they are definitely a decent performer.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: The Kyrie 3 is a solid shoe, but I cant help but feel a bit disappointed. And this admittedly comes from the high expectations I had after liking the first two shoes so much. But from the design, to the cushioning, to the comfort, its just not what Id hoped for.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: Overall, I like the Kyrie 3 but I am not crazy about it. Not in my top-3 rotation, but a good sneaker with a fair price. Especially quick guards will like the traction and court feel.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: I did thoroughly enjoy the shoe, particularly the materials and the traction. It's such a minimalistic shoe that Nike almost had everything working in unison -- almost. More cushion is definitely a much-needed necessity and a well thought out execution with support would suffice. This is a shoe for players that cut heavily, need minimalistic cushion, and rely on that court-feel.

name: Schwollo
description: Not the best value out there but a good performer overall...The Kyrie 3 just feels like a quick high cut tennis shoe for players that value lateral quickness over everything else.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The adidas Harden Vol. 1 is a very well balanced shoe for guards. Traction, cushion, materials, fit, supportthe best of what adidas has to offer all on one sneaker? Reasonably priced? And theyve been doing this all year long? You best believe it.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you are a guard, or forward, or big man who doesnt mind lows, you will enjoy this shoe. Fit, cushion, traction, and support are all nice for anyone unless you just feel like you need a super-light shoe (you dont).

name: The Sole Brothers
description: The fit is good, the traction is amazing. The shoe feels light, and the cushion is very responsive. The Harden Vol. 1 is a very good shoe and does live up to the reputation James Harden has as a talented and explosive player.

name: RicheeKim
description: These are my favourite shoes as of right now!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I like the cushioning, traction and materials, but I had sharp pain in the toe area and the lacing system is trash. Overall the Harden 1 is a pretty solid performance sneaker.

name: Schwollo
description: The Harden Vol 1 is one of those shoes I like a lot. Its tech is great, it looks good, its made well and it isnt too expensive. However, Adidas ruined an excellent traction set up with the Fibonacci design and as a traction lover, this did the shoe in for me. Well that and my arch pain.

name: KickGenius
description: Overall, the shoe gets the job done. There's nothing special here, the shoe is a decent performer, but the traction threw me for a slip.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: The fit was a little bit off, but I'd probably give those a 7/10. It's a great option for guards who are looking for traction and court feel.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: The Dame 3 combines great cushioning, good traction, killer materials, and a price that cant be beat  into a package that, honestly, looks great too.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The adidas Dame 3 is a great sneaker. Its very well rounded in every category and it will accommodate most players and foot shapes. From the traction, to the plush and bouncy cushion, to the materials that balance durability without the need for break-in time  the adidas Dame 3 has it all.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, it's a really, really nice shoe. The cushion is nice, the traction is good but not the best on dusty courts and the materials are good. The only two things I didn't like are that the shoe feels slightly bulky especially in the heel and the lockdown is not very good.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: Overall, this is a pretty solid hoops shoe, especially for the sticker price it goes for. You got great traction and cushioning, good support and lockdown and solid materials. Unfortunately the fit isn't very comfortable.

name: Schwollo
description: The improved traction really got me excited and I liked the faster feel of the Dame 3 cushioning. However, the lack of padding at the midfoot and especially around the ankle really made the lace pressure uncomfortable.  I feel like the Dame 3 is one of those shoes that performs well in every catagory but just under performs as a shoe overall.

name: KickGenius
description: Overall, I would probably still go with the D Lillard 2 over the Dame 3. But the Dame 3 isn't bad at all and gets the job done. Most people will enjoy this shoe, especially once you found a lacing pattern that is comfortable for you.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I love everything about the Kobe AD except the painful break-in period. The overall aesthetics are great, the cushion is on point, the lockdown is there. The shoe is lightweight but still supportive and sturdy.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Very good looking shoes for guards. I enjoy it, I really like the shoe. Unfortunately rather long break-in period.

name: Schwollo
description: I enjoyed playing in the Kobe AD a lot even though it wasnt perfect. Great traction and excellent fit with firmer than normal Kobe line cushioning that needs break in but feels decent after. When you see the price of $160, youll expect more since other comparative shoes out there under that price point are offering nicer materials than the mesh on the Kobe AD.

name: RicheeKim
description: For $160 there are much better options out there. Great lockdown, but painful break-in period, cheap materials and lacking cushioning.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Utter disappointment. Was I duped? $160 spent and wasted. Those are my feelings when thinking about the Nike Kobe A.D. If you enjoy your pair then I am genuinely happy for you as that would mean you enjoy your purchase and dont share the same sentiment that I do. Every once in a while a brand puts out a dud. This was a giant one.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: To put it bluntly, the Kobe A.D. has no innovation, no ambition, and nothing worthy enough to be associated with the five-time world champion, 18-time All-Star, 15-time All-NBA, future Hall of Famer, Kobe Bryant. The visual appeal of Kobes first post-retirement sneaker is off the charts but this is a performance review, and in that regard, the Kobe A.D. is more than just a disappointment.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Tacky traction, much-improved cushion and very comfortable. The KT2 has enough of everything to make them a great option on-court, and it comes in at a reasonable price as well.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: For $120 this is a great deal. The Anta KT2 is really amazing to play basketball in. I have no complaints at all - I love it!

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: High-quality materials, great cushioning and phenomenal traction. The Anta KT2 were my first Chinese sneakers and I really enjoyed them on-court!

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: The Rare Metal gives you premium materials, great cushioning, and damn near great traction.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: If you are looking for a highly cushioned, low profile and low-cut rocket for your feet, especially on clean courts, then the Rare Metal is your pick.

name: Schwollo
description: The Rare Metal is a shoe that does nearly everything well. If the traction was more consistent and more aggressive, I wouldnt hesitate to put this into my rotation maybe even into my top 5.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I was really disappointed by the traction - otherwise this is a great shoe. If you play on clean courts, then the BrandBlack Rare Metal is a great choice.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: The Curry 3 is a great shoe on-court. Especially speedy guards will enjoy their time in these. If youre a fan of the Curry 1 and 2 then youll likely love the 3.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I rank the Curry 3 above the Curry 2 and the Curry 2.5 but only by a very slim margin. There are some improvements, but overall the shoe performs very similar.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: You get great traction, Charged cushioning, and great lockdown after a short break in. If you are looking for a quick response and death-grip sticky soles, look no further.

name: Jarron Ramos [weartesters.com]
description: Steph obviously values traction and light-weight support and the Curry 3 gives you exactly that. The cushion setup is highly responsive but delivers only average impact protection.  To me, the Curry 3 falls just short of being a top-tier on-court performer.

name: Analykix.com
description: Am I happy with how the shoe performed? Yes. Would I recommend it? Yes!

name: KickGenius
description: Overall, I really enjoyed the Curry 3 and hooped in them a lot. They definitely got the job done! I really expect a lot from Under Armour going forward!

name: Schwollo
description: The Curry 3 is a solid and smooth shoe that performs well in every category but nothing outstanding. Slightly softer cushioning than the Curry 2/2.5 and softer materials but not an upgrade overall.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: I really enjoyed the shoe. The traction in dusty conditions was a little lackluster. Other than that, it's a really nice shoe with amazing materials, good support and decent cushioning.

name: RicheeKim
description: The Curry 3 is a good performer on the court. I recommend these if you like firm and responsive cushioning.

name: QuickKicks [weartesters.com]
description: Despite the great build quality and solid materials, the Curry 3 is a shoe that didnt work for my play style. If youre a fast-paced guard that loves court feel (like Steph Curry himself) youll probably enjoy this shoe. However, more explosive players and those who need more impact protection should probably look elsewhere.

name: Stanley T. [weartesters.com]
description: Does the shoe perform? It absolutely does. I do like how the shoe adapts to my movements while providing adequate lockdown and support. The cushion feels fine but I was expecting something totally different or new, and the traction has its suspect points.

name: KickGenius
description: I wasn't impressed by the Air Jordan 31 because the traction really holds them back. Other then that it is a pretty solid shoe and get's the job done.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: Ive come to expect the best from the modern Air Jordan line when it comes to performance, and the Air Jordan 31 fully delivers. There are a few matters of personal preference, but overall, there is little to criticize.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: I did like the super soft woven upper and the responsive cushion.But inconsistent traction and pain in the heel from the achilles padding keep this shoe from being in my regular rotation.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: Each piece of the shoe is great. Put them together and its not a perfect match. The biggest issue to tackle is how to get full length unlocked Zoom to be more stable underfoot.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: These shoes are absolutely incredible - aside from the catastrophic failure that is the traction. I can't play in these because the traction is literally dangerous.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: Overall, my opinion of the Air Jordan 31 is really mixed. Definitely a drop-off from previous models, but still a solid performance sneaker.

name: Duke4005 [weartesters.com]
description: Best. KD. EVER. Seriously. Besides a little less support than some need, there are no problems with this shoe. Traction  excellent. Cushioning  beyond excellent. Materials  the best Nike has to offer.

name: The Sole Brothers
description: Overall, definitely get these. The cushioning feels really nice, the traction is good and the materials are super premium.

name: Nelson Chan @Hoop and Life
description: At $150 the KD9 is a good deal considering the great performance it delivers.

name: MR FOAMER SIMPSON
description: I think this is the best overall sneaker out right now.  A very versatile shoe that works for all type of players.

name: KickGenius
description: The shoe gets the job done and performs very well. Unfortunately, the upper material is not very comfortable and the price is a little too high for what you get.

name: NightWing2303 [weartesters.com]
description: You receive solid traction, fantastic cushion, great materials, and if you get the size that fits you best, youll also receive a solid and secure fit for optimal support.

name: Schwollo
description: The KD 9 is a shoe everyone will enjoy, mainly because the fit, comfort and cushioning is amazing right out of the box. However, I need a little more support, containment, and traction during competitive play.

name: Zac Dubasik [SoleCollector.com]
description: As a performance sneaker, it just didnt work for me. Above all else, the one thing I need to have in a shoe is confidence, and I didnt have it in the KD 9.
